loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita arrendar dos manzanas de terreno para poder cultivar en el próximo año, con esto estará seguro para continuar realizando la labor de agricultura.

Él considera que trabajar con préstamos le ha permitido, tener más capacidad para realizar los cultivos, la producción ha sido abundante, en su familia todos se encuentran bien, su capacidad económica ha aumentado para cubrir lo necesario en el hogar.
texts.en:
José decided to seek a new loan because he needs to rent two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of land to be able to farm in the next year. With this, he will be certain to continue to do agricultural work.

He feels that working with loans has permitted him to have a greater capacity for growing crops. The production has been abundant. Everyone in his family is well. His economic capacity has increased to cover the necessities of his household.

loans.use: to rent two manzanas (about 3.5 acres) of land

loans.name: Hersan  Jose

texts.es:
Hersan, 27 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 5 y 1 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante. Inicio su actividad laboral motivado por su papa quien es mecánico automotriz, luego decidió estudiar cursos para ampliar sus conocimientos y asi poder administrar su propio negocio, de esta manera hoy en día ha ido haciéndole mejoras al local, además de este  negocio  tiene otro, los fines de semana se dedica  a  la venta de ropa que la vende en Ticuantepe, el cual le genera muchos ingresos.
Hersan esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar accesorios eléctrico como, luces para vehículo, grasas, lija, alambre para vehículos, etc. Toda la materia prima que necesita para su taller de mecánico, ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudara a crecer en su negocio, porque asi  podrá invertir en productos mas solicitado por el cliente, sus planes futuros es ampliar el negocio, su meta próxima es poder ir a legalizar su negocio en la Alcaldía, para tener mejores oportunidades de ventas.
texts.en:
Hersan, 27, was born in Managua and is married and has two children, ages 5 and 1. He runs a business which is inspired by his father's work as an auto mechanic. Hersan took training courses and is now managing his business and renovating his facilities. On weekends, he has another business selling clothing in Ticuantepe that generates substantial income.

Hersan is applying for a loan to buy auto accessories and parts like lights, grease, sandpaper, wire, and all the supplies he needs for his repair shop. He believes this loan will help him grow his business and invest in products his customers want. His plan is to grow the business, and his goal is to register it with the municipality to have better sales opportunities.

loans.use: to buy auto accessories and parts like lights, grease, sandpaper, wire, and more.

loans.name: Erika Ismenia

texts.es:
Erika, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para poder invertir en la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, con el dinero pagara mozos, para que saquen la cosecha y tambien alquilara una maquina desgranadora para preparar el maíz.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo que le ayudo para generar ingresos de la siembra, con esto ha podido comprar alimentación y herramientas, en sus condiciones económicas tiene una mayor capacidad para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Erika decided to take a new loan in order to be able to invest in the harvest of basic grains. With the money she will pay workers to harvest the crop and also rent a shelling machine to prepare the corn. 

With the previous loan she had a positive effect that helped her to generate income from planting. With this money she has been able to buy food and tools. In her economic conditions she has a greater capacity to keep working.

loans.use: to pay workers, and to rent a sheller machine.

loans.name: Sagrario Del Rosario

texts.es:
Sagrario, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito, para la temporada de fiestas de fin de año, con lo que logra realizar mejores ventas porque la demanda aumenta, se comprara cocos, leche, melocotón.

Ella considera que con los prestamos ha mejorado su estabilidad económica, ha mejorado su negocio y las ventas, en este tiempo ella ha comprado carretones para la venta de sorbetes, esta prosperando económicamente, también comenta que logro comprarse en este periodo un vehículo.
texts.en: Sagrario decided to apply for a new loan for the year-end holiday season. By buying coconuts, milk, and peaches now, she can increase her sales because demand is high. She believes her loans have improved her financial situation and increased her sales. She has purchased carts to sell sherbert and is prospering. She also says she was able to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, milk, and peaches.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en la recolección de la cosecha de granos básicos, ya que tiene que pagar mano de obra y una maquina desgranadora de maíz, esto le ayudara a tener la cosecha lista para el consumo.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue un aumento en la productividad con lo que ha podido vender y generar ingresos que le ayudan a la alimentación de la familia, gracias a los créditos  está mejorando sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
José decided to seek a new loan because he needs to invest in collecting his harvest of basic foods, since he has to pay for labor and a corn shelling machine. This will help him to have his harvest ready for consumption.

The result that he had from the previous loan was an increase in productivity, with which he was able to make sales and generate income that helped him to feed his family. Thanks to the loans, he is improving his economic condition.

loans.use: to pay for labor and a corn shelling machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, canned food, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Reina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, solo vive con su esposo quien también trabaja, este trabajo lo inicio como una fuente de ingresos para cubrir sus gastos, inicia su labor todos los días de 8.00am a 5:00pm, además de las pupusas también vende tostadas y refrescos,
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, quesillo, plátanos, condimentos, que son necesarios para realizar la preparación de la venta, este préstamo le ayudara a realizar la compra de productos para mejorar las ventas.
La aspiración de ella es mejorar la calidad de vida, mantener su negocio estable para contar con los ingresos necesarios.
texts.en: Reina sells pupusas, filled tortillas, and has no dependent children. She lives with her husband, who also works. She started her business to have an income source to pay expenses, and she works every day from 8.00am until 5:00pm. She also sells tacos and sodas. She is applying for a loan to buy corn, soft cheese, plantains, and the spices needed to prepare her foods. The loan will allow her to buy ingredients to increase sales. Her dream is to improve her quality of life and keep her business going because her income depends on it.

loans.use: to buy corn, soft cheese, plantains, and spices.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
Julia con 37 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 10, 17 y 19 años respectivamente, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio su actividad laboral  lavando y planchando  a domicilio,  al igual que muchas  otras personas  buscan como ganarse la vida  y salir adelante con su familia, trabajan en el comercio informal. Luego ella decidí emprender otro negocio como es la venta de frutas y verduras, de forma ambulante, ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, sus expectativas es incrementar sus ventas para comprar por mayor sus verduras.
Julia solicita el financiamiento para comprar  plátanos, cebolla, papa, naranja, limón y melón etc. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar más producto que aun no tiene en existencias, sus  planes  futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio para salir a vender mas variedad de frutas en todo el mercado, de esta manera ella lograría  incrementar sus ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias y lograr alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia, who is a native of Granada, is the mother of three children, ages 10, 17, and 19. She is a merchant. She began her working life washing and ironing at home. Like many other people seeking to earn a living and get ahead with their families, she worked in informal commerce. Then she decided to begin another business, selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor. She has the support of her children. Her goal is to increase her sales so that she can buy her vegetables wholesale.

Julia is applying for a loan to buy bananas, onions, potatoes, oranges, lemons, melons, etc. Since she estimates that this loan will help her to buy more products that she doesn't yet have in stock, her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her business so that she can go out to sell a greater variety of fruits all over the market. In this way she would manage to increase her sales and thus obtain better earnings and achieve a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, potatoes, oranges, lemons, melons, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Juan

texts.es:
Pedro, es electricista, vive con su esposa y los hijos de 3 y 10 años de edad en aprendió este oficio su familia y trabaja independientemente, no tiene horario exacto hasta el momento no ha tenído ninguna dificultad para realizar su trabajo desde hace 15 años.

Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales eléctricos como cables, tenazas, cinturón, y otros que son indispensables para realizar su trabajo con él cuidado adecuado, esto le ayudará a tener todo el equipo propio.

Los sueños de él es llegar a obtener contratos en el área de electricidad ya que esto le permitirá tener una mejor estabilidad económica para ayudar a su familia
texts.en:
Pedro is an electrician. He lives with his wife and his children, ages 3 and 10. He learned this trade from his family and works independently. He does not have an exact schedule, but for 15 years and up to now he has not had any difficulty doing his work.

He is applying for a loan to buy electrical materials such as wires, pliers, a belt, and other items that are indispensable for doing his work. With suitable care, this will help him to have all his own equipment.

His dream is to obtain contracts for electrical work, since this would allow him to have more stable income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy wires, pliers, and a belt

loans.name: Las Ovejitas 1 Group

texts.en:
Jesucita is the coordinator of her group, Las Ovejitas (The little lambs) group 1a. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Jesucita is the mother of three children and makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her three children.

Jesucita is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Esperanza and by the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, a little restaurant called Comedor, where she prepares lunch for people in her community. Jesucita will purchase goods for cooking such as rice, beans, meat, and cooking oil, as well as disposables to serve at lunch. She will use the profits to invest in her business by rebuilding the structure, for a more comfortable a nice look. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, meat, and cooking oil and other goods to cook.

loans.name: La Unidad 1 Group

texts.en:
Justa is the group coordinator for La Unidad (the Unite) 1. This group is composed of five women entrepreneurs. 

Justa lives in a rural area near the city of Hato Mayor, a city surrounded by rural areas, because of her agricultural activities. She is a single mother with five children. Justa is receiving her fifth loan and she is very excited. She started her business almost four years ago with her own savings.

Justa sells charcoal, fruit, meat, and vegetables at her stand in front of her home. She would like to continue expanding her business by adding more products. She will use this loan to buy charcoal, fruit, vegetables, chicken, and beef. 

She likes to work and to do business. Justa will use her business profits to expand her business into a grocery store. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy charcoal, fruit, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Ileana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ileana, 58 años de edad, originaria de Managua, soltera, madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante.  Inicio su negocio de pulpería  con capital propio  hace 4 años,  lo hizo con ayuda de su esposo en ese momento, luego el esposo la dejo sola con el negocio, fue allí que  decidió seguir con el negocio de pulpería, al notar que su pulpería necesitaba mas capital decidió pedir pequeños prestamos a las instituciones financieras para incrementar sus ventas, además de su pulpería, ella realiza otra labor, trabaja como profesora en una escuela, el cual le genera ingresos extra.
Solicita el financiamiento para comprar toda la mercadería en general  tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pollo, gaseosa y lácteos. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a crecer en inventario comprando productos que aun no tiene en existencia, ya que se acerca la temporada navideña en donde la demanda de sus productos aumentan, sus planes futuros es ampliar el negocio comprando ropa y zapatos, su meta próxima es tener un puesto de esquimo.
texts.en:
Ileana is 58 years old, from Managua, single, the mother of 5 adult children, and a merchant. She started her small grocery store business with her own capital 4 years ago, with the help of her husband at the time. Her husband later left her alone with the business, but she decided to keep the grocery store business going. Noting that the grocery store needed more capital, she decided to ask for small loans from financial institutions to increase her sales. In addition to her small grocery store, she has another job: she works as a teacher at a school, which generates extra income. 

She asks for the financing to buy all of the general merchandise, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, soda and dairy products. She estimates that this loan will help her to grow her inventory by buying products that she doesn't yet stock. As the Christmas season is approaching, when the demand for her products increase, her future plans are to expand her business by buying clothing and shoes. Her next goal is to carry Eskimo ice creams.

loans.use: to buy all of the general merchandise, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, soda and dairy products.

loans.name: Daisy's Group

texts.en:
Daisy is one of the members of the M.H 3 group. Group members are entrepreneurs dedicated to clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoe sales, food sales, sales of underwear, etc. in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities, where the economy depends on agriculture.

Daisy is the mother of four children. Her long-term partner and she have raised their children with many sacrifices and much effort. She started her business almost five years ago with her first loan from Esperanza. She is getting her ninth loan. Her previous loan was repaid satisfactorily, and she has made some good investments. She currently operates a business selling underwear.

Daisy is planning to invest the money from the new loan in underwear for children, women, and men. She will use her profits to finish building her house, which she has been building little by little. Her main challenge is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Unidas para Triunfar 2 (Unite to win). This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. She is the mother of two children and makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Santa is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza and by the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She is running a hot dog cart in front of her house. She sells the food for dinner time. 

Santa will use this loan to purchase sausages, bread, soda, ketchup, and other ingredients to make the food taste delicious. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to support her family’s needs. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, sausages, bread, and other goods.

loans.name: Shalom 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucia is the coordinator of the group "Shalom 2," named like this in honor to the biblical word. This group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes five micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc.

Lucia's family includes herself, her long-term partner and two children from the six they have. She is very excited to receive her 11th loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly repaid her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about five years. She started it when she took her first loan.

Lucia plans to invest her new loan in her business. She is running a cafeteria, where she sells sandwiches, juice and other snack food. She will invest this loan to purchase goods for sandwiches, hot dogs, natural juices, fried food and other snack food. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, bread, salad, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esperanza con 37 años de edad, originaria  de Granada, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos, actualmente  2 de ellos  están estudiando su primaria, y su hijo mayor trabaja en una carpintería. Ella inicio a trabajar desde muy joven con su mama en el negocio de venta de pan, pero luego la mama se retiro del negocio  y decidió dejárselo a ella, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 20 años, ya que este ha sido  su único negocio, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mama y su compañero de vida, además de este negocio, tiene otro como es una pequeña mini pulpería, la que le genera ingresos extras.
En esta ocasión Esperanza requiere el financiamiento para comprar  más  ropa variada como faldas, vestido, blusas, etc. Ella considera que al tener más productos en inventario podrá satisfacer las  necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuros es poder incrementar las ventas  para obtener mejores ganancias y de esta manera poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, sus metas próxima es diversificar su negocio con otros productos que aun no tiene en existencia.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 37 years old, is a native of Granada. She has a partner and is the mother of three children. Currently two of her children are in primary school and her oldest son  works in a carpentry shop.

Esperanza started working when she was very young selling bread with her mother. Then her mother retired and left the business to her and she has been the proprietor for more than 20 years. This had been her mother’s only business and Esperanza continues to rely on her and her life companion for help.  In addition to this business she has another one, a small mini-store, which generates additional income.

At this time, Esperanza needs funding to purchase more clothing, such as skirts, dresses, blouses, etc. She feels that having more products in her inventory will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers. Her future plans are to increase sales in order to obtain more profit so that she can provide a better future for her children.  Her next goal is to diversify her business with other products that she currently does not have in stock.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing, such as skirts, dresses, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maritza, 56 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casada, tiene 2 hijos de  17 y 33 años, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Inicio con 25 libras de maseca, elaborando  tortillas en su casa hace 3  años, luego miro que el negocio era muy rentable porque le generaba muchas ganancias, de  esta  manera el decidió comprar maquinas para la hacer  sus tortillas, en su negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y una persona que le ayuda a distribuir sus tortillas en los diferentes barrios de Managua, a los cuales le paga mano de obra.
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar toda la materia prima que necesita como maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, aceite, panas, etc. para la elaboración de sus tortillas, ya que ella estima que este préstamo  le será de mucho ayuda  porque asi podrá incrementar sus ventas comprando productos que aun no tiene en existencias, sus planes futuros es aumentar el volumen de su producción, elaborando y vendiendo productos adicionales, como queso, cuajadas. Su meta próxima es ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 56 years old, from Managua, married, and has 2 children that are 17 and 33 years old. As a merchant she makes a living by selling tortillas. She began with 25 pounds of dough, making tortillas in her house for the last three years. Then she saw that the business was very profitable as it generated a lot of income. She therefore decided to buy machines to make her tortillas. In her business she counts on the support of her son and a person that helps her to distribute her tortillas in different neighborhoods of Managua, and she pays them for their labor.

She is asking for the loan to buy all the raw materials she needs for making her tortillas like corn, lime, firewood, bags, oil, trays, etc. She estimates that this loan will help her a lot because she will be able to increase her sales by buying products that she doesn't yet stock. Her future plans are to increase the volume of her production, making and selling additional products like cheese and curds. Her immediate goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy all the raw materials she needs, like corn, lime, firewood, bags, oil, trays, etc.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es: Doña Gladis tiene 35 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Girasol, es casada y madre de tres hijos, su esposo es jornalero, son una familia muy trabajadora y honesta, residen en la aldea tepusteca, Olanchito, Yoro. Doña Gladis Comenzó su negocio desde hace 14 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías lo cual aprendió del oficio porque saco un curso en INFOP y también que su madre se dedicaba a la fabricación de manualidades, su horario de atención inicia desde las 8:00 am y culmina a las 6:00 pm, su ventaja es que tiene muy buena clientela. El préstamo que doña Gladis solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para fabricar sus manualidades. Con el apoyo de este préstamo su vida cambiaria ya que tendrá material disponible para fabricar sus productos y así podrá tener mayores ganancias para ayudar al sustento familiar. Su sueño es tener éxito en su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Es el segundo crédito que doña Gladis recibe en FAMA y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien al cancelar sus cuotas
texts.en:
Gladis, 35, is a member of the group Solidario Girasol (Sunflower Solidarity). She is married and the mother of three children, her husband is a laborer; they are a very hardworking and honest family living in the village of Tepusteca, Olanchito, Yoro. 

Gladis started her business 14 years ago; she makes handicrafts which she learned how to do from taking a course in INFOP and also from her mother who was engaged in the manufacture of handicrafts. Her hours of operation start at 8:00 am and end at 6:00 pm, her advantage being that she has very good customers. 

Gladis needs the requested loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials to manufacture her handicrafts. With the help of this loan, her life will change now that she will have the material available to create her products and thus have a better income to help support her family. Her dream is to succeed in her business and that her children become professionals. This is the second loan that Gladis is getting from FAMA and thankfully, she has done very well with making her payments.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Los Excelentes 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is receiving her sixth loan and will invest it to buy different underwear for wholesale, and she will also she buy clothes. 

This group has been paid well. This is the reason why they are getting another loan to be invested in Christmas sales. Francisca and her group thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad, tiene 27 años de edad, está casado, vive con su esposa y un hijo de tres años de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, trabaja en la ganadería, esto lo aprendió con sus padres, realizando el cultivo en dos manzanas de tierra. 
Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono y preparación de la tierra, esta compra le ayudara para incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más ingresos.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es fortalecer mas el negocio y ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Natividad is 27, he is married, lives with his wife and three year old son, he grows basic grains, he works with cattle, he learned this from his parents, growing crops in 3 acres of land.  Natividad requests a loan to buy agricultural inputs like seed, fertilizer to prepare the land, this purchase will help him increase inventory and obtain more income.
His goal with the loan is to strengthen his business and offer better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and prepare the land.

loans.name: Miguel Ramon

texts.es: Miguel, habitante de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, de oficio comerciante se dedica a vender ropa usada, padre de tres hijos , de 8 , 12 y 1 año de edad respectivamente. El empezó con la venta de ropa de manera ambulante hace 6 años, tenía pocos ahorros los cuales invirtió para vender ropa usada, él viaja a las diferentes comarcas, pueblos en busca de clientes vende su mercadería al contado y de crédito. Su esposa se dedica atender la casa y a los hijos, él es quien lleva el alimento para su familia. El espera en lo futuro poner una gran tienda donde además de vender ropa, venda zapatos, sabanas, almohadas y diferentes artículos para el hogar.  El desea comprar un pequeño terreno para heredarles a sus hijos y tengan un techo digno donde puedan vivir.El esta solicitando el credito para comprar pantalones de varon y mujer tales como jeans y de vestir.
texts.en:
Miguel lives in Teustepe in the Boaco municipality, and he sells used clothes.  He has three children, ages 8, 12, and 1.  He started selling clothes in an itinerant manner six years ago.  He had a little savings that he invested in selling used clothes.

He travels to the different districts and towns looking for customers.  He sells his merchandise for cash and for credit.  His wife takes care of the house and the children.  He is the breadwinner in the family.

In the future he hopes to be able to set up a large store where, in addition to selling clothes, he will sell shoes, sheets, pillows, and different household items.

He wants to buy a small piece of land to pass on to his children and for them to able to live with a decent roof over their heads.

He is requesting the loan to buy men’s and women’s pants like jeans and dress pants.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s pants.

loans.name: Mateo De Jesus

texts.es:
Mateo ,53 años casado es habitante de la comarca Las Banderas casado él se dedica a la compra y venta de piedra canteras (piedras que se utilizan para construcción de casas) desde hace 25 años lo cual lo hacía trabajando como chofer pero hace 6 años compro su camión con un préstamo que le otorgó una financiera aunque también tenía su dinero ahorrado. Hoy Mateo dice que el camión que tiene ya es propio porque hace 3 años lo  cancelo. El vende las piedras canteras en la cuidad capital Managua con la ayuda de una persona a quien le paga el día. 
 Mateo hoy solicita este préstamo para comprar un juego de llantas, piezas de repuesto para el motor. Pues de esta manera espera mantener en condiciones óptimas el buen funcionamiento de su camión. Como planes futuros desea comprar otro camión y abrir nuevas rutas de mercado.
texts.en:
Mateo, 53 years old and married, is a resident of the rural municipality Las Banderas.  He has made his living buying and selling quarry stone (stones that are used in constructing houses) for the past 25 years.  He used to do this working as a driver, but 6 years ago, he bought his own truck with a loan from a financial institution, even though he also had savings.

Today Mateo says that he already owns the truck, because he paid it off 3 years ago.  He sells the quarry stones in the capital city, Managua, with the help of a person whom he pays by the day.  

Mateo is now applying for this loan to buy a set of tires and replacement parts for his engine.  In this way, he hopes to maintain his truck in optimum working condition.  As for future plans, he hopes to buy another truck and open new market routes.

loans.use: to buy a set of tires and replacement parts for the engine.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mayra, 54 años de edad, madre de 9 hijos, solo uno está a cargo de ella, los demás viven independiente, habitante de la ciudad de Boaco se dedica a vender tortillas, frijoles cosidos y gaseosa , actividad que realiza desde hace 22 años cuando empezó con 5 libras de maíz para hacer tortillas , buscando la manera de apoyar a su familia , poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo , logro mantener a sus hijos , pagarle la escuela, vestirlos y darles de comer. Con el tiempo fue agregando la venta de frijoles, y gaseosas sus mismos clientes le solicitaban estos productos. 
Ella sueña con lograr componer su humilde vivienda y mejorar la cocina que es donde prepara las tortillas y los frijoles. Esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar maíz, leña, frijoles, crema y cuajada. Pues desea vender desayunos acompañados de sus sabrosas y calientitas tortillas hechas por sus propias manos.
texts.en:
Mayra is 54 years old and the mother of 9 children, with just 1 still in her care. The remainder live independently. She lives in the city of Boaco and sells tortillas, baked beans and soft drinks. Mayra has been doing this since 22 years ago, when she began making tortillas with just 5 lbs. of corn. searching for a means of helping her family.  Little by little, her business has grown. She managed to maintain her children and pay for school, dress them and give them food. Over time, she has been increasing her sales of beans and soft drinks. Her customers continue to solicit these products.

Mayra dreams of finishing her humble house and improving the kitchen, which is where she prepares the tortillas and beans. She needs financing to buy corn, firewood, beans, cream and cottage cheese. Mayra wants to sell breakfasts to accompany her delicious and piping hot tortillas, which she makes with her own hands.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, beans, cream and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Yeimy Raysa

texts.es:
Yeimy, originaria de Managua, tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, madre de 1 hijo con 13 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicio su negocio con capital propio, comprando crema corporal, ropa usada y ropa nueva con el objetivo de obtener más ingreso extra para el sustento de su familia, actualmente es dueña de una tienda de ropa nueva, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 2 años, este ha sido su único negocio, ella cuenta con  otros ingresos, dinero que le da el papa de su hijo, cuenta con el apoyo de su mama.
Solicita el financiamiento para comprar toda la mercadería en general tales como blusas, sandalias, zapatos, pantalones, vestidos, etc. Ya que ella estima que podrá comprar toda la ropa mas solicitada por los clientes y de esta manera poder incrementar las ventas, sus planes futuros es llegar a tener una tienda grande solo de ropa y calzado, para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para darle mejor presentación al negocio.
texts.en:
Yeimy is from Managua.  She is 30 years old and the single mother of a 13 year old son.  [Yeimy] is a merchant and sells general merchandise.  She started this business with her own money, buying body cream, and new and used clothing, in order to generate more income for the family.  She has been a store owner for more than two years and it has been her only business.  She gets some other money from her son’s father and also from her mother.

She is asking for this loan to buy different merchandise in general, such as blouses, sandals, shoes, pants, dresses, etc.  She expects to be able to buy clothing that is in highest demand by her customers so she can increase her sales.  Her plans for the future are to have a large clothing and shoe store to satisfy her customers’ needs.  Her next goal is to improve her home’s infrastructure and give the business a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the raw materials to make belts and lamps.

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es:
Francisco, expresa su agradecimiento por brindarle la oportunidad de su primer crédito Kiva con el cual el logro comprar materia prima como cuero, pegamento y hebillas para cumplir con la elaboración de fajas y billeteras para caballero, su pedido aumentado tiene un poco más de clientela. Siempre mantiene en su mente los planes de lograr tener su propia empresa industrial de fajas y billeteras pero su principal prioridad es darle una buena educación escolar a su hijo.
Está requiriendo  este financiamiento para compra cuero al por mayor hebillas, broches. Espera algún día lograr exportar sus productos fuera del país.
texts.en:
Francisco is grateful for having been granted his first Kiva loan, with which he was able to buy supplies such as glue and buckles to make men’s girdles and wallets.  His requests have increased and he has more customers.  He always keeps in mind that he wants to have his own factory, but his main priority is providing his son with a good education.

He needs this loan to buy leather in quantity, buckles, and snaps.  Some day he wants to export products.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Brenda Maria

texts.es: Brenda, de 30 años de edad, es habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, es madre de un hijo, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, carteras y fajas. A pesar de que ella estudio Ingeniería en sistema y no ejerce su carrera debido a la escasez de trabajo. Busco otra manera de ganarse al alimento de cada día vendiendo ropa de manera ambulante con el paso del tiempo puso uno mini tienda donde vende mercadería para vestir. Actualmente sobrevive de este negocio y paga los estudios de su hijo. Durante esta época la venta de ropa y zapatos es muy buena necesita surtir su negocio es por ello que solicita el financiamiento para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, fajas de diferentes estilos y colores. Su siguiente paso es lograr ampliar su tienda con más variedad de mercadería y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en: Brenda is 30 years old, lives in Estelí, and has a son.  She sells clothing, shoes, wallets, and girdles.  Even though she studied systems engineering, she doesn’t work in that field because of the scarcity of work.  She was looking for a way to earn a daily living by selling clothing on foot and in time opened a small clothing store.  Now she lives off of this business and pays for her son’s education.  During this season her clothing and shoe sales is very good and she needs to stock her business, so she is asking for a loan to buy clothing, shoes, wallets, and girdles of different styles and colors.  Her next goal is to expand her store with a greater variety of merchandise and move her son ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 58 años de edad, originaria de la Comarca San José  de los Remates, de las afueras del Municipio de Boaco, pero actualmente viven en Managua, viuda, madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de una mini tienda de ropa. Inicio su actividad laboral hace 7 años, con capital propio,  vendiendo helados, gelatina y hielo, luego con el tiempo decidió  vender ropa y cosméticos, el cual es un  negocio que le genera mucho ingreso, ya que ella desea diversificar su mercadería  especialmente la ropa que esta de moda en esta temporada, ella cuenta con otros ingresos como es la remesa que le envían su hija.
Ana solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería en general  como bolsos, zapatos, ropa, sandalias, zapatillas, etc. Con el objetivo de invertir aun más en su inventario para mayor atracción del clientes, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijas, ella  estima que este crédito será  de gran ayuda porque podrá mantener su negocio activo  con productos mas solicitado por los clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar su tienda  y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, su meta próxima es surtir el negocio con ropa variada de niño y adultos, perfumes, chinelas, de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Ana, 58, is a native of the San José  de los Remates district, on the outskirts of the municipality of Boaco. However, she currently lives in Managua.  She is a widow with 2 adult children.  She is a merchant who has a small clothing store.  She started in business 7 years ago with her own capital, selling ice cream, gelatins, and ice.  Later, as time passed, she decided to sell clothing and cosmetics, a business that generates a lot of income.  Ana wants to diversify her merchandise, especially with clothing that is in fashion this season.  She has other income, such as a remittance that is sent to her by her daughter.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise, such as: purses, shoes, clothing, sandals, slippers, etc.  Her goal is to invest in inventory so that she can attract more customers. Her daughters support her with the business.  Ana thinks that this loan will be a great help, because she will be able to keep her business active with the products that are most in demand by her customers.  For the future, Ana plans to expand her store and improve the condition of her business.  Her next goal is to stock her business with a variety of clothing for children and adults, perfumes, and flip flops so that she can obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including: purses, shoes, clothing, sandals and slippers

loans.name: Jhubielyn

texts.en:
This is Jhubielyn, 24, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edmar and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jhubielyn oversees and owns the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jhubielyn dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City and she helps her family through running an art and sign printing business. She is 43 years old and is married with one child. For 10 years, she has managed this business and earns about 10,000 PHP per month. For the time being, she needs to buy printing materials such as paint, brushes, etc so she ask for a new loan amounting of 18,000 PHP from GDMPC.  She joined GDMPC in 2010. In the future, Angela desires to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy printing materials such as paint, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Jimagilpe

texts.en: Jimagilpe, age 19, is single and lives in Tabid, Ozamis City. Jimagilpe operates a gardening business to earn a living and been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Recently, Jimagilpe joined GDMPC. In the future, Jimagilpe wants to make improvements to her house and to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf is 34 years old from Ramallah. He is married and has four children. Two of his children are in school. He owns a laundry shop in a small place where he washes for one of the hospitals in Ramallah. He has asked Ryada for a loan in order to buy a big washing machine for the store. He hopes to improve his income and to provide his children the best education he can afford them. His dream is to own a big place for washing laundry for big hotels and hospitals.

loans.use: to buy a big washing machine for the store

loans.name: Al-Shbab Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-shbab which consists of four men who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Sadam is 26 years old and single.  He lives in Sana`a.  He has a car which is in need of repair.  He works as a guard in a company and receives a low salary for this work.  He also owns a small grocery store.  He said his salary is not enough to repair his car and buy goods for his business so, he applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his car and grocery items.  He hopes to get married to live with his family and have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car and grocery items.

loans.name: Nour Al-Hoda Group

texts.en: This group, Nour Al-hoda, consists of 7 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Hoida, 19, is a single woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hardworking and educated woman. She is known who doesn`t waste her time doing things that are not beneficial. She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy laptop for her education.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use for education.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, un humilde campesino habitante de la comarca El Ventarrón  en las afueras de Teustepe, el se dedica a cultivar maíz frijol y trigo desde hace 25 años lo cual lo inicio realizando con dinero que el papa le prestaba para trabajar. Hoy tiene sus vaquitas y sus tierras donde trabaja las que ha ido comprando con la ganancia de sus cosechas. Don pablo solo tiene una hija de 23 años que estudia el 5to año de secundaria en el pueblo de la localidad , para realizar sus trabajo siempre paga mozo  la cosecha siempre la lleva a vender a Managua donde pagan mejor el grano.
 Hoy don Pablo solicita este crédito para comprar trigo para retenerlo y venderlo a un mejor precio él dice que el crédito le será de ayuda ya que ya que al comprar el trigo en este momento a precio bajo y venderlo cuando comience el verano para que sus clientes no carezcan de este producto. Su próxima es cortar el maíz que ya está listo para ser vendido y en lo futuro comprar terneros machos  para engordarlos y venderlos a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Pablo is a humble countryman who lives in El Ventarrón, outside of Teustepe.  He raises corn, beans, and wheat and has been doing this for 25 years.  He started with money that his father loaned him.  Now he has his own cows and land where he works and has been buying with the profits from his harvests.  He always takes it to sell in Managua where he can get better prices.

Today Pablo is asking for this loan to buy wheat to resell at a profit.  He says that the loan will be helpful because he will buy the wheat at a low price and resell it at the beginning of summer when his customers don’t have any available.  His next goal is to harvest the corn that is ready so that he can sell it.  In the future he wants to buy steers to fatten up and resell at a profit.

loans.use: to buy wheat.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es:
Rene, es un sencillo agricultor originario de la comunidad San Lorenzo en las afueras de Teustepe, padre de un hijo, su esposa es ama de casa y lo ayuda con las tareas del hogar mientas el mantiene el hogar. El inicio a trabajar a la edad de 7 años con su padre sembrando granos básicos al cumplir 15 años  sembró por cuenta propia una manzana de frijoles. Además de dedicarse a la siembra, también realiza trabajos como albañil buscando nuevas formas de conseguir ingreso para la familia. 
Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar semillas de frijol, maíz y trigo. El espera almacenar bastantes granos básicos para vender durante la época de verano que es cuando empieza a escasear el producto. Uno de sus proyectos comprar ganado y tierras  para mejorar sus ingreso . Como meta próxima mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar para que su familia tenga un techo digno donde pueda vivir.
texts.en:
Rene is a simple farmer from San Lorenzo, outside of Teustepe.  He’s the father of one son and his wife is a housewife who helps him with the household tasks while he supports the home.  He started working with his father at age 7, raising basic grains, and began planting a crop of beans on his own at age 15.  Besides farming he also works as a mason, looking for new ways to bring income to the family.

He needs this loan to buy bean, corn, and wheat seed and expects to stockpile plenty of basic grains to sell during the summer months, when these products begin to become scarce.  One of his plans is to buy livestock and land to improve his income.  He has a goal to improve the infrastructure in his home so that the family will have a dignified roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Yislene Francisca

texts.es:
Yislene, originaria de Boaco, casada, madre de un hijo, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a tender un bar, vende cosméticos. Es una mujer emprendedora el negocio lo dirigía a su mama pero hace 10 años ella se hizo cargo por completo del bar adicional sale a vender cosméticos, su esposo trabaja junto con ella administrando el negocio.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar jugos, gaseosas, licores sellados, cervezas y comprar cosméticos para vender. Uno de sus proyectos es lograr poner una pulpería y mejorar el techo de su hogar para no tener goteras en el techo que está muy deteriorado.
texts.en:
Yislene is from Boaco.  She is married, the mother of one son, and has a pub from where she also sells cosmetics.  She is an enterprising woman and 10 years ago she took charge of the business that her mother ran and also began selling cosmetics.  Her husband works with her in the business.

She is asking for this loan to buy juices, soft drinks, licensed liquor, beer, and cosmetics.  Her plans are to open a general store and improve the roof over her home so as not to have leaks.  Her current roof is in very bad shape.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, es de la comarca Potrerillo casado tiene 4 hijos de los cuales una  de sus hijas mujeres  esta en 5to año de la carrera de contabilidad y un hijo está en 3er año de la carrera de  Ingeniería en sistema y una hija el 2do año de secundaria.
 Ramiro es un productor que se dedica al cuido y ordeño de vacas lecheras dice que el ejerce esta actividad desde que tenía 15 años ayudándole a su mama y cuando se casó la mama le heredo un pedacito de tierra y unas vaquitas.  Con  el tiempo y trabajo ya posee un buen  ganado, uno de sus hijos le ayuda con el negocio y mano de obra que logra contratar por temporada. El vende cuajada, queso y leche de esta manera ha mantenido a su familia y lograr graduar algunos pues no es fácil por la situación económica difícil que se vive. Él tiene un sueño el cual es poner un puesto de venta de leche  en otra comarca donde la demanda es buena pues no todas producen ni venden leche lo cual sería ventajoso para él .
Hoy Ramiro solicita este crédito para comprar alambres y pagar la limpieza de los potreros lo cuales le ayudara  ya que se podrá mejorar  la finca, tenerla en condiciones óptimas para  trabajar. Ramiro dice que su meta es algún día llegar a tener vacas de mejor calidad en producción de leche.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a native of the Potrerillo district. He is married and has four children. One of his daughters is in the fifth year of the accounting curriculum, a son is the third year of systems engineering, and another daughter is in her second year of secondary school.

Ramiro is a farmer who cares for and milks cows. He says that he has carried out this activity since he was 15 years old, helping his mother. When he married, his mother gave him a small piece of land and some cows. As the result of time and work, he now has a good stock. One of his sons helps him with the business, and he manages to hire seasonal labor. He sells cheese curds, cheese, and milk, and in this way he has supported his family and managed to have some graduate, but it is not easy because of the difficult economic situation where he lives. He has a dream, which is to set up a stand to sell milk in another district where the demand is good, since not every district produces or sells milk, which would be advantageous for him.

Now Ramiro is applying for this loan to buy wire and pay for the cleaning of his pastures, which will help him, since he will be able to improve the farm, to have it in optimal conditions for working. Ramiro says that his goal is to someday have cows of better quality in milk production.

loans.use: to buy wire and pay to clean the pastures

loans.name: Oscar Eduardo

texts.es:
Oscar, es agricultor sembrando maíz, pipián, maicillo, vive con su esposa y seis hijos, algunos de ellos le ayudan a realizar sus labores, ya que además de la agricultura atiende la ganadería, él aprendió de sus padres y cuando formo su hogar, decidió dedicarse a estos oficios, ya tiene 12 años de realizarlo  y en su experiencia el riesgo que enfrenta son los cambios climáticos.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para realizar la siembra como el abono, semilla, pago de mozos para la preparación del terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios para realizar el trabajo sembrando maíz y pipián, ya que le aumentara la producción. 
La aspiración de Oscar es ampliar la producción en más terreno, realizar mejoras a la vivienda, ayudar a sus hijos para que se superen.
texts.en:
Oscar is a farmer who plants corn, squash, and sorghum. He lives with his wife and six children, some of whom help him in his work, since in addition to growing crops, he tends to the livestock. He learned from his parents, and when he set up his household, he decided to work in these areas, since he already had been doing it for 12 years. In his experience, the risk that he faces is the changes in climate.

He is applying for a loan to purchase supplies to do the planting, such as compost and seeds and paying for labor to prepare the land. This loan will help him to have the supplies necessary to do the work of planting corn and squash, since it will increase his production. Oscar's aspirations are to expand production on more land, to make improvements in his house, and to help his children so that they can better themselves.

loans.use: to buy compost and seeds, and pay for labor

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa est une femme mariée qui exerce dans le commerce de tissus et d'articles de mercerie. Elle est mère de trois enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Elle achète en gros ses produits à Dakar et les revend au détail dans sa localité. Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus substantiels qui lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels ainsi que les dépenses d'entretien de ses enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce , elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des issus et des articles de mercerie. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: Awa is a married woman who works in the textile and haberdashery business. She has three children of which two go to school. She buys her products wholesale in Dakar and sells them retail in her neighbourhood. This activity earns her a substantial income which allows her to cover her personal needs and her children's expenses. In order to enhance her business, she requests a loan of 200000 F for the purchase of fabrics and haberdashery items. Her ambition is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, viven en propiedad de la suegra, Sandra se dedica a la venta de meriendas, sandalias y ropa en variedad, aprendió de su madre quien se ha dedicado a este negocio, tiene cinco años realizándolo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de sandalias para ambos sexos, tambien comprara una parte de ropa como blusas, camisas, faldas, y algunos insumos para las meriendas, esto le permitirá mantener lo necesario, aprovechando la temporada de fiestas de fin de año, para generar más ingresos para la familia.
Su aspiración es poner su negocio en un local fijo, para evitar realizar las ventas ambulantes, tambien desea construir a futuro su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her husband and two children. They live on her mother-in-law's property. Sandra sells snacks, sandals, and a variety of clothing. She learned from her mother, who worked in this business. She has been doing it for five years.

She is applying for a loan to purchase sandals for both sexes. She will also buy a stock of clothing such as blouses, shirts, and skirts and some ingredients for snacks. This will allow her to maintain the necessary stock, taking advantage of the holiday season at the end of the year to generate more income for her family.

Her dream is to set up her business at a fixed location, to avoid making sales as a street vendor. In the future she also wants to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy sandals for both sexes, blouses, shirts, and skirts

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio de fabricación y venta de hamacas y tambien necesita una parte para la graduación de la hija, se comprara hilo, cáñamo, manguios, agujas, para elaborar las hamacas.

Ella manifiesta que estos préstamo le han permitido crecer en su negocio, tambien con sus ganancias y por el trabajo ha realizado mejoras a la vivienda, sus hijos se encuentran estudiando, gracias a los créditos ella está superando.
texts.en:
Bartola decided to apply for a new loan to strengthen her business of making and selling hammocks, and she also needs part of it for her daughter's graduation. She will buy thread, hemp, rope ties, and needles to make hammocks.

She states that the loans have permitted her to grow in her business. With her earnings and because of the work, she has also made improvements in her home. Her children are in school. Thanks to the loans, she is bettering herself.

loans.use: to buy thread, hemp, rope ties, and needles

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income he earned doing subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Zachary is applying for a loan of 47,007 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income he earned from subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted out once he purchases a water pump.

Stanley is applying for a loan of 11,175 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Nanyuki in the Coast province of Kenya. She is married and has one child. Beatrice has been a subsistence farmer but would like to diversify into tea tree farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. She began the business of tea tree farming this year. She learned about Milango from promotions and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of water for irrigation.
 
Beatrice is applying for a loan of 9,092 Kenya shillings to purchase tea tree seedlings for farming. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase tea tree seedlings for farming.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin lives in the Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farm. He started the business with income from subsistence farming. The extract from his tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began this business this year.

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Martin is applying for a loan of 12,761 KES to buy tea tree seedlings for his business. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, and he looks forward to increasing the acreage of his farm.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена замужем. У нее трое детей. Двое из них учатся в университете. Елена вместе с мужем ведет бизнес. У них в семье хорошие и теплые отношения.

Елена занимается выращиванием овощей на протяжении 6 лет.  У нее больной участок земли, который позволяет развиваться и строить новые теплицы. Елена трудолюбивая и ответственная. В планах на следующий год у нее стоит покупка машины.

Елена просит предоставить кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на постройку новой теплицы.
texts.en:
Elena is married.  She has three children.  Two of them are studying at the university.  Elena has a business with her husband.  Their family has nice and warm relationships.  

Elena has been growing vegetables for 6 years.  She has a large plot of land which allows her to expand and build new greenhouses.  Elena is hardworking and responsible.  Next year her plans include buying a car.  

Elena is asking for a loan of 10,000 hryvnia to build a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь занимается фермерством. У него много теплиц. Предыдущий кредит Игоря был потрачен на покупку двух маленьких котлов для отопления теплиц. Их приходилось топить каждую ночь, то есть следить, чтобы они не потухли. Не смотря на это, он значительно увеличил доход, и теперь хочет улучшить отопление.

Игорь просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 24000 гривны на покупку большого, автоматического котла, а также шланги и трубы для отопления. Новый котел будет поддерживать необходимую температуру, а также его нужно будет топить лишь один раз в сутки. Игорь, сэкономив время, собирается строить новую теплицу для рассады.
texts.en:
Igor is a farmer.  He owns many greenhouses.  Igor used his prior loan to purchase two small boilers to heat the greenhouses.  He needed to stoke them every night - meaning he had to watch them to make sure that they did not extinguish.  Despite this he increased his earnings significantly and would now like to improve the heating system.

Igor is asking for a loan of 24,000 hryvnia to purchase a large, automatic boiler and hoses and pipes for the heating system.  The new boiler will maintain the right temperature and will only need to be stocked once per day.  Igor, having saved time, plans to build a new greenhouse for planting.

loans.use: to buy a large automatic boiler to heat greenhouses

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident of Nanyuki in the Coast province, Kenya. She has been a subsistence farmer but would like to diversify into tea tree farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. She began the business of tea tree farming this year.

She learned about Milango from promotions and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of water for irrigation.
 
Lucy is applying for a loan of 11,526 Kenya shillings to purchase tea tree seedlings for farming. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To purchase tea tree seedlings for farming.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya.  He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income he earned from subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted out once he purchases a water pump.

James is applying for a loan of 9,128 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income he earned from subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. Joseph had so much faith in the project that he decided to invest in a larger acreage farm to realize more returns on his investment.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted out once he purchases a water pump.

Joseph is applying for a loan of 100,150 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Gathecha

texts.en:
Gathecha lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income he earned from subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted out once he purchases a water pump.

Gathecha is applying for a loan of 21,440 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es:
José, quiere surtir el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprarse lo necesario para la reparación de bicicletas como catarinas, pedales, asientos, tambien se dispone a sembrar maicillo, para esto comprara abono, que le permita mejorar su trabajo.
Él manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la inversión necesaria, hasta el momento se ha mantenido estable,  en su familia tambien, los ingresos han servido para cubrir los gastos del hogar, desea construir un local para el negocio del taller.
texts.en:
José wants to stock his business, and to do this he is applying for a loan to buy what he needs to repair bicycles, such as sprockets, pedals, and seats. He is also getting ready to plant sorghum, and for this he will buy fertilizer, which will allow him to improve his work.

He states that with the last loan he succeeded in making the necessary investment. So far things have remained stable, and with his family as well. The income has served to cover the household expenses. He wants to construct a business location for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy sprockets, pedals, and seats for his bicycle repair business

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем. У нее взрослая дочь. Светлана ведет свой собственный бизнес.

Светлана занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке родного города. Ее опыт работы  в этом направлении 14 лет.  Наиболее популярные товары: блузы, платья, пиджаки, куртки и пальто. Светлана ответственная и трудолюбивая.

Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21000 гривен на закупку сезонной верхней одежды. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль, а тем самым улучшить быт семьи.
texts.en: Svetlana is married with a grown daughter.  She runs her own business selling women's clothing in the market of her native city.  She has 14 years experience in this line of work.  The most popular items she sells are: blouses, dresses, jackets, skirts and coats.  Svetlana is responsible and hard-working.  She is asking for a loan of 21,000 hryvnas to buy seasonal outerwear.  The loan will help her increase her income and thus to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal winter clothes

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем. У нее двое детей. Старшая дочь учиться в университете, а младший сын в лицее. Оксана ведет свой бизнес.

Оксана занимается продажей товаров для дома. В этом году этот бизнес основной источник дохода семьи. Ее муж занимается фермерством, но в этом году была очень сильная засуха, а соответственно плохой урожай. Благополучие семьи сейчас зависит от Оксаны.

Оксана просит  предоставить ей кредит на сумму 15,000 гривен на закупку промышленных товаров, недорогой одежды и обуви, а также на уплату аренды.
texts.en: Oksana is married with two children.  Her elder daughter is at university and her younger daughter is in high school.  Oksana runs her own business selling household products.  This year, the business was the family's main source of income.  Her husband is a farmer, but this year there was a bad drought and a correspondingly poor harvest.  The family's well-being now depends on Oksana.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 hryvnas to buy manufactured goods and inexpensive clothes and shoes, as well as to pay her rent.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of items for sale

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: В прошлый раз Галина потратила КИВА кредит на закупку дорогих подарочных кошельков, благодаря чему она получила дополнительную прибыль. В это раз Галина хочет закупить рюкзаки и дорожные сумки. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия.
texts.en: Last time, Galina used her Kiva loan to buy expensive gift purses, thanks to which she was able to receive an additional profit.  This time, Galina wants to buy backpacks and travel bags.  She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy backpacks and travel bags

loans.name: Kasyipa

texts.ru: Касыйпа 42 года, не замужем. Касыйпа воспитала 2 детей, старший сын живет отдельно, младший учится в школе. Дети активно помогают матери по хозяйству. С 2002 году семья Касыйпа успешно занимается разведением скота и продажей молока. Начав со стартовой суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), Касыйпа смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в 6,000 сом. Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Касыйпа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Касыйпа намерена использовать для постройки нового сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kasyipa is 42 years old and unmarried.  She has raised two children; her elder son lives outside the home and her younger son is in school.  Her children actively help their mother around the house.  Since 2002, Kasyipa has been successfully raising livestock and selling milk.  Starting with the sum of 2,000 som (KGS), she has been able to increase her household's monthly income to 6,000 som.  To further increase her head of livestock, Kasyipa has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy some additional animals to raise.  She plans on using her increased income to build a new barn to provide good living conditions for her animals, and to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to purchase cows and a foal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Al-Seham Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Seham and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz. Seham is 30 years old. She is a married woman and has five children who live in Taiz, Yemen. Seham has a small house. She intends to buy a water tank, but she doesn`t have sufficient money, so she applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy a water tank to use at home.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to use at home.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a resident of Nanyuki, Coast province, Kenya. Aniceta has been a subsistence farmer but would like to diversify into tea tree farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. She began the business of tea tree farming this year.
She learnt about Milango from promotions and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of water for irrigation.
Aniceta is applying for a loan of 22,022 Kenya shillings to purchase tea tree seedlings for farming. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family.

loans.use: to purchase tea tree seedlings for farming.

texts.en:
Jeremy lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.
He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.
Jeremy is applying for a loan of 15,769 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to growing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: o buy tea tree seedlings for his farm.

texts.en:
Julius lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

Julius is applying for a loan of 23,454 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings and he looks forward to increasing the acreage of his farm.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is also a married mother of one child. Emily owns a grocery stall selling fruits and vegetables. She began the business from her savings and has been operating it for the last four years.
Purity is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to purchase food stuff for the grocery stall. Her business faces the slight challenge of seasonal business climate and the inflation.
She would like to own a larger grocery in the future made possible through the savings she expects from this loan. She expects to pay for her siblings school fees with the additional income from this business.

loans.use: to purchase food stuff for the grocery stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes, flour, sugar, paraffin, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a 27-year-old divorced woman living with her sister, brother-in-law and her two-year-old son. After her divorce from her husband, she came back to her sister's house and started living with her sister's family, but she felt like a burden on her sister's family, as her sister was already responsible for her one son and two daughters. So she planned to help her sister financially and started a small tailoring shop with her one sewing machine. She took orders from her customers for stitching plastic bags and whenever she had time, she got involved in a cane craft. She makes mirror stands, tools, chairs etc. from cane. She says that the cane craft is more profitable than tailoring. Because of her limited financial condition, she is not able to develop her cane craft business. She earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity, which is not sufficient for her family. She plans to purchase the raw materials (cane, coloring, nails, etc.) and appoint two workers for her business.
 
She has requested a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing raw materials (cane, coloring, nails, etc.) and appointing two workers for her business to help her to produce more.

She wants to save some money for her sons’ future and send her son to a good school.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (cane, coloring, nails, etc.) and hire two workers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, and other non-perishables for resale.

loans.name: Al-Rabia Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Rabia which consists of 6 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Nabila is a 25-year-old married woman who has three children who live in Taiz. She works as a cleaner in the Public Sector. She started to work while she was at school. She is the breadwinner of her family. She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Ruphena

texts.en:
Ruphena is a resident of the Changamwe area of the Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady. Ruphena owns a retail shop - a business that she has been running for four years. In this shop, she sells paraffin, sugar, flour and other items. Ruphena has two children. She also earns some income from rental houses owned by the family.

She learnt about Milango Financial Services from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. The main challenge is high competition from other retail and wholesale shops. Even so, she believes she can make more sales from increased her level of stock. She aspires to own a wholesale shop in the future.

Ruphena is applying for a loan of 57,500 KES to purchase rice, sugar, flour, soap and other non-perishables for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standards. She aspires to own other centres and plan for her children’s education with more security.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour and other non-perishables for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima est un homme nouvellement marié.Il n'a pas encore d'enfant.Il exerce un commerce de denrées alimentaires comme le mil, l'arachide, le haricot...Il s'approvisionne en gros à l'intérieur du pays juste après les récoltes et stock la plus grande partie de ses produits dans un magasin en attendant que la demande soit supérieur à l'offre sur le marché.Il achète et revend également des moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.Ces activités lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et d'entretenir sa femme.Il sollicite actuellement un prêt de 250000f pour acheter du mil et de l'arachide afin de renouveler son stock.Son ambition est d'acquérir un véhicule pour faciliter ses déplacements.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a newly-married man who doesn't yet have any children.  His business is selling food products such as millet, groundnuts and beans.  He buys his merchandise wholesale in the countryside just after harvest time and sells most of his produce from a store, having waited for demand to outstrip supply.  He also buys and re-sells sheep in the weekly markets in his town.  These businesses allow him to cover his own needs and to support his family.  He is currently requesting a loan for 250,000 francs to buy millet and groundnuts to replenish his stock.  His goal is to buy a vehicle to make his trips easier.

loans.use: to buy millet and groundnuts

loans.name: Momar Ngone

texts.fr: Momar est un homme marié.Il est père de deux enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école primaire.Il construit en ce moment sa maison.Il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter des carreaux.Son vœux le plus cher est de terminer rapidement sa maison et de s'y installer avec toute sa famille.
