texts.en: Momar is a married man.  He is the father of two children, one of whom attends elementary school.  Right now, Momar is building a house for himself.  He is requesting a loan for 400,000 francs to buy tiles.  His biggest wish is to finish building his house quickly and to move in with all his family members.

loans.use: to buy tiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase paraffin, sugar, flour, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Abdullah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Abdullah which consists of 5 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Hend is a young woman, 24 years of age. She is married and has one child. She owns a small house. 

Hend applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business with the income from subsistence farming. The extract from tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. He believes this will be solved once he purchases a water pump.

Charles is applying for a loan of 10,073 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, and he looks forward to establishing the farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Nanyuki in Coast province, Kenya. Jane has been a subsistence farmer but would like to diversify into tea tree farming. The extract from tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. She began the business of tea tree farming this year.

She learned about Milango through promotions, and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is the lack of water for irrigation. 

Jane is applying for a loan of 10,832 Kenya shillings to purchase tea tree seedlings for farming. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of the family.

loans.use: To purchase tea tree seedlings for farming.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year.

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be solved once he purchases a water pump.

Simon is applying for a loan of 10,832 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings, and he looks forward to establishing the farm by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo District with his wife and children. The family sows greens in the open ground and sells them in an open market. In addition, David owns a milk cow and produces cheese products. 

He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. David requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan programs extend to the country rural poor business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions. These families do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, David will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials to construct it. David will sow different kinds of greens and vegetables to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. David awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Parayil

texts.en:
Parayil lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from tea trees is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learnt about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be solved once he purchases a water pump.

Parayil is applying for a loan of 19,444 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the farm. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and he looks forward to getting the returns once he starts harvesting.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Qarat-Ul-Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Qarat-ul-Nisa is a 47-year-old responsible housewife. She lives with her husband and 2 sons in Punjab, Pakistan. 

She wants to open a new general store for her son; however, due to financial constrains she is facing some hurdles. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a variety of products like flour, rice, biscuits, chips, candies, etc. for her son's general store. This will help her son to add a variety of products in the new store which will increase his savings and income as well.

Qarat-ul-Nisa is very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products like flour, rice, biscuits, chips, candies, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Mishach

texts.en:
Mishach is 29 years old and married with 3 children and 1 orphaned dependent. He is a herdsman, mainly dealing in cattle fattening as his major source of income. He started the project in 1998 with 4 cows. Mishach has earned a lot from this project. He has managed to build a permanent house for his family, send his 2 children to school and provide them with the basic necessities of life.

He wants a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to construct a kraal for his animals and to buy medicine (drugs) for preventing infections that could attack his animals. His dream is to own a large dairy for processing milk in his region. His major challenges are inadequate pasture, animal feeds and kraal for his animals’ safety. Mishach is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to construct a shed for his animals.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar lives in Tbilisi city. He is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife, his 5-year-old son and his parents-in-law. David is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the monthly retirement pensions of Omar’s parents-in-law. The family lives in poverty.

David decided to re-start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. He used to have a car and worked as a taxi driver, but after a car accident where Omar crashed the car, his business was stopped. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, David will purchase a car to serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 57 years old. She lives with her sister and mother in the Batumi District, West Georgia. Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nino works as a sales lady in a grocery store. It makes a total of 250 Laris per month. Her mother is provided with a retirement pension and gets 125 Laris per month. It is hardly enough to buy food for the 3 member family.
 
Nino requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Nino will rent the grocery store where she works as a sales lady, and will purchase a stock of goods for resale. She will work hard and do her best to increase the income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to rent a grocery store and purchase a stock of goods.

loans.name: Sehrish's Group

texts.en:
Sehrish is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor for the past four years. She has gotten a lot of appreciation through her work. She is very talented and knows the art of makeup very well. People prefer her for bridal makeup. She makes enough to support her family well.

Due to an increase in the number of customers, she requires more beauty products, utensils, and some furniture to cater to many customers at a time. For this, she requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the requirements of her parlor, which ultimately helps her to generate more income. 

Sehrish desires to expand her parlor and intends to spend part of the income on the improvement of her house.

Note: In the picture Sehrish holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products, utensils, and some furniture.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia lives in the Bolnisi District. She is 48 years old and lives with her grown son and husband. The source of income for the family is a small monthly salary earned by Maia, working as a teacher locally. Besides, the family runs a small dairy farm of two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold locally. In addition, she sows potatoes on the family-owned land and sells the harvested products at the local open market. 

Maia’s husband has a tractor and serves local farmers. Maia and her husband decided to start their business, as their existing income wasn't enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Maia will purchase a car, and her husband will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is an 18-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has run a small grocery store for five years. This business is improving but at the same time, competition is increasing. He is a man with very good communication skills who treats his customers in a very attractive and elegant way. He is requesting a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery items for his business. This new stock is attractive enough to increase his income and let him dream of a shining future. In the future, he hopes to expand his business, open another grocery store and get married.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in the city of Mombasa. He is single and lives in a rental house. He is requesting his first loan from Yehu to buy an inventory of second-hand clothing to resell.

Buying and selling such items has been Edward’s activity for the past three years. “It is one of the activities that Kisauni people enjoy and are good at doing,” he said. 

Edward is a responsible young man who promises to make his repayment on time so that he will be entrusted with more loans in future.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a resident of Kisauni, Coast Province, Kenya, where he lives with his family and has been practicing dairy farming for five successive years.
Alex has requested a loan of 10,000 KES from Yehu to add to his savings so he can buy a dairy cow. He hopes to raise enough income from the dairy cow to construct a modern dairy unit in future. His focus is to make dairy farming his core business and hopes to generate enough income to educate his five children who are in school.

He notes that animal diseases are a great challenge in the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: The desire to have a prosperous life is one of Benson's dreams. He always struggles to achieve success. He is a very dedicated man who has been operating a clothes shop, a business that is active to date. He wants to make improvements to his business so that he can have reasonable sales for this festive season. Benson is grateful for the support from the last loan. He is a responsible and faithful person, as expressed from the previous loan, which he successfully repaid. He will buy clothing to stock his shop so that he can offer a variety to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ogrey Group

texts.en:
Ogrey group consists of 5 women: Faustina, Comfort, Grace, Leticia and Grace. They decided to access credit from ID Ghana in 2011. They sell soaps, firewood, groceries, plantains and fish, respectively.

Faustina, 49, is a widow with one child. She sells soaps. She has 12 years of experience and works from Monday to Saturday. She is constantly working to increase her business capital. This is her 5th loan with ID Ghana and she needs a loan of 600 GHS to buy more soap to sell to her customers.

She sells to generate income to take care of family expenses. She buys from the market in Accra and sells in her community. 

The entire group needs an amount of 3,100 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, tiene la edad  de 40 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café para que el cultivo en este verano que se aproxima esté preparado nutricionalmente. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: William is a married 40 year old man who lives with his wife and children whom are his main priority.  With this loan he plans on paying for fertilizers, fungicides, and manual labor to help him cultivate his coffee this coming summer.  He also plans to purchase seedbeds so that he can replant the coffee and increase the number of plants on his land.  He hopes to take advantage of the fertility of the land and the good weather conditions among other things that favor the cultivation of coffee.  With these improvements to his coffee he expects to increase revenue and thus improve his family's quality of life.  Also, he would invest a bit more in his land and achieve other goals.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has never before received loans from other banks but FUDECOSUR has given him the opportunity with a lot less scrutiny and lower interest rate.

loans.use: with his coffee.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a self-driven man with the urge to move ahead. He thanks Kiva lenders for the support they have given him. He is taking out a new loan to expand his business. With this new investment, he will be able to purchase more clothing for sell. He is happy to see his living standards improve day by day.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Al-Amira Group

texts.en: This group, Al-Amira, consists of 3 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Ashwaq is a 28-year-old married woman who has 3 children who live in Sana`a. She is a housewife and dreams of living a comfortable life with her family. She applied for a youth loan of 60000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a responsible housewife who buys and sells fruits and vegetables in her town. This is her way of helping her husband generate income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their son. She aims to improve her business to satisfy her customers' demand and earn a higher income, but she suffers from an insufficiency of capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy cabbage, kale, tomatoes, oranges, bananas, and potatoes for sale. She believes that through her hard work, she can make her business a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, kale, tomatoes, oranges, bananas, and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 47 years old and married with five children between the ages of 1 and 20 years old. He sells general stock items in Waterloo. Previously, he was doing business with his father. In 1992, he decided to start his own business so he could build his family. Three of his children are currently attending school.

To earn a living, he sells home products like radios, tapes, lighters and phone accessories at his store. He also earns income from renting out his house. He describes his main problem as insufficient capital to run his business and the difficulty of catching a vehicle within the Waterloo community.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electronic appliances like radios, tapes, lighters and phone accessories .He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to increase his income and improve his family's standard of living. In the future, he would like to expand his business in town. He is grateful for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to purchase more electronic appliances like radios, tapes, lighters and phone accessories.

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
Yawah lives in Gardnerville, one of the well-known areas in Montserrado county that is noted for its commercial center. Yawah is 45 years old and unmarried with five children between the ages of 6 and 26 who are in school, and only four live at home. Yawah said she was unable to attend school, but she said she is very good at managing her business. She received money from her boyfriend to start her business where she sells alcoholic drinks, rice by the cup, oil, etc. 

One problem that she faces is the price of the drinks, because she buys the drinks in USD, and now the exchange rate of USD to LD is too high. She enjoys the interaction between herself and her customers. Having enough money to buy a piece of land and support her home makes her proud of her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks, rice by the cup, oil, etc. to have the attention of her customers. Her dream is to educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks, rice by the cup, oil, etc. to have the attention of her customers.

loans.name: Armah

texts.en:
Armah is 22 years old and lives in Kakata Town. She is single and has two children, aged 3 and 5, who are in school and live at home. She stopped her education at seventh grade. 

For the past two years, Armah has been selling fresh cow meat from a table in the market. She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh cow meat for her business. She established the business with a loan from her mother. A problem she faces is the price of the cow meat at wholesale. 

Armah enjoys the independence her income gives her. Her goal is to have a provision shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fresh cow meat for her business.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha is a 38-year-old divorced woman living with her parents and children who are attending school.

She owns and manages a small tea cum snacks stall where she sells tea, samosa (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), 'Idli' (popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), 'Wada' (lentil doughnuts), etc. She has her shop in front of her house which makes it easy for her to look after her children as well as the shop.

 She requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase cooking utensils and raw materials like flour, potatoes, spices, lentils, and oil for her Snack shop. She says the additional source of income will enable her to be financially stronger and provide good education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing cooking utensils and raw materials like flour, potatoes, spices, lentils, and oil for her Snack shop.

loans.name: Purna Chandra

texts.en:
Purna Chandra is 26 years old, a differently-able person living with his parents in Odisha, India.

He owns a variety store in his village. He sells vegetables, biscuits, hair oil, talcum powder, soaps, detergents, wafers, chocolates and other daily household consumables.

His family lives on 3500 INR per month currently and he wants to earn more for the betterment of his family. He has requested a loan amount of 25,000 INR to buy more variety of the stock he is selling right now and offer a better quality and range of products to his customers. He wants to save some money for his future and get married.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing vegetables, biscuits, hair oil, talcum powder, soaps, detergents, wafers, chocolates, etc. for his variety shop.

loans.name: Al-Bkiry Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Bkiry and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Sumia is a 23-year-old married woman. She would like to buy a home appliance. She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Al-Haima Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Haima and consists of six ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 180,000 YER. 

Fatima is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. They live happily in Sana`a. Fatima is a housewife. 

She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Selifa

texts.en:
Selifa is a 38-year-old lady with 2 children at the age of 5 and 15 years. She has been running her business for one year. Her customers are very welcoming and friendly. They buy her products on credit and cash basis. Her business is situated at the market which is strategically placed. She sells cereals such as beans, maize, black beans etc. She faces a business challenge of harsh climatic conditions which can lead to shortages of cereals to sell.

Selifa plans to use 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cereals to sell to her customers. In the future, she looks forward to being the best seller of cereals in her market area.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 7 years. She describes herself as a visionary woman. She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are regular residents within the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy tea leaves to sell. Her business goal is to be the best supplier of tea leaves in her area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add new stock of tea leaves

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw is 26 years old, married to Esther, 25 years old and a trader. They are blessed with two children. He belongs to the promise group located at Teshie but decided to take this loan as an individual.

He has been trading in doughnuts and bread for the past 6 years. He has a sample of bread in the photograph. He gets his products from Makola in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and sells to his customers in and around Teshie.

This is his fourth loan and he needs an amount of 1,000 Ghana Cedis (GHS) to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy flour to bake bread and sell to customers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 26-year-old married man. He describes himself to be an honest man. 

Samuel operates a retail business where he sells cakes and bread. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power sometimes. 

Samuel will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy loaves of bread to sell. His business goal is to be the best supplier of bread within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Pamelah

texts.en:
Pamelah is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. She describes herself as a visionary woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a shopping centre and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor road transport which makes it hard for customers to access her business area. 

She will use the 10,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy home products. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 26-year-old lady. She runs  a boutique business where she sells shoes, dresses and materials for making clothes. Jane describes herself as a hard-working and honest woman. Jane is married but has no children yet. She plans to use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy clothes and shoes so as to improve her boutique business.

She faces a business challenge of low purchasing power from customers at some seasons.She plans to improve and expand her business. In addition, she does farming which increases her business income. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 30, is a responsible and hardworking person who lives with her husband and one child. She has a beauty salon where she straightens and blow-dries hair and does hair coloring, facials, haircuts, and other services. 

Josephine is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a large quantity of beauty products such as hair dyes, cosmetics, hair creams, and other items.

Josephine at times receives orders to supply beauty products to her customers, door to door. She is a person who dreams of improving her business as much as she can, improving her services and in this way continuing to grow the business so that she can live better with her family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beauty products such as hair dyes, cosmetics, hair creams, and other items.

loans.name: Bee Group

texts.en:
Beatrice and Gifty are the members of this group. They sell wigs and plastic products respectively. They have been together from 2010 to date. 

Beatrice is a 25-year-old hairdresser. She is not married. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and doing very well with her business. She has been doing this business for five years now. She works from Mondays through Saturdays, a routine she followed with her teacher during her apprenticeship. With her savings with ID Ghana, she was able to rent a store where she does her business. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings, she would not have made it this far. 

This is her 6th loan and she needs GHC 1,400 to buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell to her customers. 


Beatrice and Gifty need a total amount of GHC 2,700 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to serve her customers with.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 45-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 10 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be a visionary woman. 

Loice operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, onions, kale, mangoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are regular residents within the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Loice will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to be the best retailer of vegetables and fruits within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 28 years old. She and her husband are in a common-law relationship and have two children. They reside in a community in the town of Mwambalazi.


For the past three years, Ruth has been selling household products from her convenience store. She plans to restock her business and offer a variety of products, so she decided to request a loan for the amount of 50,000 KES. She plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, cleaning products, condiments, snack foods, and soft drinks.


She hopes to continue improving her quality of life with the income that she will generate.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, eggs, cleaning products, condiments, snack foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming; he also grows potatoes, maize and vegetables on a small scale. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. 

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

David is applying for a loan of 10,832 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings and looks forward to establishing the farming business by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a 30-year-old, married man. He has two children, one and two years old. Hillary describes himself as patient and hard-working. He operates a food stall where he sells ground nuts to passers-by. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a viable business environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be unstable, high market prices. 

Hillary will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy ground nuts. His business goal is to have a distribution network selling ground nuts in other branches or regions within five years.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts for his food stall.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 24-year-old married woman. She has a child who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a busy market and her primary customers are regular residents within the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor road transport which make it hard for customers to access her business area. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be a seller of clothes and shoes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 30-year-old, married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a faithful and trustworthy woman. 

Caroline operates a retail store where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a busy environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate rice to sell. 

Caroline will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy rice to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with two children who are one and five. For the past four years, she has run a store where she sells products such as sugar, salt, maize, flour, and other items. Leah's business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes herself as an honest woman. Leah's biggest business challenge is the poor road network that makes it hard for customers to access her business.

Leah is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy home products to sell. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM and her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy products to sell

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a 44-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be trustworthy and dynamic in his work. 

Harrison does a retail business where he sells pigs and pork meat to customers in his residential area and also to tourists. He has been involved in this business for one year. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital and quick spoiling of the pork, as he does not have a proper storage facility to store his meat when not bought by customers. He will use the loan of Kes 30,000 to buy pigs.

Harrison's business goal is to be a large distributor of pigs and to diversify his business by selling other meat products within five years.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Wadhah

texts.en:
Wadhah is a 29-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Wadhah sells cell phones, accessories, and cell phone chargers in a commercial center. He began by working in a business with a friend in Sana`a city and, once he gained experience, started his own business in the town where he and his family live. Wadhah used his savings from an earlier job as working capital. Initially, he began by selling clock accessories and then gradually added other items as his customers requested them. Wadhah has earned a profit and he hopes to continue expanding his working capital, which often is insufficient to meet the demand of his clients. 

Wadhah is requesting an 150,000 YER youth loan through AMB to buy cell phones, accessories, and cell phone chargers along with other items that his customers have ordered. In the future, Wadhah hopes to rent another shop and start an electronics business.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, accessories, and cell phone chargers for his business

loans.name: Angelin

texts.en:
Angelin is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. For the past seven years, she has been operating a business where she sells cereals. Angelin's business is located in a busy business environment and her primary customers are local residents and the local priest. She describes herself as a creative woman. Angelin's biggest business challenge is the shortage of cereals to sell. 

Angelin is requesting a 12,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp to use at home with her five family members. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM and her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: In Him Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Mercy and Panor, who run businesses selling sandals and fish in their community. Together, they are requesting a 1,100 GHS loan to buy more fish and shoes for their businesses. 

Mercy is 47 years old and married to Samuel, who is 52 years old and works as a driver. The couple has two children. Mercy has been selling sandals and shoes for the past 12 years, and sells from Monday to Saturday. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and seems to be doing very good.

Mercy is requesting an 800 GHS loan to buy more sandals and shoes to sell. This will be her fourth loan. Through her business and with the help of her husband, Mercy has been able to provide her children with a quality education. She is grateful to Kiva and ID Ghana.

loans.use: to buy more sandals and shoes to sell

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze's business improved over the last period and she was able to set up a local poultry business and a green grocery stall, selling tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. 

Kanze desires to improve the grocery business and is applying for a loan of KES 26,300 (Kenya shillings) to purchase additional stocks of tomatoes, onions, etc. She believes this will help improve her lifestyle and provide for some of her children, who depend on her.

loans.use: to buy stocks of tomatoes, onions, etc. for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 40 years of age, is married and has a wife with two children, ages 4 and 6 years. He describes himself as an ambitious and focused man.

Michael sells building blocks to masons and local residents from his home area. He faces a business challenge of inadequate stones to sell to the customers. 

Michael is requesting a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a stone-cutting machine, which he will use to cut stone into smaller pieces. 

He has a plan to expand his business in the next five years and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a stone-cutting machine.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages one and five years. She describes herself as a gentle woman. 

Christine sells clothes to customers in a busy market . She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transport incurred when buying clothes and transporting them to her business premise. 

Christine will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her goals are to run a fully-stocked clothes retail store and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Harusi

texts.en:
Harusi lives in the coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has five children. 

Harusi sells fish at the Malindi area to most of her customers. She has been doing the business for over three years. Upon learning of Milango from her friends, Harusi joined the group in order to access credit.

Harusi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase fish for sale. She faces the challenge of a seasonal business climate, but given the fact that people have to eat, she doesn’t fail to sell some fish and get money to support her family.  

Harusi’s ambition is to improve her business and maybe start other projects. Harusi has therefore decided to save additional income yet to be realized from this loan for such goals.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami a 28-year-old, is married and has no children yet. 
For the past five years, Rami has had a bookstore, where he sells various types of stationery to school and university students and to groups, which makes his project a profitable one. It is his only source of income. It needs more support to cover some urgent costs. 
Rami wants to improve and expand his business, so he is requesting a USD1,500  loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a collection of stationery and bring in a new copier machine, so students can use it to copy their documents and papers.
Taking out this loan will improve Rami's work and increase his sales, which will increase his income and create better living conditions for his family.
Rami is photographed inside his bookstore.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and a copier machine for his bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions to sell.

loans.name: Omware

texts.en:
Omware is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 6 and 12 years. He describes himself to be a humble and God-fearing man.

Omware provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located within a busy urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be long working hours, so as to get profit from his business.

Omware will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a bicycle. He hopes to expand his business in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase a new bicycle.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 28-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be a polite and faithful woman.  She operates a retail business where she sells cloth; she has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a busy urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. 

She will use the  20,000 KES loan to buy clothing material to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing material for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soap, sugar, flour, etc for sale.

loans.name: Macmillan

texts.en:
Macmillan lives in the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of two children and owns a green grocery stall which he has been operating for five years. In this business, Macmillan sells greens, fruits, vegetables, mineral water, and other soft drinks, etc. He began the business through the capital he raised from the casual jobs he once performed.

Macmillan learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend; he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenges he is facing are bad debts and the high cost of transport. 

Macmillan is applying for a loan of KES 52,250 (Kenya shillings) to buy a new stock of groceries (e.g. potatoes, onions, tomatoes). The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy a new stock of groceries (e.g. potatoes, onions, tomatoes) for his grocery stall.

loans.name: Kangombe

texts.en:
Kangombe is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married businesswoman who sells firewood, a trade she has run for twelve years. Kangombe has six grown children. She is also a farmer.

Kangombe learned of Milango Financial Services from a friend and joined in order to access funds. She is applying for a loan of KES 10,650 (Kenya shillings) to buy charcoal and also pay for its transportation. 

The only challenge in the business is the bad debts. Kangombe is determined to carry out her operations well because she believes that it is from such a venture that she can establish her family. Her future ambition is to be able to purchase larger stock.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and also pay for its transportation.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a resident of Kongowea of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. Mercy owns a tailoring shop, a business that she has been running for 22 years. Besides this, she also sells detergents.

Mercy learned about Milango Financial Services from an employee; she joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is bad debt.  

Mercy is applying for a loan of KES 32,600 (Kenya shillings) to purchase materials and sewing equipment, like needles, thread, etc., and raw materials/chemicals to make detergents. 

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family. Mercy aspires to own a training center.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring shop, like needles, thread, etc., and to buy raw materials to make detergents for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns an electronics shop, a business she has been operating for four years now. She also sells clothes.

Irene learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on her business operations. Her main challenge is occasional low demand.

Irene is applying a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy electronic/stationery gadgets like toner, etc. and also clothes for sale. Her extra income will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family. 

Irene aspires to expand and own a larger electronics/stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy electronic/stationery gadgets like toner, etc. and also clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, who is photographed in the picture, is a Palestinian single young man. Mohammad is employed and gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover his daily costs.

Mohammad is also studying at the university, specializing in Accounting. Mohammad wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Mohammad and improve his work and living conditions.

loans.use: To pay university fees

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a resident of Mariakani of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single business lady and runs a grocery stall selling potatoes, a business that she has been running for six months. She received the start-up capital from her brother.

She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of funds to grow the business and fluctuating prices. 

Aisha is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase food to stock, e.g., potatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard. She aspires to own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase food to stock, e.g., potatoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. She owns a green grocery which she has been operating for four years. In this business, Mary sells vegetables like tomatoes, kale, etc. She began the business from the income from her farming business, selling one cow to obtain start-up capital.

Mary learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and the seasonal business climate.

Mary is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables like tomatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase clothes and set up a boutique in addition to helping educate her children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like tomatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married businessman who owns a butchery, a trade he has run for about eleven years.  

He learnt of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to add meat to his butchery inventory, e.g., beef and poultry. 

The only challenges in the business are high competition and a lack of adequate meat supply, but Jeremiah is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to open other stalls/shops.

loans.use: To add meat to stock in the butchery, e.g., beef and poultry.

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady who owns a curio shop where she sells artwork, mostly loved by tourists. This business has been running for two years. Besides this, she also runs a transport business using a motorcycle she owns.

Naomy learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal business climate (mainly tourists and visitors) and the high cost of purchasing stock.

Naomy is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase more stock of curio-making raw materials. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of her family and provide for their school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of curio-making raw materials.

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru:
Хайрулло житель города Куляб. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Жена Хайрулло домохозяйка. У них маленький ребенок. 
Хайрулло предоставляет услугу, такси. Вот уже шест лет он занимается этим видом деятельности. Хайрулло берет кредит для приобретения нового автомобиля.
texts.en:
Khayrullo lives in Kulob. He is 42 years old, married, and has one child. Khayrullo's wife is a housewife. They have a small child. 

Khayrullo drives a taxi.  He has done this for six years. Khayrullo is taking out a loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single business lady who owns a salon which she has been operating for over three years.  

Maurine learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges she is facing are competition and lack of enough capital to expand the business, an issue she feels will be partly sorted by this new application/loan.  

Maurine is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of cosmetics, hair nutrients, and a dryer. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her acquire a college education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of cosmetics, hair nutrients, and a dryer.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Абдуманон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Абдуманон вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. У него имеется участок земли, где он сеет пшеницу, выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры. Этим видом деятельности он занимается девять лет. Абдуманон берет кредит для закупа семян пшеницы и топлива.
texts.en: Abdumanon lives in Shahrituz. He is 31 years old, married, and has four children. Abdumanon  and his wife farm. He has a plot of land where he sows wheat, vegetables, and melons. He has been doing this for nine years. Abdumanon is taking out a loan to buy wheat and fuel.

loans.use: to buy wheat and fuel.

loans.name: Sarpinoy

texts.ru:
Сарпиной жительница Яванского района. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Сарпиной занимается земледелием и выращиванием зернобобых культур. Также она занимается садоводством. Сарпиной при доме имеет участок земли, где сажает фруктовые деревья. Она каждый полгода получает спелые сочные фрукты. В этой области она десять лет. 
Сарпиной берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sarpinoy lives in Yavan. She is 46 years old, a widow, and has three children. Sarpinoy farms beans.  She also keeps an orchard. Sarpinoy has a plot of land in front of her house where she plants fruit trees. Every six months she gets ripe juicy fruit. She has been doing this for ten years. Sarpinoy is taking out a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Kongowea in Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of one school-going child. 

Jane owns a poultry-selling stall, a business that she has been running for 23 years. She also sells watermelons when they are in season. 

She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are the lack of funds to grow the business and fluctuating prices. 

Jane is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to purchase more birds for sale and rebuild a poultry shelter. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family, especially the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more birds for sale and rebuild a poultry shelter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 27-year-old young man. He is married and a father to a 1-year-old daughter.

For the past four years, Salah has been operating a mobile phones store, which is located in a distinguished place in the market and has many loyal customers and a good reputation among them. This makes his project a profitable one and the only source of income to the family, but in spite of being a successful project, it also needs more support to cover some costs.

Salah is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of mobile phones and accessories. This will meet the customers’ requests and increase the sales, which will improve Salah's income and enable him to create better living conditions for his family.

Salah is photographed inside his store.


About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en: Elisha has witnessed much growth over the last few months. Although the business began from the humble beginnings of hawking to various houses and centers, he now boasts a stall with steady customers. He is applying for a loan of 52,300 Kenya shillings to increase the stock of clothes over this festive season and other fast moving consumer goods. He says the target of owning a wholesale is still on course.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell and other fast moving consumer goods.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young Palestinian man. He is married and a father to four sons. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all of his family's needs.

Ahmad lives with his family in Rafah city in a small and modest house. He is looking to improve his family's living conditions by purchasing necessary home appliances.

Ahmad is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new refrigerator for his house. This will offer Ahmad and his family one of the necessary home appliances that will create better conditions at home.

This is Ahmad in the photograph. 

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in the Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. He believes this will be sorted once he purchases a water pump. 

Charles is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings. 

He looks forward to establishing the farming by increasing the acreage.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Katambo

texts.en: Katambo is taking out another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES. With the loan, he plans to construct a permanent family house, by purchasing roofing nails, gutters and cement. However, he says that he is still in his business of selling furniture. He gives thanks to Kiva lenders for the opportunity he has received and is now living a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase roofing nails, gutters and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
This is Alice, resident of Tiribe, Mombasa Kenya. She is married to a businessman and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alice operates a variety store which is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Kes 500 in sales every day.
In addition to this business, she is also a farmer where she grows a variety of vegetables and flowers for sell.Thanks to her children who assist her which gives her room to visit her farm.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Kes 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Biimu

texts.en:
Biimu is taking out another loan to invest it in her motorcycle business. She explains that she is still in her food vending business. She is glad that her business is doing well since the previous loan. With this new loan, she needs to repair her motorcycle to increase efficiency.

She is a very hardworking woman who has shown great interest in moving forward.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa, a quien ama y agradece todo su apoyo, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; Juan no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, puesto que su familia era numerosa y muy humilde, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de Mecánica Automotriz, en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para engreírlo, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Juan trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Juan se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque conoce las rutas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general de su taxi y podrá cubrir los gastos de la tramitación del seguro y formalización de su licencia de circulación; de esta manera Juan podrá tener su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is a 60 year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his wife, whom he loves and whose support he appreciates.  He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts toward getting ahead with his family.  Juan was not able to study for a college degree, because from the time he was very young he had to work to support his parents, as he came from a large and very humble family.  However, he really would have liked to have studied to become an automotive mechanic.  At times, his wife cooks a rich ceviche to pamper him, because this is his favorite dish.

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Juan works each day as a taxi driver, providing transportation service in his city.  He works each day from the very early hours of the morning, and he is able to work for about 10 hours a day.  Juan feels comfortable doing this work, and he believes his business is doing well because he knows the routes where he can find the greatest number of passengers.

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help that they are providing, he will be able to do some general maintenance work on his taxi and cover the bills for his insurance and licensing fees.  In this way, Juan will be able to  have his work tool in better condition, and so will be able to continue to work and exert himself so that he can achieve his greatest dream: to finish building his house.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his taxi and pay for his insurance

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y sus 2 pequeñas hijas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente cuando era pequeña sufrió la pérdida de su madre, desde entonces ella se dedico a apoyar a su padre y hermanos, debido a ello y la necesidad de trabajar, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Obstetricia que tanto deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta engreír a su familia invitándolos a comer un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa, el cual es el plato favorito de ellos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que ella desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta del piso de concreto en la habitación de sus pequeñas, de esta manera podrá brindarles un ambiente adecuado, con mayor seguridad y bienestar para ellas; así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijas convertidas en buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 32-year-old woman.  She lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago with her husband and two small daughters, who she loves and are her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who, together with her husband, dedicates all her efforts to getting their family ahead.  Unfortunately, when she was little she suffered the loss of her mother.  Since then she has devoted herself to supporting her father and brothers.  Due to that and the need to work, she wasn’t able to study the professional career of obstetrics that she so wanted but she would have liked very much to have been able do so.  In her free time she likes to pamper her family, inviting them to eat the delicious “Pollo a la Brasa” (a traditional Peruvian grilled chicken dish), which is a favorite dish of theirs. 

On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Rosa works in the fields on a large agricultural farm in her city.  She works every day from the early hours of the morning and can do it for approximately eight hours.  She feels comfortable doing her job and believes that it is going well for her because of her good performance and because of her kind treatment of others. 

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided she will be able to carry out some home improvements, as she wants to be able to plaster, paint and lay down a concrete floor in the room of her daughters.  In this way she will be able to provide them with a suitable environment, with better security and comfort for them.  Thus Rosa will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of seeing her daughters become good professionals.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor  Genardo es nacido en Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive con su esposa Martina en su comunidad con su familia y con su hijos menores, la descripción de su casa es rustico está construido de barro con techo de teja con revoques de barro la determinación de la vivienda es prácticamente rustico, la comunidad del cliente esta ubicado a 10 km al norte de la localidad de Tiraque camino por Rodeo. La actividad económica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos y cereales, la producción es estacional en la zona son alturas del valle alto. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de abono de gallina y semilla de papa, el cliente tiene interés de superarse sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años como también mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia, es por eso que el cliente vio necesario solicitar el préstamo de, los trabajos agrícolas lo realizan mayor parte toda la familia en algunos casos utiliza ayuda de sus vecinos para la siembra y la cosecha.
texts.en:
Genardo was born in Tiraque in the department of Cochabamba.  Currently he lives with his wife, Martina, in his community with his family and his young children.  His house is rustic: it's constructed of mud and has a tile roof with mud plastering.  The client's community is located 10 kilometers north of the town of Tiraque, toward Rodeo.  The economic activity there is agriculture, growing tubers and grains.  The production is seasonal in the high regions of the high valley.

The loan he's requesting is to buy chicken manure and potato seed.

Genardo is interested in improving his income as well as his own and his family's quality of life in the coming years.  This is why he requested the loan.  Most of his family does agricultural work and in some cases the neighbors help them with the planting and the harvest.

loans.use: to buy poultry manure and potato seeds

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: El señor Hernan es nacido en el  municipio de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive con su esposa Gerarda en su comunidad con su familia y con su hijo menor, la descripción de su casa es rustica está construido de barro con techo de teja con revoques de barro. La actividad económica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos y cereales, la producción es estacional en la zona, son alturas del valle alto. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de abono de gallina y semilla de papa, el cliente tiene interés de superar sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años como también mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia, los trabajos agrícolas lo realizan mayor parte toda la familia en algunos casos utiliza ayuda de sus vecinos para la siembra y la cosecha.
texts.en:
Hernan was born in Tiraque, in the Department of Cochabamba.  He lives with his wife Gerarda in his community with his family and with his youngest son.  His home is rustic, constructed of adobe with a tile and mud roof. The economic activity in this area is agriculture.  They produce tubers and grains.  Production is seasonal in this area due to the high valley altitudes.  

The loan that is being requested is to purchase chicken droppings for fertilizer and potato seeds.  The client would like to increase his income in the upcoming years and also improve his family's quality of life.  For this reason he is requesting a loan from our organization.  The agricultural work is done by most of his family, sometimes with the assistance of neighbors during planting and harvesting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jhonny Manuel

texts.es: El señor  Jhonny Manuel en Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive con su esposa Margarita en su comunidad con su familia y con su hijo menor, la descripción de su casa es rustico está construido de barro con techo de teja con revoques de barro la determinación de la vivienda es prácticamente rustico, la comunidad del cliente esta ubicado a 10 km al este de la localidad de Tiraque. La actividad económica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos y cereales, la producción es estacional en la zona son alturas del valle alto. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de plantas de cebolla, el cliente tiene interés de superarse sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años como también mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia, los trabajos agrícolas lo realizan mayor parte toda la familia en algunos casos utiliza ayuda de sus vecinos para la siembra y la cosecha.
texts.en: Jhonny Manuel in Tiraque, Cochabamba Department, currently lives in with his wife Margarita in his town with his family and his youngest son. Their house can be described as rustic. It is built with mud with a tile roof with plaster made of mud. His town is located 10 kilometers east of the city of Tiraque. He works in agriculture, growing tubers and grains. Production is seasonal in the area. They are in the high parts of Valle Alto. The loan he is applying for is to buy onion plants. He wants to increase his income in the coming years as well as improve his family's quality of life. The whole family does most of the farm work. Sometimes they get help from their neighbors for the planting and the harvest.

loans.use: to buy onion plants

loans.name: Delmi Ynes

texts.es:
Delmi es una mujer de 62 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, ella tiene 6 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; Delmi no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, puesto que su familia era muy humilde y no tenían los recursos necesarios para darles una buen educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para engreír a sus hijos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Delmi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Delmi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio, tales como polos, blusas, pantalones, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir; de esta manera Delmi seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su sueño de poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una gran boutique.
texts.en:
Delmi, 62, lives in the city of Chiclayo.  She has six children, whom she loves and who are her main motivation in life.  She's a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman who has devoted all her effort to getting her family ahead, because she has always been both father and mother to her children.

Delmi wasn't able to finish her elementary school education because from a very young age she had to work to help her parents.  Her family was very modest and didn't have the resources to give them a good education, but she very much would like to have studied for a professional career.  In her free time she likes to watch television, and sometimes she cooks a delicious spaghetti and tomato sauce to spoil her children.

On her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Delmi works every day in her small business selling clothing for women, men, and children.  She can work approximately 12 hours.  She's comfortable in her job and believes it's going well for her because of her good prices and her kind treatment of her customers.

Delmi is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy merchandise to supply her business: polo shirts, blouses, pants, shirts, and other garments.  This way Delmi will continue working and making the effort to achieve her dream of expanding her business and turning it into a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Julio Fernando

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Julio se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, él es un buen alumno, tiene muy buenas calificaciones y en poco tiempo espera poder convertirse en un buen profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Julio trabaja brindando atención al público en una empra de transporte de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sus materiales de estudios, tales como libros, cuadernos, folltería, ente otros; de esta manera Julio podrá seguir cursando sus estudios con los materiales necesario, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julio, 19, is single.  He lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings.  He's a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic young man who has a big desire for self-improvement.  Thanks to his effort and the support of his parents, Julio is studying for a career in business administration.  He's a good student who gets good grades, and he hopes that soon he'll become a good professional.

On his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Julio works providing services to the public in a transportation company in his city.  He works every day from early in the morning, and can work for approximately eight hours.  He feels comfortable in his work and believes it's going well for him because of his hard work and his kind treatment of others.

Julio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy books, notebooks, pamphlets, and other school supplies.  This way he'll have the necessary materials to continue his studies, and continue working and making the effort to achieve his big dream of being a professional and having his own house.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham Province's Dambae District in Cambodia, Leang is 63

To earn a living for his family, he has been working so hard in his rice growing business and cassava planting business for more than twenty years. Leang has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for a loan cycle already, with which he succeeded in securing food needs for his family.
