Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some home improvements like repair walls, build the façade, paint and install water pipes to provide his family with better quality of life and he can continue working towards making his greatest dream reality: to finish building his house and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Fiorella Yenefer

texts.es:
Fiorella es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de sus padres en la calurosa y alegre ciudad de Chincha, Fiorella es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella estudia actualmente la carrera de derecho en una de las universidades de su ciudad y para poder apoyarse con los gastos de sus estudios ella trabaja vendiendo ropa a sus compañeros de clase, vecinos y amigos de su barrio; ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día ya que por las noches va a su centro de estudios; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy carismática y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Fiorella está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como como short, pantalones, blusas, polos, entre otros y de esta manera tener mas mercadería y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes,de esta manera ella seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio, culminar su carrera y poder seguir apoyando a sus padres”.
texts.en:
Fiorella, 21, lives with her parents in the hot, cheerful city of Chincha.  Fiorella is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s currently studying Law at a local university and to help pay for her studies she works selling clothes to her classmates, neighbors and local friends.  She works about 8 hours daily because she attends classes at night.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s kind to all the customers and above all because she’s charismatic and very much wants to get ahead.

Fiorella is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy more merchandise like shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. for the business and thus have more merchandise and offer a wider variety to her customers.  In this way, she will continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to have her own store, to finish her career and to continue supporting her parents.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Jonny Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Parcona es conocido por su clima cálido, así como también por la generosidad de sus pobladores, también  se puede encontrar el bosque de piedras, el cual son formaciones rocosas en forma de animales y personas. Diana es madre de 3 pequeños a quienes  quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja al igual que su esposo para darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucha humildad. Cuando Diana tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión sobre todo sus novelas, en ocasiones le gusta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima Carapulcra. Diana debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Enfermería.

Con mucho entusiasmo Diana trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 5 horas diarias, ella recorre las casas de sus vecinas y amigas de su barrio y también ofrece sus productos en el mercado de su barrio como recorredora, puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y le gusta su trabajo.

Diana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su confianza y apoyo y gracias a ello Diana podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como Short, blusas, faldas, entre otros, así ella podar tener más productos para ofrecer y sus clientes tendrán más variedad de productos para escoger, de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando día a día con todo el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y seguir creciendo cada día”.
texts.en:
Diana’s a very hardworking, enthusiastic woman.  She lives in Parcona District in Ica, Peru.  Parcona district is known for its hot climate as well as for the generosity of its inhabitants.  The “Bosque de Piedras” (Stone Forest) is also found here which are rock formations of animals and people.

Diana is the mother of three little ones she loves very much and for whom she and her husband work very humbly to provide with a proper life.  When Diana has a little free time she likes to watch television, especially the serial dramas and sometimes she likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes, the delicious ‘Carapulcra.’  Because of her parents’ limited economic resources, Diana was only able to study up to fifth grade of secondary school but she would have liked to have studied Nursing.

With much enthusiasm, Diana works in her business selling clothes.  She works about five hours daily going from house to house visiting her neighbors and girlfriends; she also sells her products in the local market where she works and can see up to 20 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to customers and she likes her work.

Diana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this is the second time they’ve provided their trust and support and thanks to it Diana will be able to buy more merchandise like shorts, blouses, skirts, etc. for her business and she’ll have more products to offer and her customers will have a wider variety of products to choose from.  In this way, she will improve her income and continue working day to day with her typical enthusiasm to make her greatest dream reality: to provide her children with a good education and to continue growing every day.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eduardo Martin

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 32 años de edad vive en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, él es soltero y vive con los padres que son mayores y su hermano menor. Eduardo es una persona que comenzó a trabajar en el servicio del transporte público (Taxi) hace 5 años trabaja generalmente por la noches por que no encontraba trabajo pero así de esta manera continuo con sus estudios de Psicología (Egresado) gracias a su dedicación y trabajo, esta actividad le ayuda a generar ingresos para poder vivir actualmente pero también cuenta con una segunda actividad de COMERCIO DE POLERAS Y CAMISAS POLO  que trae del desaguadero. Desea salir adelante para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Eduardo colabora en los gastos familiares necesita este crédito para poder comprar mercadería para su segunda actividad por fin de año ya que existe bastante venta en esta época. El sueño principal de Eduardo es poder ejercer su profesión, hacer trabajar su taxi y obtener renta, también sueña con una casa propia y una familia el señor tiene dos actividades es taxista pero tambien vende ropa.
texts.en: Eduardo is 32 years old and lives in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz.  He is single and lives with his younger brother and his parents who are advancing in age.  Eduardo began to work as a taxi driver five years ago and he generally works at night because it allows him to continue his advanced studies in Psychology.  Thanks to his dedication and hard work, this job has helped him generate income to be able to live, but her also counts on a second job selling sweaters, shirts, and t-shirts that he brings from the Desaguadero river region.  He wants to get ahead in order to improve his quality of life.  Eduardo helps with the household expenses and he needs this loan in order to purchase merchandise for his second job, particularly because there is great demand during the holiday season.  His main dream is to be able to work in his field, to get his taxi to work and to obtain the rent.  He also dreams of owning his own home and having a family. He has two jobs - he is a taxi driver but also sells clothes.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell, such as t-shirts and dress shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for raising broiler chickens.

loans.name: Diana Estela

texts.es:
Diana tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de cuatro meses de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio junto a su abuela desde hace cinco años; su mamá se caso con otra persona y se fue de la casa; por eso Diana se quedo con su abuela y su esposo. Ella junto a su esposo instalaron una tienda de productos básicos, a la cual tratan de surtirla cada día, ya que desean brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. Para comprar los productos para su tienda, debe viajar a la ciudad, para eso camina  a pie unos treinta minutos, luego aborda el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad y tarda cuarenta minutos para llegar y luego regresarse a su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un quintal de fríjol, un quintal de azúcar, un quintal de arroz, dos garrafas de aceite, tres cajas de jabón, rinso, lejía y la otra parte para instalar la luz eléctrica en su casa. Actualmente, Diana traslada luz de la casa de su abuela hacia la casa de ella; pero lo ideal es que ella lo tenga solo para ella, además que comprara más productos, pues cada día los clientes demandan más productos y mejor atención a sus necesidades. Su objetivo es ahorrar, para comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, donde vive es de un familiar. Por otra parte desea que su negocio prospere para que sus vecinos no viajen a la ciudad en busca de productos; sino que los puedan adquirir en su tienda. Todo esfuerzo que realiza , es con la única finalidad de brindar a su hijo alimentación, salud, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
Diana, 24, is married and has a four-month-old son.  She and her grandmother have been merchants for five years.  Her mother remarried and left home which is why Diana lives with her grandmother and her husband.  She and her husband set up a grocery store that they try to stock every day because they want to provide good customer service.  To buy products for their store, she must travel to the city and to do so she first walks for half an hour to catch a bus that takes her to the city; it takes 40 minutes to get there and then she has to make the return trip home.

Part of the loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a quintal of beans, a quintal of sugar, a quintal of rice, two large jugs of oil, three boxes of soap, RInso [brand of detergent] and lye and the other part is to install electricity at home.  Diana currently transfers electricity from her grandmother’s house to hers but the ideal thing is for her to have her own.  She will also buy more products because customers demand more things every day to better meet their needs.  Her goal is to save up to buy a lot to build a house because where she lives now belongs to a relative.  On the other hand, she hopes her business will prosper so that her neighbors won’t have to travel to the city seeking products but will be able to buy them in her store.  All her efforts are aimed exclusively at providing her son with food, health, clothing and education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is 20 years old and is a very industrious bachelorette. To gain income, she sells different food products such as snack foods, banana cues, juices and breads. She patiently offers these goods and earns an income of PHP 4,000 each month. Her income goes for the daily allowances of her siblings who go to school. 

Annelyn aims to increase her income, so she is requesting for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy juices, snack foods, candies, biscuits and banana cues to sell. In the future, with a stable income, she will give enough allowances to her siblings.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Nicole Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Liliam de 46 años de edad, casada con tres hijos tiene 10 años de dedicarse a vender comida a trabajadores de empresas privadas cercana a su casa, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo y compra de utensilios de cocina , Jeannette tiene una mini  pulpería en su domicilio,Flor de Liz su negocio es venta de fritanga en su domicilio, Rosa Angélica vende frijoles cocidos, gaseosas, queso en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of four entrepreneurial members. One of these is Liliam, who is 46 years old and married with three children. She has been selling food to employees of private businesses near her home for the past 10 years. This loan will be used to purchase grains such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, and chicken, as well as kitchen utensils.

Jeannette runs a small grocery store out of her home.

Flor de Liz's business is selling fried food out of her home.

Rosa Angelica sells cooked beans, sodas, and cheese out of her home.

loans.use: purchase basic items such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, and chicken, as well as kitchen utensils such as skewers, ladles, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Las Lindas Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gema de 25 años de edad, soltera que hace dos años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos Avon, productos de Arabela. Estos los vende por encargos en su comunidad, el crédito lo utilizara en la compra de cosméticos Avon como  perfumes, crema para la cara, cremas para el cuerpos, crema para manos etc. Jennifer vende accesorios de acero como aretes, pulseras, dijes, anillos, Vilma vende cosméticos Avon y ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is formed by three entrepreneurial women partners. One of them is Gema, who is 25 years old and single. For the last two years she has made a living by selling Avon cosmetics and Arabela products. She sells these via pre-order in her community, and will use the loan to buy Avon cosmetics like perfumes, face cream, body lotion, hand cream, etc. 

Jennyffer sells steel accessories like earrings, bracelets, pendants and rings, and Vilma sells Avon cosmetics and new clothing.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing Avon cosmetics like perfumes, face cream, body lotion and hand cream.

loans.name: Hodson Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores tal es el caso de Sobeyda es una mujer casada con 26 años de edad posee un niño menor de 3 años se dedica a elaborar y comercializar pizza la cual las hace en su domicilio y las distribuye en los colegios cercano a su casa, cuenta con otra actividad como es la venta de ropa nueva,  ropa usada, zapatos usados, carteras usadas, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un carrito de comida chatarra  para vender pizza ambulante, Rosibel su negocio es la venta de alcancías, maceteros para plantas, comales de barros en un mercado de la capital y José Félix vende bisuterías y juguetes al por mayor y menor en los municipios cercanos a la capital.
texts.en: This group is made up of three hard-working members.  Sobeyda is a good example.  She is a married 26 year old woman who has a young three year-old child and works making and selling pizzas that she makes in her own home.  She sells them in the schools near her home.  She also has another activity which is selling new clothes, used clothes, used shoes, and used wallets.  She has been working in that field for four years.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of a cart for selling fast food in order to sell her pizzas while walking.   Rosibel is another member whose business involves selling pots for plants, corn grinding stones, and piggy banks in a market in the capital  The other group member, José Félix, sells toys and imitation jewelry in bulk and individually in the municipal markets close to the capital.

loans.use: to purchase a cart for selling fast food in order to sell her pizzas while walking.

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres microempresarias una de ellas es Santos Evangelina quien vende cosméticos de la Avon, productos Arabela, ropa, zapatos tiene 4 años de tener su negocio. Invertirá el crédito en cosméticos de la Avon como champo, perfume, colonias, cremas etc. Karla tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y Reyna tiene una pequeña librería, vende comida rápida y productos de la Avon.
texts.en:
The group is formed by three micro-businesswomen, one of whom is Santos who sells Avon cosmetics, Arabela products, and shoes. She has had her business for four years. She will invest the loan in Avon cosmetics such as shampoo, perfume, cologne, creams, etc. 

Karla has a grocery store in her home and Reyna has a small bookstore, and sells fast food and Avon products.

loans.use: to buy Avon cosmetics such as shampoo, perfume, colognes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de la Tinguiña,Ica,Perú. el distrito de la tinguiña se caracteriza por tener un clima  muy cálido y acogedor, Cesar vive al lado de su esposa quien lo apoya mucho en todo el hace.  Cesar aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que sus padres no tenían muchos ingresos y tuvo que trabajar para poder apoyarlos, es por ello que el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, aunque le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Cesar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de librería, él le dedica a trabajar en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería como adornos navideños, papeles decorados,  papel navideño,papelería en general, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:de ser un gran empresario.
texts.en:
Cesar is 40 years old. He lives in the district of Tinguiña, Ica, Peru. The district of Tinguiña is known for its very warm and hospitable climate. Cesar lives with his wife, who helps him a lot in everything he does. Cesar learned to work when he was very young, since his parents didn't have much income, and he had to work to be able to support them. It is for this reason that he was only able to go to school up to the fifth grade of secondary school. although he would have liked to study for a university degree.

Day after day Cesar works in his little stationery business. He works in his business about 10 hours a day, and he can assist about 20 customers daily. He believes that his business is going very well for him because he is very friendly to the customers and above all because he makes a great effort to advance.

Cesar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy merchandise such as Christmas decorations, decorated paper, and Christmas paper, among other items. In this way he will be able to have a variety of products to offer his customers and continue improving his quality of life, which will allow him to continue working to be able to realize his greatest dream: to be a great businessman

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as Christmas decorations, decorated paper, and Christmas paper, among other items

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras, Martha tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera con cinco  hijos de 24, 12, 5,7 y 22 años quienes le ayudan en la comercialización de la venta de leña, carbón al por mayor en los diferentes mercados de la capital, además vende tortilla en su casa, hace y vende pozol y tiene una mini pulpería, tiene 10 años de echar tortillas de esa forma ha venido diversificando sus actividades. Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, leña, carbón, granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Débora hecha y vende tortilla y hace nacatamales los fines de semanas y Claudia vende frijoles cocidos, leñas, cuajaditas en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is composed of three hard-working members.  Martha is 48 years old and is a single mother with five children ages 24, 12, 5, 7 and 22.  They help her with the sale of wood and coal in bulk in the different markets of the capital.  She also sells tortillas from her home.  She makes and sells pozole (a type of hominy soup), and she has a small store.  She has been making tortillas for 10 years and with that have come diverse business activities.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of corn, beans, wood, coal, basics grains like rice, sugar, and oil etc.  Another group member, Débora, makes and sells tortillas and makes tamales on the weekends.  Claudia, the third member, sells cooked beans, wood, and curds.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, wood, coal, basics grains like rice, sugar, and oil etc.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es: Ayda es una cliente exitosa que se tiene en su casa una pulpería desde hace 12 años, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos de 19, 27, 25,20 y 19años respectivamente, uno de sus hijos le ayuda en la administración del negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabón de lavar, jabón de baño, productos lácteos como crema, leche en bolsa, sopas magi etc.
texts.en: Ayuda is an existing client who's had a store in her home for 12 years. She's a single mom with 4 children aged 19, 27, 25, and 20 years old. One of her sons helps her run the business. She will invest the loan into the purchase of basic goods like rice, beans, sugar, washing soap, bath soap, and dairy products like cream, bags of milk, soups, Magi, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, beef, chicken, washing soap, and bath soap.

loans.name: José Saúl

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él toda su vida a trabajado en el cultivo de de granos básicos como fríjol, maíz y maicillo, fueron su abuelos y padres quienes le enseñaron. Con el paso del tiempo se caso y formo su propia familia; ellos son por los que José trabaja muy duro cada día. Desde hace 12 años se traslada a la capital del país a vender sorbetes naturales de manera ambulante por las calles y parques de la capital,  cada 15 días José viaja a la comunidad donde esta su familia a verlos y ha trabajar en el cultivo de maíz y fríjol que posee. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un frrizer, tubos, un carretón y un juego de llantas, para elaborar él los sorbetes y venderlos en la comunidad donde reside su familia y ya no viajar a venderlos a la capital. Pues esta lejos de su familia por mucho tiempo y será dueño de su negocio; por que actualmente es empleado. Espera obtener mejores ingresos para su familia y tener más tiempo para ellos.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, has a wife, and has one son.  He has worked his whole life planting basic grains like beans, corn and sorghum.  He was taught by his grandparents and parents.  With the passing of time he married and formed his own family.  José works very hard for his family each day.  He moved to the capital of his country 12 years ago in order to sell natural fruit drinks as a walking vendor in the streets and parks of the capital.  Every two weeks José travels to the community where his family lives to see them and to work in the corn and bean fields that they own.  

The loan that he is requesting from Kiva partner Fundación Campo is for purchasing a freezer, flatbed trailer, and tires in order to make and sell the fruit drinks in the community where his family lives and not have to travel anymore to sell them in the capital.  He is far from his family much of the time and this would make him the owner of his own business -- currently he is an employee for someone else.  He hopes to obtain better income for his family and to have more time with them.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, flatbed trailer, and tires in order to make and sell frozen fruit drinks

loans.name: Santa Julia

texts.es: Santa Julia tiene 33 años de edad madre soltera con tres hijos de 15,12y 13 años de edad, tiene una pulpería en su casa desde hace 4 años, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pampers, carne de pollo, carne de res, queso, crema atún etc.
texts.en:
Santa Julia is a 33-year-old single mother of three children who are 15, 13, and 12 years old. She has had a small grocery store in her house for four years. 

Santa Julia will invest this loan in the purchase of basic staples like rice, beans, sugar, oil, diapers, chicken, beef, cheese, cream, tuna, etc.

loans.use: to purchase staples like rice, beans, sugar, oil, diapers, chicken, beef, cheese, and tuna.

loans.name: Manuela  Lisseth

texts.es: Manuela es una microempresaria de éxito con 46 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos mayores de 26, 20 años de edad,  hace dos años vende ropa usada en su domicilio. El propósito del crédito es en adquirir paca de ropa usada de buena calidad.
texts.en: Manuela is 46 years old and a successful small businesswoman. She is a single mother of two adult children who are 26 and 20 years old. She has been selling used clothing out of her home for two years. The purpose of the loan is to acquire bales of good-quality used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Ideal Group

texts.es: Miembros del grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias de éxitos una de ellas es Thania mujer de 23 años de edad soltera se dedica a elaborar trajes típicos en su domicilio que los vende en el mercado de Masaya, lleva con la institución 7 años consecutivos, el crédito lo invertirá en materia prima como telas, dacron, conos de hilo, hilos de bordados, encajes adornos etc. Thelma vende frutas y verduras y Irene elabora trajes típicos.
texts.en: This group is composed of three successful small business owners, one of whom is Tania. She is a woman of 23 years who makes traditional clothes in her home that she sells in the market in Masaya. She has been with the institution for 7 consecutive years. The loan will be used to invest in raw materials such as fabric, Dacron [quilt batting], cones of thread, embroidery thread, lace trimming, etc. Thelma sells fruits and vegetables and Irene makes traditional clothing.

loans.use: purchase fabric, Dacron [quilt batting], cones of thread, embroidery thread, lace trimming, etc

loans.name: Jehova Nice Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario formado por cinco miembros microempresarios una de ellas es Angela quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 20 años en su domicilio, tiene 57 años y con un hijo mayor, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, carne de res, carne de pollo, etc. Esperanza tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, Nora Amalia vende pollos en piezas desde hace 20 años, María Magdalena hace y vende tortilla, pinolillo desde hace 15 años, Rosa vende joyas de plata desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
This is a group that is made up of five members, who are all small-business owners. One of them is Angela, who has been running a small grocery store out of her home for the past 20 years. She is 57 years old and has one adult child. She will use the loan to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, beef, chicken meat, etc.

Esperanza has a small grocery store that she runs out of her home; Nora Amalia has been selling chicken meat for the past 20 years; María Magdalena has been making and selling tortillas and cornmeal for the past 15 years; and Rosa has been selling silver jewelry for the past 5 years.

loans.use: to buy grains such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, beef, and chicken meat in pieces.

loans.name: Patricio Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es Marisol trabaja en artesanía en palma hace chischil, canastas y trenzas  de palma desde hace 4 años, es madre casada con dos hijos quienes les ayudan en su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como es la palma, Irma vende queso, huevo desde hace 6 años y José Domingo vende artesanía echa de palma.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three entrepreneur partners. One of them is Marisol, who works doing craftworks with palm. She makes rattles, baskets and palm braids for four years. She is married and is a mother of two children who help her in the business.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials such as palm.

Irma sells cheese and eggs for six years and José Domingo sells craftworks made of palm.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as palm.

loans.name: La Finca Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socio todos originarios de Masaya una de ellas es Concepción tiene 50 años y se dedica a vender carne de res desde hace 30 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de carne de res, Heidi de los Angeles vende ropa en el mercado  de la localidad y Cristian vende carne de res en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three members from Masaya.  One of them, Concepción, is 50 years old and has been selling beef for 30 years.  She is married and has six adult children.  She will use the loan to buy beef.  Heidi de los Angeles sells clothing at the local market and Cristian runs a beef home delivery service.

loans.use: To buy beef.

loans.name: Betania Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias de éxitos una de ellas es Nancy Carolina  desde hace dos años vende zapatos es soltera y los comercializa por encargo, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos, María tiene un taller de carpintería donde fabrica muebles de mimbres y de material ratán tiene cinco años de tener su negocio y  Rosmery   vende cosmético de la Avon por encargo y al crédito.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three successful micro-entrepreneurs, one of which is Nancy Carolina who has been selling shoes for two years.  She is single and sells on an order basis.  She will use the loan to buy shoes.  María has a carpentry business and makes wicker and rattan furniture.  She has been in business for five years.  Rosmery sells Avon cosmetics on a credit basis.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Reina quien tiene una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace dos años, es una mujer casada, luchadora quien tiene dos hijos menores, quienes le ayudan a cuidar y atender el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico etc. Silvia María vende pan ambulante desde hace 15 años en las calles de Masaya y Kenia desde hace dos años vende ropa y queso.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Reina who has been running a grocery store out of her home for two years.  She is married and works hard for her two minor children who help her take care of the store and attend to the public.  She will use the loan to buy basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet tissue, etc.  Silvia María has worked as a street vendor for 15 years in the streets of Masaya.  Kenia has been selling clothing and cheese for two years.

loans.use: To buy basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, toilet tissue, etc.

loans.name: Alvaro De Jesus' Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario formado por tres socios uno de ellos es Alvaro de Jesús desde hace 10 años vende trigos, maíz, frijoles. EL socio se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la siembra como semillas mejorada, insecticidas, fungicidas, preparación de terrenos, abono etc. Paula vende pollo a domicilio y Rosibel vende frutas y verduras en su domicilio.
texts.en: The communal bank Grupo Solidario is comprised of three members, one of whom is Alvaro de Jesús who has been selling wheat, corn and beans for ten years.  He is a farmer and grows grain for a living.  He will use the loan to buy supplies such as quality seeds, insecticides, and fungicides, and prepare the farmland with fertilizer, etc.  Paula sells chicken and Rosibel has a fruit and vegetable home delivery service.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as quality seeds, insecticides, and fungicides, and to prepare the farmland.

loans.name: Los Hernandez Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socios emprendedores una de ellas es Darling tiene 33 años de edad y vende ropa usada desde hace 5 años. El crédito lo solicitara para la compra de ropa de paca usada, Mayra vende también ropa usada y julia Mercedes vende ropa usada.
texts.en: This group has three entrepreneurial members.  One of them is 33-year-old Darling who has been selling used clothing for five years.  She is requesting the loan to buy bundles of used clothing.  Mayra and Julia Mercedes also sell used clothing.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxitos así se le denomina a Emiliana quien tiene 47 años, acompañada quien dice que hace 12 años se dedica a vender prendas de plata y bisuterías, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de Granada. Con la institución tiene tres años consecutivos  en los préstamos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de plata como anillos, aretes, pulseras, cadenas, dijes etc.
texts.en: 47-year-old Emiliana lives with her partner and can be described as a successful micro-businesswoman.  She says that she has been selling silver jewelry and costume jewelry for 12 years.  Her business is located in Granada market.  She has been taking out loans with the institution for three consecutive years and will invest her current loan in buying silver jewelry such as rings, earrings, bracelets, chains, charms, etc.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver jewelry such as rings, earrings, bracelets, chains, charms, etc.

loans.name: Merali

texts.es: Mareli es una microempresaria tiene 33 años de edad es originaria de Catarina es casada y tiene cinco hijos menores quienes le ayudan a cuidar el negocio, su negocio es la venta de artesanía y fritanga en su domicilio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la fritanga como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, verduras, perecederos entre otros.
texts.en:
Mareli is a 33 year old small businesswoman.  She is from Catarina, and she is married.  She has five minor children, and they help her take care of the business.  She sells handicrafts and fried food at her house.

She will use the loan to buy raw material for the fried food business.  She will buy things like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, and perishables, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, vegetables, and perishables, among others.

loans.name: Juana Argentina

texts.es: Microempresaria de éxito es doña Juana quien  tiene 69 años, viuda  y propietaria de una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 12 años y seis años trabajando con la institución en préstamos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, pamper, papel higiénico etc.
texts.en: This successful small business owner is Juana, who is 69 years old, widowed, and has been the owner of a general store located in her home for 12 years. She has worked with the loan institution for 6 years. She will invest the loan in beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, diapers, toilet paper, basic grains such as rice, etc.

loans.use: purchase beans, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, diapers, toilet paper, basic grains such as rice, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia es una microempresaria de éxito  quien tiene una pulpería desde hace siete años, es casada, con cuatro hijos. Uno de sus hijos mayores le cuidan y atienden el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, pamper, carne de res, carne de pollo etc.
texts.en: Silvia is a successful micro businesswoman. She has run a grocery store for the last seven years. She is married and has four children. One of her older children works in the business. She will invest the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, toilet paper, diapers, beef and chicken, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken, diapers and toilet paper

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en:
Shown in the picture is a 26-year-old married woman named Sokleap. She and her family reside in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. Sokleap is blessed with a son who is still dependent on her and too young for school.

To offer a decent life to her family, she has a business farming rice. To add more income to the family, Sokleap’s husband plants cassava and works for others as a paid worker. Together, this couple is able to earn around 9 USD per day and save approximately 5 USD after deducting the daily expenses. 

Sokleap is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is now requesting a 1,100 USD loan to purchase more plots of farmland. This hardworking woman, Sokleap, expects that, after receiving the requested loan, she can expand her business, earning greater profit and better supporting her beloved family. In the future, she also hopes that she can send her children to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase more plots of farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou, 24 years old, is a citizen living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is married and has a child.

To earn a living for the family, Chanthou and her husband farm rice and plant cassava and peppers. This couple also has a business buying and selling cassava in order to add more income for the family. The current businesses enables them to earn around 62,000 KHR per day.

This is Chanthou’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR to buy cassava in order to sell for more profit. Chanthou hopes to be able to expand her farmland so that she can increase her productivity and earn greater income for the family.

loans.use: to buy cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Saroen is 43-years-old and married. She has four children, two of whom are her dependents and still in school. The primary sources of her family’s income are from buying and selling fermented fish in the local area while her husband is a taxi-driver to earn additional income for the family. 

She has been with VisionFund for four years. This is the first micro loan for Saroen with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan of $1,000. With this loan, she is going to use it as a working capital to support her business by buying more fermented fishes to sell. She hopes to earn a large income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more fermented fish to sell.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en: Seang is 42 years old and a mother of three children, one of whom is still in school. She has two hectares of rice, and one hectare of cassava growing. She has engaged in this business for 21 years and is able to earn up to 16,200 KHR. Her previous loan was the original loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. Her past loan has helped her farm rice on time with high yield and she can set aside some money to expand her cassava growing business. Now, she has formed a group of two second-cycle-loan clients to apply for a new loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for both her cash-crops. She hopes this purchase will boost her productivity yielding a good profit, so she can buy a mini-tractor to support her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, a rural villager from the O Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, is a 35-year-old single lady who makes a living through rice farming and clothes tailoring. She has engaged in this business for 6 years and is able to save about 4 US dollars. For her, the main challenge is the lack of working capital for supporting her business. 

This is the first-cycle for Chantha with VisionFund, Kiva's partner (VisionFund). She is seeking a loan of USD $300 in order to buy another sewing machine for supporting her tailoring business. She hopes this purchase will help keep her business on time so as she can absorb more clients.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Nhuong's Group

texts.en:
Nhuong was born in 1969. She has two children. Her daughter is learning and in the 3rd grade. Her son is at learning and in the 5th grade. Her husband is a driver. Nhuong makes and sells cooked food in a market to earn a living. She earns 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to pay for her children’s education fees. Her dream is that her children can have good careers.

Other members who are part of Nhuong's group include the following: 
Quyen has a child. She sells clothes to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to do her job. 
Hien has two children. She raises pigs to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to raise pigs to sell.
Duyen has a child. She sells fresh fruit for a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to do her job.
Thuy has a child. She raises chickens to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.
Lieu was born in 1976. She has two children. She sews clothes and raises chickens to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Ana Doris

texts.es:
Ana tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de ocho años. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de chinas. Ella fue una de las favorecidas por FOMILENIO, ya que recibió una capacitación y resultado de eso opto por emprender este negocio. Ella solicito un préstamo para iniciar el negocio con otra institución que ya fue cancelado.

 Hoy en día solicita uno a Fundación Campo para incrementar el nivel de inventario de chinas, ropa para dama, caballero y niños; debido a que esta temporada navideña es muy buena. Ella tiene su puesto de venta en la calle del pueblo. La mercadería se la envía la empresa que distribuye lo que ella vende.

Con la inversión, podrá ayudar a su mamá, ya que es algo que siempre ha deseado. Además, comprara mobiliario para su casa; pues solo posee una mesa y dos sillas en la sala. Ana, considera que con el resultado de la inversión, comprara cosas para su mamá, su hija y para ella, como es la alimentación. En un futuro desea que su negocio crezca aún más, para emplear a otras personas que deseen superarse.
texts.en:
Ana, 23, is a single mother of an 8-year-old daughter.  She’s been selling sandals for a year.  She was one of those benefitted by FOMILENIO [government poverty-reducing program] because she took a training course and as a result of that decided to start this business.  She requested a loan from another institution to start the business and it’s already been repaid.

Today, she’s asking Fundación Campo for a loan to increase her inventory of sandals and clothing for women, men and children because the Christmas season is a very good one.  She has her stand on one of the streets in town and she’s sent the merchandise by the firm that distributes what she sells.

With this investment, she will be able to help her mother which is something she’s always wanted to do.  In addition, she’ll add furnishings to her house because she only has a table and two chairs in the living room.  Ana considers that as a result of the investment she’ll be able to buy things like food for her mother, her daughter and for herself.  In future she’d like her business to grow still more to hire others who wish to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy sandals and clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, uno de 12 años y otra de 7 años de edad. Ella se dedica desde hace 7 años al comercio, ha trabajo y se ha esforzado para que a sus hijos no les falte la comida. Durante cinco años elaboro tortillas por la mañana y por la tarde elaboraba pupusas para la venta. Actualmente, vende papitas fritas; Dora ha tenido que trabajar mucho ya que su esposo la abandono. Los insumos para preparar las papitas fritas, las compra en el mercado del pueblo y las transporta en una mototaxi hasta su casa que esta a dos kilómetros. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar papas, salsas, mayonesa, platos descartables, palillos de madera, gas y el resto para terminar de cancelar el carretón en donde fríe las papitas. Con la inversión, espera incrementar sus ingresos, para que a sus hijos no les falte el alimento, ya que comenta que ha habido ocasiones en que no han tenido que comer y ella no desea pasar por esa situación otra vez. También, desea comprar un refrigerador para almacenar la comida de su familia, mejorar la vivienda hacerla más grande y mejorar la infraestructura.
texts.en:
Dora is 44 years old, she is a single mother of two children aged 12 and 7 and she has been engaged in retailing for 7 years, putting all her efforts in her job in order to provided her children with the daily bread. For five years she has prepared tortillas in the morning and “pupusas” (a typical Salvadorian dish) in the afternoon to then sell them. These days she is selling French fries. Dora has had to work very hard since her husband left her. She buys the ingredients she needs to prepare French fires in the village market, transposition them with a moto taxi to cover the two kilometers from the market to her house.

The loan she is requesting to Fundación Campo will be used to buy potatoes, sauces, mayonnaise, reusable dishes, firewood and gas, as well as to finish paying off for the small wagon where she fries potatoes. She hopes to succeed in increasing her earnings thanks to the loan, in order to always have food for her children, as she says there have been times when they did not have anything to eat and she does not want to find herself in this situation again. She also wants to buy a fridge to store food for her family, and she wants to make improvements to her house making it bigger and with better structure.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, sauces, mayonnaise, reusable dishes, firewood and gas, as well as to finish paying off for her small wagon.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia, es una persona de 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltera pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola, produce papa, haba, cebolla y cebada en sus propios terrenos de herencia por parte de sus padres que se hallan situados en la comunidad de Sankayani Alto Los Andes del municipio de Tíraque distante a unos 80 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora Sonia manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para realizar la compra de terreno agrícola y de tal forma obtener mayores ingresos económicos que van a mejorar la calidad de vida de su dependiente.
texts.en:
Ms. Sonia is 24 years old, single but in a civil union. She reached an elementary school level education. She has a young son in her care and economic dependent.  
For a living, she works as a farmer, growing potatoes, fava beans and oats. She does this in her own farmland, which she inherited from her parents. They are located about 80Km from Cochabamba in the community of Sankayani Alto Los Andes, county of Tíraque.

Ms. Sonia demonstrates to be a hardworking and responsible person who wants to move ahead and increase farming production.  In order to do that, she needs to borrow investment capital to buy farmland, and through such means, obtain better economic income, which will improve the quality of life of her dependent.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. Él vive muy feliz con su familia, ellos deben caminar un kilómetro y medio a pie hasta llegar al lugar donde abordan el autobús, ya que viven en la cordillera de un cerro. A los 10 años de edad, empezó trabajando como jornal en las fincas de café, realizando actividades de poda, limpieza, fertilización, corta, entre otras más. Además, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y fríjol. Goza de una buena reputación en la comunidad, es responsable, con valores y principios. Hoy en día, es uno de los mejores albañiles de la comunidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 25 pliegos de láminas, pago de mano de obra para reforzar las paredes de su casa, ya que están elaboradas de bahareque. Con la inversión desea que su familia viva dignamente y segura.
texts.en:
Evelio is 30 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage and he has a 3-year-old son. He lives very happily with his family; they live on a hill in the mountain range and they have to walk for a kilometer and a half to reach the nearest bus stop. He has started working when he was 10 as a day laborer in small coffee farms, engaging in a few activities such as pruning, cleaning, fertilizing and cutting. On top of this he plants corn and beans. He has good reputation in his community, he is responsible, with good values and principles, and to today he is one of the best masons of his community.

The loan he is requesting to Fundación Campo will be used to buy 25 sheets of sandpaper, sheets of plywood and to pay for labor costs as he needs to reinforce the walls of his house, currently made of wattle and daub. He hopes that thanks to this loan his family can lead a decent and safe life.

loans.use: To buy 25 sheets of sandpaper, sheets of plywood and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Leke

texts.en:
Leke, who is in his early fifties, is married and has four children. They all live in a village in northern Albania. Because of his love for children, eight years ago, he purchased a minivan that he has been using it to take the children to and from school. 

“I wake up early in the morning and wait for the children to arrive so that I can drive them to school, including my own. During the summer months that the schools are closed, I use the vehicle to transport other people. However, during the school-time, I only use it for the children,” Leke said. 

“Recently, I experienced some problems with the minivan and I am not using it at the moment for safety reasons. This has caused some frustration within the community because parents have no vehicle to take their children to school. It would be very helpful for our community if I can start running the vehicle again,” Leke kept saying.  

Leke is requesting a loan to take the school minivan to an auto shop for the needed repairs.

loans.use: to take the school minivan to an auto shop for repairs.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El cliente Carlos tiene 31 años y radica en el trópico de Cochabamba, desde hace 10 años. Actualmente vive en la población de Entre Ríos. EL cliente es de la provincia CAPINOTA del departamento de Cochabamba, tuvo que irse al trópico para buscar mejores oportunidades de vida, porque en el lugar de origen la crisis era cada vez mayor,  falta de trabajo, malas cosechas,  por escases de lluvia ya que sus ingresos eran insuficientes para poder sobrevivir y  también eran muchos hermano en la familia, vio una opción de ver otros horizontes y uno de ellos fue el trópico de Cochabamba,  aunque los primeros años fue difícil pero con esmero y muchos esfuerzo y con la ayuda de un pariente cercano, y poco a poco se hizo amigos y uno de ellos le facilitaron una motocicleta para que trabaje en la cooperativa,   de esa manera podrá tener un ingreso económico, y ser mas solvente. Ahora el necesita un préstamo para empezar a construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, 31, has lived in the tropics of Cochabamba for ten years now. He currently lives in a village called Entre Rios and he is originally from the Capinota province, department of Cochabamba. He had to move to the tropics looking for better life opportunities, because his hometown had a growing crisis: unemployment and bad crops because of the lack of rain.

Seeing that his income was not enough for surviving, and because his family is big, he realized there was an opportunity to look for a better future, and that was in the tropics of Cochabamba. Even though things were difficult the first few years, a close relative helped him and he made good friends. One of them lent him a motorcycle so that he could join a cooperative, have a stable income and stay solvent.

He is requesting a loan to build his own house.

loans.use: to build his own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes to re-sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey, 30 years old, has been with HKL for three loans already. She is well known for her loyalty in paying back her loans. She is a resident living with her husband and two children in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province, where she operates a rice farm and generates income from farming activities. She has been doing this for about twelve years.

In order to make improvements in her family-owned business, Mey would like to have additional capital for her husband's animal sales business. Her husband will use the loan to purchase cows from local regions and will resell them for profit. She hopes that this loan will be great for the business, and they might have a good income through this.

loans.use: to purchase cows from local regions to resell for profit.

loans.name: Awa Peulh's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe du banc villageois de Sikilo ouest est né depuis 1998 date d’inauguration. Il est compose de  femmes braves qui s’activent dans le petit commerce.

Madame Awa (assise à droite) est responsable vedette, âgée de 55 ans, veuve et mère 07 enfants dont (03 garçons et 04 filles).
Elle achète des "thioub" (tissus teintés) dans les pays voisins à 300 000 FCFA, elle est aussi vendeuse des légumes au  marché central de la ville, elle s’approvisionne à hauteur de  25 000 FCFA  renouvelable toutes les semaines. Ces produits sont revendus à 40 000 FCFA  à l’unité et fait presque un bénéfice de 75%  et une recette journalière assez importante.

Avec son bénéfice, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne, la scolarité des enfants leurs soins et renforcer son épargne au sein du Bv
texts.en:
The group of the West Sikilo banc villageois was established in 1998. It is made up of courageous women who participate in small businesses.

Mrs. Awa (seated at right [in the photo]) is the featured borrower; she is 55 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children (three boys and four girls). She purchases dyed cotton cloth in neighboring regions for 300,000 CFA francs, and also sells vegetables in the central town market. She gets her supplies for 25,000 CFA francs each week. These goods are resold for 40,000 CFA francs per unit, turning a profit of nearly 75% and making for a sizeable daily revenue.

With her profits, Mrs. Awa plans to see to the daily expenses, her children's school fees and care, and to increase her savings with the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy dyed cotton cloth and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois dont ce groupe fait partie a été créé le 18 Septembre 2010. Il est composé de membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Rocky l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 23 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter un boeuf à 100 000 frs et recharger sa boutique en marchandises diverses avec le reste du prêt. 

Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent d'assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et de prendre en charge les soins de santé de ceux-ci.
texts.en:
The banc villageois of which this group forms a part was created on September 18, 2010. It is composed of a members with a good social cohesion. Their principal activity is selling consumer goods. 

Standing on the right side of the photo and raising her hand is Rocky, the 23-year-old featured borrower. She is married and the mother of 3 daughters. With the loan she received, she will buy a cow at 100 000 francs CFA and restock her boutique with various consumer goods with the rest of her loan. 

The profits from her business will allow her to pay her children's school fees and the cost of their health care.

loans.use: to buy a cow and consumer goods for resale

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra Milena de 28 años de edad, se ha dedicado a laborar en confección a terceros realizando ensamble y terminado de camisas desde la sala de su casa. Actividad que le permite sostener a sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad y colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es poder montar su negocio con el cual pueda generarles empleo a madres cabezas de hogar, porque es conciente de la necesidad de la que carecen muchas familias en su municipio. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una maquina plana que le permita mejorar su capacidad de producción y le genere mayores ingresos para compartir con su familia una feliz navidad.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena is 28 years old. She has worked for third parties assembling and finishing shirts from the living room of her house. This work allows her to support her two children, ages 4 and 2, and collaborate with her husband on the household expenses. 

Her greatest wish is to be able to open her own business, with which she could offer employment to women who are heads of household, because she is conscious of the necessities that many families in her municipality lack. Currently, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a tabletop sewing machine that will allow her to improve her production capacity and give her more earnings, in order to give her family a happy Christmas.

loans.use: to purchase a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Manuel Adan

texts.es:
Manuel de 49 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Se dedica a las labores del campo desde hace 30 años, actividad que heredó de su padre. En la actualidad labora en una finca del municipio de Sonsón, Colombia,  como jornalero. Su patón se ofreció a prestarle una parcela para que comience a sembrar. Su sueño es poder tener su propio negocio, pero no cuenta con los recursos para la siembra. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de semillas y abonos para un cultivo de fríjol. 

Su familia es lo más importante para él, por eso manifiesta que su principal motivación será laborar todos los días de sol a sol para comprar una vivienda, ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Manuel, 49, is married and has three minor children.  For 30 years he has worked as a farmer, having inherited the trade from his father.  Currently, he works on a farm in the town of Sonsón, Colombia, as a hired worker.  His landlord has offered him a patch of land to begin planting.  His dream is to have his own business but he does not have enough resources to plant crops.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant beans.

His family is what matters most for him, so he says his main motivation is to work every day from sun up to sun down to buy a home for his children, give them a better lifestyle and a good education.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to plant beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Erlinson Alfonso

texts.es: Erlinson de 24 años de edad es un claro ejemplo de que cuando se quiere salir adelante no existen obstáculos. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la ebanistería, oficio que aprendió por medio de videos de la Internet.  Siempre le llamó la atención el oficio y como no contaba con lo recursos para ingresar a una academia, se dedicó a prender desde su casa. En la actualidad fabrica sillas, cajones para amplificadores y forra muebles. Esta actividad ha sido el sustento para él y su familia ya que tiene dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad a los que les debe educación y alimento. Su mayor deseo es poder tener su negocio con las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de toda clase de artículos de madera, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que espera financiar la compra de madera, pintura y una máquina pulidora para mejorar sus capacidad de producción y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erlinson, who is 24 years old, is a clear example of "where there's a will, there's a way." For the last four years, he has worked as a cabinetmaker, a trade he learned from watching videos on the internet. He was always drawn to the trade, and since he lacked the resources to enroll in a vocational school, he dedicated himself to learning at home. Currently, he builds chairs and speaker cabinets, and finishes furniture. 

This business has sustained his family and him; he has two children, ages 3 and 6, for whom he must provide education and food. His greatest wish is to have a business equipped with all the tools necessary to make all sorts of things out of wood. For that reason, he is requesting a loan with which he plans to purchase wood, paint, and a sander so he can improve his production capacity and offer his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, and a sander.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Kun is 49 years old and a married mother who has been blessed with six children. She resides in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support her family, she has been raising ducks for four years. She is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day and manages to save almost 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Kun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles. Her past loans, which she has successfully paid back, have relieved her family’s burden and improved their livelihood. Now she would like to acquire a loan of 1,500,000 KHR from VisionFund. Kun will use this loan to buy more ducklings to raise and use a portion of it to purchase duck feed. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her ducks so as to sell them for a good price and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more ducklings to raise

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
Lon is a 39-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

Cassava planting is the main source of the family’s income. Lon has been in this business for six years. Sometimes her husband also complements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 32,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 9,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Lon has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. The first loan has helped Lon to support her current business. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. 

Lon wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to get a high yield from her cassava planting so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat is a villager from a rural area of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She is 33 years old and married. Sarat has two children, all of whom are currently in school. To support the family, she has been involved in farming rice while her husband works as a motor repairer in a local area to earn additional income for the family. Her family’s daily income is approximately 15,000 KHR but she can manage to save about 10,000 KHR per day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Sarat has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her living conditions. Now she is leading her group to seek another loan. Sarat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it on buying spare parts for her husband’s business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to better her family’s standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is a 35-year-old rice farmer who lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He is a widowed father of one daughter who is still in school. Savy grows rice on a nine-hectare area of farmland. He has been a farmer for ten years.

Savy is a first-time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. With this loan, he is going to use a portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. He hopes this his rice will be healthful and timely, so as to sell it for a good price and to improve his standard of living and keep his daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn, a 52-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living, she has been farming rice on three hectare of farmland and raising pigs while her husband helps to earn additional income for the family by distilling alcohol in a village. The current business earns them about 40,000 KHR per day and manages to save them about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Khorn has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the previous loans while the other member in the photo is just with VisionFund this cycle. The past loans have helped Khorn to support her business. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. Through this loan, she hopes to fatten her pigs in order to sell them for a good price to better her living condition.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising.

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Yom, 61, is a rice farmer in a rural village of the Pursat Province’s Sampov Meas district of Cambodia. She has six children, one of whom is dependent on her, and they are still in school in the local area. She has been growing rice on two hectare of farmland as well as planting watermelon, cassava and bean for twenty years. She is able to earn about 17,000 KHR per day, but she can manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day. 

Yom’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and she is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a cow to help her in the farming business. Yom hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her paddy field so as to fulfill her dream to buy a tractor for supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to help her in farming business

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en: Kanha is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one daughter in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district. Her daughter is in school. Raising pigs is the only primary source of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for two years. Her husband is a car-taxi driver to help better support the family. The current business earns them approximately 27,000 KHR and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. This is Kanha’s second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She fully repaid her past loan, which has helped her better support her family with enough food as well as her daughter’s education. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. She wants to use this loan to buy spare parts to repair her car. She hopes to earn more income for her family so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair her car

loans.name: Proeng's Group

texts.en:
Proeng, aged 60 years, is a married mother of four children who has been engaged in rice growing and pigs raising in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been in this business for ten years. The current occupation earns her approximately 13,000 KHR per day and manages her to save about 8,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Low yield resulted from flood is the main challenge for her farming business. 
Proeng’s group consists of two members and she is in her first microloan with VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Proeng will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy pig feeds. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully so as to better off her living condition.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Eudal

texts.es: El señor Eudal  tiene 25 años, vive con su esposa Sandra en un cuarto alquilado, ambos se encuentran estudiando en la universidad. Ellos se dedican a la producción de maíz como también crían cerdos cabañeros, ellos obtienen ingresos de ambas actividades para cubrir sus gastos de estudios, ropa, vivienda, alimentación y otros que tienen, es por eso  que ellos están solicitando crédito ya que tienen lechones y también cerdas madres que están en etapa de gestación y necesitan alimento balanceado para que los engorden a los lechones y vendan a fin de año ya que el precio es muy favorable. Ellos se dedican a estas  actividades y con los ingresos que adquieren quieren culminar  sus estudios superiores y así tener un trabajo y mejores condiciones de  vida.
texts.en: Eudal, 25. lives with his wife Sandra in a rented room. They are university students and grow corn and raise pigs. They earn income from both activities that pays their education, clothing, housing, food, and other expenses. They are applying for a loan because they have piglets and sows that are gestating. The animals need nutritious feed to fatten so that they can be sold at year end when prices are most favorable. Eudal and Sandra will use the income from their businesses to finish their college education, to continue their work, and to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy nutritious feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier tiene 54 años de edad, vive con su esposa María, su domicilio esta ubicado en Municipio de Monteagudo. Su principal actividad es producción de tejas, viguetas y lavanderías con material de cemento, al igual que venta de agregados (ripio, arena, piedra) para la construcción a si mismo se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino. Tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la Universidad, es por eso que trabajan arduamente para cubrir los gastos de estudios y otros de sus hijos, para que estos puedan salir profesionales y tener una mejor vida. Están solicitando crédito para sembrar maíz que será destinado para alimentar sus cerdos, los cuales son criados en su terreno, su esposa es quien lo colabora en esta actividad. Con esto mejoraran la alimentación de sus cerdos, lo que podrá significar ingresos adicionales  que les ayudara a cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Javier, 54, lives with his wife María in their home in the city of Monteagudo. They make bricks, beams, and laundry tubs with cement and also sell building aggregates (gravel, sand, and stone). They also raise pigs. Javier has four children in college, so they work hard to pay their education and other expenses, in hopes that the children have professional careers and a better life.

They are applying for a loan to plant corn to feed the pigs they are raising on their land. María helps her husband with the work. They will buy better feed for the animals, which should increase income and help them pay for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy corn seed to plant.

loans.name: Rolando Rucio

texts.es: El señor Rolando, es una persona de 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltero pero vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo la cual es su pequeña hija. La actividad económica principal a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa y arveja en sus terrenos de herencia y en terrenos prestados por parte de sus padres políticos que se hallan situados en la comunidad de 15 de octubre del municipio de Tíraque distante a unos 68 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba; asimismo como segunda actividad económica complementaria presta sus servicios de cortador de leña de eucalipto en esta misma zona; trabaja en sus tiempos libres en otras actividades. El señor Rolando manifiesta ser una persona responsable que quiere superarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital para realizar la construcción de su propia vivienda y de tal forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rolando is twenty-two years old.  His civil status is single, although he lives with his partner.  He finished studying elementary school, and is responsible for an economic dependent, his small daughter.  

His main economic activity in which he makes a living is agriculture.  He grows potatoes and peas on lands he inherited and on those provided by the government located in the community of 15 October in the distant Tiraque municipality, about 68 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  

As a second economic activity, he also offers his services as a woodcutter of eucalyptus trees in this same area.  In his free time, he works in other activities.  Rolando says he is a responsible person who wants to make himself better and improve his life situation.  For this purpose, he sees the need to request capital for the construction of his own home and to therefore improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to construct his own house.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber tiene 26 años vive en la zona de la Maica - Kaspichaca, al oeste en el callejón, tiene dos hijos pequeños, casado con MARLENE han logrado poco a poco consolidar su granja donde producen leche cruda y entregan a la Planta Industrializadora de Leche, la actividad lechera en la zona es intensiva, tienen buen hato lechero que manejan familiarmente, entregan gran parte de su producción, su ganado es de raza mejorada, trabajan en los terrenos que los padres les han heredado.  Actualmente tienen la necesidad de comprar una puerta para el ingreso a la vivienda y granja, en los anteriores años han podido levantar los muros de su terreno y está sin protección, indica que las vacas se podrían salir, ingresar personas no deseadas y robar algo, es por tal motivo que está solicitando el crédito para la construcción de un muro para cuidar a sus vacas se puede ver en la foto al señor wilber con su esposa en un día normal de trabajo, con la ayuda ello iran mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber, 26, lives in the Maica-Kaspichaca area, in the west, in El Callejón.  He has two young children and is married to Marlene.

Little by little they have managed to strengthen their farm, where they produce raw milk and sell to the industrial milk plant.  Milk production is intensive in the area.  They have a good dairy herd that the family manages, selling a large part of the production.  Their livestock is a high-quality breed.  They work on land their parents gave them.

Currently they need to buy a gate for the entrance to the house and farm.  In previous years he has been able to build walls on his property, and they're not protected.  This means the cows could leave or undesirable people could come in and steal something.  This is why he's requesting the loan to build a wall to protect his cows.

The photo shows Wilber and his wife on a normal work day.  With the help they'll be able to continue improving their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to build a wall to protect his cows

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo tiene 40 años de edad y hace varios años ya  que se dedica a la actividad de transporte de pasajeros público  y casi un año que se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa distribuidora de productos comestibles en la ciudad de Tarija. Nos cuenta que la actividad de servicios de transporte público urbano (taxi) es su mayor ingreso familiar del cual dependen tanto su esposa como su hija que solo tiene 4 años de edad y que necesita el apoyo de sus padres; es por tal motivo que realiza la solicitud de este crédito para la reparación de su vehículo y rehabilitarlo poniéndolo de nuevo en servicio que no solo genera ingresos para su familia sino que paralelamente genera una fuente de empleo que lo da a su chofer que es una persona conocida y confiable; de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar apoyando a su familia que es lo más importante para el cliente.
texts.en: Reynaldo is 40 years old and has been transporting public passengers for several years now. For nearly one year he has also been providing a transport service to a company in Tarija that distributes food products. He says that his urban public transport service (taxi) is the main source of income for his family, and that his wife and daughter, who is only 4 years old and needs her parents’ help, depend on this income. For this reason he is requesting this loan to repair and restore his vehicle. The car will then return to service, generating income for his family and also providing employment to the driver who is someone he knows well and is trustworthy.  In this way he can improve his quality of life and continue supporting his family which is this client’s priority.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle (taxi)

loans.name: Tito Angelo
