texts.es: Tito tiene 22 años vive en el departamento de La Paz en la Zona de Tembladerani, comenzó a trabajar con esta actividad hace 2 años y a la edad  de 20 años en el comercio de Abarrotes en una pequeña Tienda de Barrio  para poder obtener  más  ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos de alimentación y algunos servicios de la casa. Tito se independizo a  los 18 años, pero vive actualmente  en casa con su mama a la cual le colabora con gastos del domicilio y cuida también a su abuelita el vende en estos productos en su tienda y tiene experiencia de dos años en esta actividad y se sacrifica en diversos horarios para poder vender mas. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería (Refrescos, Cerveza, dulces, etc.) por fin de año donde existe mas demanda y venta es mayor , para así poder salir adelante y lograr muchos más sueños que él tiene, específicamente tener en un futuro una tienda mas grande donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y así cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Tito is 22 years old and lives in the department of La Paz in the zone of Tembladerani. He began to do this work 2 years ago, and at the age of 20, he started in the grocery business in a small neighborhood store in order to obtain more income to cover the costs of food and some household services. 

Tito became independent at 18 years old, but he currently lives in his mother’s house, with whom he collaborates on the home expenses and also cares for his grandma. 

He sells these products in his store; he has two years of experience in this work, and he conforms to various schedules in order to be able to sell more. The loan that he’s requesting is for the purchase of merchandise (soft drinks, beer, candy, etc.) - because at the end of the year, there is more demand and sales are higher – in order to get ahead and achieve many of the dreams that he has: specifically, in the future, to have a bigger store where he can offer his products and in that way fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks, beer, cookies, candy, etc.).

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La señora Isabel tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son dependientes de ella ya que aún están en edad escolar, vive en la provincia colcapirua de Cochabamba en la zona oeste, perseverante con sus metas, sus hijos están estudiando y son alumnos muy buenos, todo eso logro gracias a la venta de quesillos  que ella misma elabora, los cuales son vendidos en su totalidad a una panadería de la zona en la que vive. Su esposo Carlos tiene el mismo empeño en cuanto a su trabajo el señor se dedica a la perforación de pozos de agua, en lo cual es muy bueno porque cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en su labor, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar forraje para sus vacas y así seguir con la elaboración de quesillos ya que utiliza la leche que producen las vacas que son de su propiedad.
texts.en: Isabel is 41 years old and has two dependent children of school age. She lives in the province Colcapirua in Cochabamba in the western zone of Colombia. She is working hard to meet her goals and her children are in school and are very good students. All of this is made possible by selling the cheeses that she makes to a local bakery.  Her husband Carlos is just as devoted to his job drilling wells for water, which he is very good at thanks to 20 years of experience. The reason for this loan is to buy fodder for her cows to continue making cheese from the milk her cows produce.

loans.use: buying fodder to feed her cows

loans.name: Reinalda

texts.es: La señora Reinalda tiene 35 años, vive con su  esposo, tienen 3 hijos que dependen de ellos. uno se encuentra cursando el primero básico en la escuela de la Comunidad, su otro hijo tiene 4 años  y el menor todavia es un bebe.Ella y el esposo se dedican a la cría de cerdos y a la producción de maíz, pero  el diario vivir de la señora Reinalda es muy sacrificado ya que ella también tiene que atender a sus hijos y los que aceres de la casa. Los ingresos que tiene no son suficientes para proporcionar una buena vida a su familia,ella necesita un credito crédito para  invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar el alimento balanceado de los cerdos, ya ste es su actividad principal, con esto ellos esperan incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Reinalda is 35 years old, lives with her husband, and they have three children that depend on them. One is enrolled in first grade at the school in the Community, another child is 4 years old, and the youngest is still a baby. She and her husband make a living by raising pigs and growing corn, but Mrs. Reinalda’s daily life is sacrificed because she has to care for her children and do household chores. Her income is not sufficient to provide a good life for her family, so she made the decision to ask for a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies to prepare a balanced diet for the pigs and thus save a little on expenses since this is her principal activity. In this way she will have a little more income, which will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a balanced diet for her pigs.

loans.name: Olivia Nadeska

texts.es: La cliente, Olivia, es una señora de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos dependientes, la cliente se dedica a vender productos cosméticos de perfumería en la ciudad de Cochabamba, si bien sus ingresos que genera es muy poco en la actividad que realiza, no le es suficiente para los gastos de su familia, la escuela de sus hijos, la vestimenta, la alimentación, etc. La casa donde vive la cliente queda ubicado en la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona oeste, aproximadamente a 2 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente es propia y de su familia, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para invertir en más mercadería (capital de operación del negocio a la que se dedica  la cliente), y de alguna u otra manera satisfacer las necesidades de su familia en los gastos que se producen diariamente, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de al cliente.
texts.en:
The client, Olivia, is a 31-year-old woman, is married and has two dependent children. She makes a living by selling perfume cosmetic products in the city of Cochabamba. While the income she earns is very little for the business that she does, it isn’t sufficient for her family's expenses, school for her children, clothing, food, etc. The house where the client lives is located in the western area of the city of Cochabamba; the client currently lives in the western zone, approximately 2 km from the city of Cochabamba. She and her family own the house they live in. 

The purpose of the new loan from the institution is to invest in more merchandise (operating capital for the client’s business) and in some way or another meet the needs of her family in their daily expenses. We relate this little story about the client for this reason.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (cosmetics)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa de su hermana Isabel alquilado, el domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Candua. Sus principales actividades del cliente es la producción y venta del cultivo de frejol y sésamo, trabaja en terrenos alquilados, las parcelas de trabajo están ubicado en la comunidad de San Miguel de las Pampas a 15  Km. de nuestra ciudad de Monteagudo. Juan es soltero, vive y trabaja solo, es por eso que trabaja arduamente para cubrir los gastos de alquiler de su vivienda, alimentación, vestimenta y otros que tiene, por otra parte también  para pagar el alquiler de terreno donde cultiva el frejol y sésamo. Esta solicitando crédito para comprar agroquímicos  y también pagar la mano de obra del personal eventual para el fumigado, ya que las parcelas tienen hierba por la mucha lluvia que se ha presentado en estos días.
texts.en: Mr. Juan is 26 years old; he lives and rents his sister’s home (Isabel) in the Candua area. His main work is in growing and selling beans and sesame crops. He works on rented land and the parcels are located in the community of San Miguel de las Pampas, some 15 km. from the city of Monteagudo. Juan is single, lives and works by himself and is the reason why he works so arduously, to cover the costs of renting his home, buying food and clothing as well as other expenses, he also works to pay for the land he rents where he grows his beans and sesame. Juan needs a loan to buy agricultural chemicals and pay for labor to fumigate the land since the parcels have grass due to a lot of rain that has hit the area.

loans.use: buy agricultural chemicals and pay for labor.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El cliente, Arturo, es un señor de 46 años de edad, está casado el cliente trabaja como profesor de primaria en una escuela lejana de la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona oeste de la ciudad, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa en alquiler, ambos tienen 2 hijos dependientes y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la  refacción de vivienda,  la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento, esto les brindara tranquilidad en las épocas de lluvia.
texts.en: This client, Arturo, is a 46 year old man. He is married and works as an elementary school teacher at a school in the city of Cochabamba. Right now he lives in an area west of the city, about 10 km from the city of Cochebamba. He doesn't own the house he lives in and rents it with his wife. They have two dependent children and the new loan from the institution will be used  to do some repairs on it. It has a lot of wear and tear from the passing of time. Humidity from the constant rains in the city has damaged the lower part of the walls in the house. It is rainy season and the house needs maintenance. This will bring them peace of mind during the rainy season.

loans.use: to some home repairs.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: El señor Fermín tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa Felicidad, su domicilio esta ubicado en el Municipio Monteagudo. Cantón Fernández comunidad Camalote. Sus principales actividades de los clientes son la cría y venta de ganado porcino mejorado, como también venta de ganado vacuno, por otra parte produce y vende maíz amarillo duro una parte y con lo restante lo alimenta sus cerdos como para la alimentación de ellos mismos. Fermín Tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, es por eso que trabajan arduamente para cubrir los gastos de estudios y otros de sus hijos, para que estos puedan continuar sus estudios hasta salir profesionales y tener una mejor vida. Están solicitando crédito para sembrar maíz que será destinado para alimentar sus cerdos, Con esto mejoraran la alimentación de sus cerdos, lo que podrá significar ingresos  que les ayudara a cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Fermín is 40 years old. He lives with his wife, Felicidad. Their house is located in the town of Monteagudo., Fernández canton, in the community of  Camalote. The client's main activities are raising and selling pigs as well as cattle. He also grows yellow feed corn and sells some of it and uses the rest to feed his pigs. Fermín has 3 children who are in school. They are why he works hard to cover the school and expenses of his children so that they loan keep going to school until they have careers and a better life. He is asking for a loan to plant corn to be used to feed his pig. This way, he will improve their feed and that will mean income that will help cover the cost of his children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials to plant corn.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel  tiene 23 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años en casa de sus suegros, padre de sus esposa, el domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Vallecito a 35 Km. de nuestra ciudad de Monteagudo. Ellos se dedican a la producción de maíz como también crían cerdos cabañeros, obtienen ingresos de ambas actividades para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, ropa, vivienda y otros que tienen. Están solicitando crédito para el alimento balanceado de los lechones y también cerdas madres que están en etapa de gestación. Los lechones son para engorde  y  venta a fin de año ya que el precio en esta época del año es muy favorable. El mayor deseo de Miguel Ángel es mejorar sus ingresos para poder adquirir su propio terreno para trabajar en el campo y construir su casita y así poder proporcionar una mejor vida para su esposa e hijo.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel is 23 years old. He lives with his wife and his 4-year-old son in his wife's parents' house. The house is located in the village of Vallecito, 35 kilometers away from the city of Monteagudo. They grow corn and also raise breeding pigs. From both these businesses they obtain profits in order to pay for their clothing, food, housing and other expenses. They're requesting a loan to purchase balanced feed for the piglets and the sows who are currently gestating. The piglets are for fattening and selling at the end of the year, since prices are very favorable during this time of the year. Miguel Ángel's biggest wish is to increase his profits so that he can acquire his own plot of land for farming and also build a little house of his own. Therefore he'll be able to improve his wife's and his son's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor tiene 28 años de edad, vive en cuarto alquilado. Su principal actividad del cliente, servicio de transporte publico en la Ciudad de Monteagudo, su horario de trabajo comienza desde las 5:30 AM. Y termina alrededor de las 11:00 PM. El diario vivir del señor Víctor a es muy agotador, el lucha día a día para llegar a tener un futuro mejor. Víctor es soltero, razón por la cual trabaja arduamente para cubrir los gastos de alquiler de su cuarto, alimentación, vestimenta y otros gastos. Esta solicitando crédito para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación de motor y así poder seguir trabajando con su vehículo y seguir generando ingresos para tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor, 28, lives in a rented room.  His main job is public transportation service in the city of Monteagudo.  His work schedule begins at 5:30 a.m. and ends around 11 p.m.  Víctor's daily life is very exhausting.  He strives every day to have a better future.  Víctor is single, for which he works hard to cover the expenses of rent for his room, food, clothing, and other expenses.

He's requesting the loan to perform engine maintenance and repair so he can continue working with his vehicle and generating income to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for engine maintenance and repair

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: Jose Carlos tiene 32 años, soltero y vive a 10 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en la vivienda tiene su taller que comparte con la mamá en sus actividades artesanales de orfebrería elaborando joyas en plata y pedrería está creciendo de a poco en su actividad ya que todavía trabaja las mismas una por una artesanalmente, puliendo, repujando incrustando, todo labrado a mano, su mercado está creciendo poco a poco, ya que para esta actividad se necesita mucho capital, él obtuvo un crédito anterior para materia prima, especialmente plata y piedras, tiene que trabajar con doble capital porque nadie le paga al contado, siempre deja a trimestre los pagos en las diferentes joyerías de la ciudad, por este motivo vuelve a solicitar crédito para materia prima que le ayudará a contar con un capital de operación sin quedarse sin fondo rotatorio que le permita crecer y agrandar su mercado y el de su mamá que tiene la misma actividad pero no puede movilizarse porque es una persona enferma y él la está apoyando y cuidando.
texts.en:
Jose Carlos is 32 years old, single and lives 10 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. In his home he has his workshop that he works in with his mom producing artisan products of jewels in silver and stones. His business is growing little by little since he works on each product with his hands one by one, polishing, embossing and embedding his products. Everything is made by hand and the market is growing slowly since this activity requires a lot of capital. 

He received the previous loan for raw material, especially for silver and stones. He has to work with double the capital because nobody pays him up front. He allows for payments to be made every three months in the different jewelry stores in the city. For this reason he is requesting another loan for raw material. This will help him to have operational capital without being left without rotating funds that will allow him to grow and expand his market. He and his mother work together but she is not able to move around because she is very sick. He is supporting and caring for her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make silver jewelry.

loans.name: Rilma

texts.es: RILMA,  TIENE 20  AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA VIVEN EN LA COMUNIDAD DE QUEBRADAS DE LA  PROVINCIA  MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,   LLEVA UNA VIDA INDEPENDIENTE HACE MÁS DE UN AÑO APARTÁNDOSE DE SUS PADRES POR PROBLEMAS FAMILIARES, NO TIENE HIJOS, COMPARTE SU VIDA CON LOS PARIENTES MÁS CERCANOS COMO SER SU ABUELITA Y SOBRINOS, QUE LOS COLABORAN EN LA PRODUCCIÓN SEGÚN SUS POSIBILIDADES. POR LAS ESCASAS LLUVIAS PRESENTADAS EN LA ANTERIOR GESTIÓN AGRÍCOLA SE HA REDUCIDO EL CAUDAL DE LAS AGUAS SUBTERRÁNEAS PARA EL RIEGO EN LA ZONA, RILMA HA PERDIDO GRAN PARTE DE SU PRODUCCIÓN DE ZANAHORIA YA QUE LA COMUNIDAD HA RESTRINGIDO EL USO DEL AGUA A LO MÍNIMO Y NO HA CUBIERTO EL REQUERIMIENTO DE AGUA PARA LA PRODUCCIÓN EL CUAL A OCASIONANDO UNA DISMINUCIÓN DE INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS, POR VENTA DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS, ES POR ESTOS MOTIVOS MENCIONADOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA HA SUFRIDO UN DESEQUILIBRIO AFECTANDO DIRECTAMENTE EN LA ADQUISICIÓN DE LOS MATERIALES E INSUMOS REQUERIDOS PARA LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA COMO EN LA CANASTA FAMILIAR PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DE LOS JORNALEROS QUE EMPLEA. PARA ESTO NECESITA UN CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR INSUMOS AGRÍCOLAS, SEMILLAS Y ABONO ORGÁNICO, PARA VOLVER A SEMBRAR Y ASÍ DE ESTA MANERA RECUPERAR.
texts.en: Rilma is 20 years old, is single and lives in the Quebradas neighborhood in the province of Mizque, department of Cochabamba. She has lived on her own for over a year, leaving her parents due to family problems. She doesn’t have any children and lives with her closest relatives, her grandmother and nephews, who help her in the agricultural production as well as they can. Scarce rainfall during the past agricultural season has decreased the volume of groundwater for irrigating the area. Rilma has lost a great part of her carrot crops since the community has restricted the use of water to minimum usage and does not have the water needed to support production which has caused a decrease in economic earnings as sales have dropped. It is because of the former reasons mentioned, that her financial stability has suffered and as her crops have been affected directly and she needs to acquire materials and merchandize to maintain her agricultural production, help feed her family and the day laborers that she employs. Rilma needs a loan to buy agricultural products, seeds and organic manure to replant and recuperate her loses.

loans.use: buy agricultural products, seeds and organic manure.

loans.name: Pastor Hernan

texts.es: El señor Pastor Hernán tiene 65 años de edad, vive solo, porque su esposa trabaja de profesora en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, viene a verlo cuando tiene vacación y en algunos feriados durante el año, su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de la Tapera a 45 km de la Ciudad de Monteagudo, municipio de Muyupampa. Las principales actividades del cliente son la producción y venta de maíz y maní overo, también cría ganado porcino criollo y vacuno en corrales rústicos. Esta solicitando crédito para compra semilla de maíz, maní y agroquímicos y sembrar ya que nos encontramos en época para esta actividad, con la producción de maíz cultivado será  para el ganado porcino y también para la alimentación del mismo. Pastor Hernán quiere mejorar sus ingresos para poder tener una etapa de adulto mayor con más respaldo económico y no depender de otra persona para vivir y poder cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y otros que tiene.
texts.en: Mr. Pastor Hernán is 65 years old, and lives alone because his wife works as a teacher in the city of Santa Cruz; she comes to visit him when she’s on vacation and during some holidays during the year. His home is located in the Tapera neighborhood, some 45 km. from the city of Monteagudo in the Muyupampa municipality. Mr. Pastor Hernán’s work consists of growing and selling corn and peanuts, breeding cattle and pigs on rustic farmyards. He needs a loan to buy corn and peanut seeds, and agricultural chemicals to sow since it is the season to do this type of work. The corn harvest will be used for the pigs as feed. Mr. Pastor Hernán wants to improve his earnings to be able to have a good life as a mature adult by having more financial support, not depending on another person to live and to be able to cover his food, clothing and any other expenses that he may have.

loans.use: buy corn and peanut seeds, agricultural chemicals and to pay for labor for his crops.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José tiene 53 años de edad  es una persona amable y muy trabajadora hace más ya de 38 años que se dedica a la agricultura, en la comunidad de la Huerta ubicada a 95 Km de la ciudad de Tarija en la provincia Arce donde actualmente vive y trabaja con su familia, es de estado civil casado y tiene  2 hijos de los cuales ya no dependen económicamente de él. En esta temporada pasada fue muy dura ya que no obtuvo la producción que regularmente obtiene por motivos climatológicos nos cuenta que necesita recursos para poder comprar semilla de papa ya que es la mayor producción que el realiza al año el desea incrementar su producción para poder salir adelante con su familia ya que la vida en el área rural es muy complicada y dura. El señor José está seguro que con este crédito su situación va a mejorar y el próximo crédito será para comprar un vehículo que le hace falta para transportar sus productos al mercado local.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old and is a friendly, hardworking person who for 38 years has been farming in the La Huerta community, located 95 km from Tarija, in the Arce province.  He currently lives and works there with his family.  He’s married and has two adult children on their own.

This past season was very difficult and he didn’t have the production he normally has because of the weather.  He needs resources to buy potato seeds because it’s the greatest production he has during the year.  He wants to increase his production so that he can come out ahead with his family because rural life is very complex and difficult.  Jose is certain that his situation will improve with this loan.  This loan is so that he can buy a vehicle that he needs to transport his products to the local market.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Pablo Issac

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo tiene 29 años de edad y hace más de 10 años  que se dedica a la actividad de servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de motocicletas de la ciudad de Tarija  además de esta actividad también se gana la vida con el alquiler de máquinas compactadoras de suelos. El Sr. Pablo es de estado civil casado y tiene dos hijos una niña de 6 años de edad y niño de 3 años de edad a los cuales apoya junto a su esposa. Nos cuenta que esta actividad de mecánico es buena y generan buenos ingresos pero necesita comprar más herramientas pues con las que cuenta no son suficientes, además está ahorrando para poder adquirir una casita y de esa manera ya no pagar más alquiler y poder mejorar su taller y brindar mejores trabajos y de más calidad es por el cual Don Pablo solicita este crédito que es para comprar su casita (en su casa el tendra la oportunidad de montat su taller)  le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida por otra parte sus conocidos nos afirman que es una persona amable, responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en: Mr. Pablo is 29 years old and has made a living from his motorcycle repair and maintenance business in the city of Tarija for more than 10 years. In addition to this business he also makes a living from the rental of soil compaction machines. Mr. Pablo is married and has two children he supports together with his wife, a 6-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old son. He tells us that his mechanic business is good and generates a good income but that he needs to buy more tools, as the ones he has are not sufficient. He is also saving up to be able to buy a little house so he doesn’t have to rent anymore, and to improve his workshop and offer better and higher-quality work. Mr. Pablo asks for this loan to buy his little house in which he will have the opportunity to open his workshop,, which will help him to improve his income, improving his quality of life. Moreover, those that know him affirm that he is a friendly, responsible, and hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy a little house

loans.name: La Reforma Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por cuatros socios emprendedores originarios de Masaya uno de ellos Gilberto quien es dueño de un taller de carpintería desde hace 30 años, tiene un hijo, es casado y tiene dos empleados asalariados quienes le ayudan en  el proceso de producción, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de madera, lijas, selladores, barniz, junco etc. Elena también es propietario de un taller de carpintería, Roger vende legumbres y Mariana tiene un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
This is a group formed by four entrepreneurial partners from Masaya. One of them, Gilberto, has been the owner of a carpentry workshop for 30 years, has a child, is married, and has two salaried employees that help him in the production process. The loan will be invested in the purchase of wood, sandpaper, sealants, varnish, reeds, etc. 

Elena is also the owner of a carpentry workshop, Roger sells vegetables, and Mariana has a small sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like wood, sandpaper, sealants, varnish, reeds, etc.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas hace tortillas desde hace siete años, anteriormente tenía una pulpería. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, cal. Vilma destaza cerdos y Juana vende ropa.
texts.en:
This group is formed by three micro-entrepreneurial women partners. One of them has made tortillas since she was seven years old, and used to have a small grocery store. The loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, firewood, and limes. 

Vilma butchers pigs and Juana sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like corn, firewood, and limes

loans.name: Estrella Resplandeciente Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es María Elena tiene 55 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos ya adultos. En el pasado se dedicaba a la costura actualmente se dedica a vender ropa nueva  variada y zapatos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada, zapatos, Martha tiene un taller de costura y Teresa vende cosméticos de la Avon y Consuelo tambien cosmeticos de la Avon tambien.
texts.en: This is a group composed of three members. One of them is María Elena; she is 55 years old, married, and has three children who are already adults. In the past, she worked as a seamstress; currently, she sells various new clothing and shoes. She will invest the loan in the purchase of various clothing and shoes. Martha has a sewing shop, Teresa sells Avon cosmetics, and Consuelo also sells cosmetics from Avon.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, and thread.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios como María Inés se dedica a vender cosméticos inicio con una pequeña pulpería con  las ganancias fue comprando cosméticos en menor escalas hasta hoy. Es una mujer casada con un hijo menor y tiene 28 años de edad., El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de  la Avon como perfumen, cremas para manos y cuerpos, lociones, etc. Jenny vende ropa y cosméticos y Alex es transportistas que brinda servicio de taxis de Masaya a Nindiri
texts.en: This group is made up of three members like María Inés who sells makeup. She began with a small grocery store and with the earnings she bought makeup little by little. She is married and has a small child, she is 28 years old. The loan will be used to buy Avon makeup and perfumes, hand and body creams, lotions, etc. Jenny sells clothing and makeup and Alex is in transportation, he works in a taxi and travels between Masaya to Nindiri.

loans.use: buy Avon makeup and perfumes, hand and body creams, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Los Tres Pinos Group

texts.es: Este  grupo lo conforman tres personas microempresaria como Margarita quien se dedica hace diez años a la compra y venta de cosechas de temporadas como cosechas de aguacate, cosecha de tamarindo, cosechas de limón, cosechas de limón dulce etc. Tiene de estar trabajando con la institución 8 años de ser cliente es casada y tiene dos hijos quienes le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, cosechas de limón dulce, cañas de azúcar etc. María del Carmen es otra socia que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio y Pedro José vende ropa ambulante.
texts.en: This group is made up of three people who are microentrepeneurs like Margarita who has worked for over ten years buying and selling seasonal crops like avocadoes, tamarinds, lemons, limes, etc. She has worked with the institution for 8 years. Margarita is married and has two children who help her with the business. The loan will be used to buy tamarinds, limes, sugar canes, etc. María del Carmen is another member who has a grocery store in her home and Pedro José sells clothing door to door.

loans.use: buy tamarinds, lemons, limes, sugar canes, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Marcelina, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tuvo 9 hijos, cinco de ellos viven con ella, los dos menores estudian en escuela. Su marido es ebanista.

Doña Marcelina realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice en su negocio, el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería lugar donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas, puertas, camas, entre otras cosas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de sus hijos y su esposa más que todo en los trabajos de pintura. Es así como desde hace más de 20 años el ha podido sacar adelante a su familia de una manera honrada.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y pintura para la elaboración de las obras. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda el Banco para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos menores terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sequita holds its meetings at the Sequita Parish which belongs to Montecristi in the Manabita Canton.  It is a place full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their origins.  La Sequita is a parish whose population is made up of honest people who only know how to work and care for their families.

Marcelina, 48, is married and has nine children, five of whom live at home, the younger two in school.  Her husband is a furniture maker.

Marcelona is requesting a loan for her husband's business.  He has a workshop where he makes all kinds of furniture, chairs, doors, beds, and other things.  His working hours are Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  His children and wife help with the paint jobs.  This is how he has been able to provide for his family for over 20 years in an honest way.

The loan will be used to buy wood and paint to make products.  Marcelona has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings and enjoys the easy credit terms given by the bank.

Her dream is to see her younger children finish their education.

loans.use: To buy wood and paint.

loans.name: Angela Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar  vive la señora Ángela, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos tres de ellos  ya son mayores e independientes, los dos menores de 16 y 14 años estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Doña Ángela tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa donde vente carne, pollo, arroz, azúcar, detergentes entre otras muchas cosas, ahora también está surtiendo su tienda con ciertos artículos de bazar que tienen muy buena salida con lo cual ha mejorado su clientela, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, son más de 15 años que tiene su negocio y gracias a él ah podido sacar adelante a su familia ya que su marido en ocasiones no tiene trabajo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos, carne y artículos de bazar que necesita. Lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal  le gusta por la ayuda ya que gracias a los créditos cada día mejora su negocio y su situación económica. 

Su sueño es tener una gran despensa.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sequita holds its meetings at the Sequita Parish which belongs to Montecristi in the Manabita Canton. It is a place full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their origins. La Sequita is a parish whose population is made up of honest people who only know how to work and care for their families.

This is where Ángela, 44, lives.  She is married and has five children, three of whom are adults and independent.  The younger two, ages 16 and 14, are still in school and live at home.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Ángela has a small grocery store at home where she sells meat, chicken, rice, sugar, detergents and many other things.  Also, now she is stocking certain bazaar items that are popular which has improved her customer base.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and has been in business for 15 years.  Thanks to her store activity she has been able to provide for the family, as sometimes her husband is out of work.

This loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, detergents, sausages, meat and bazaar items, as needed.  For over two years she has been a member of the communal bank, which she enjoys because thanks to the loans her business and economic situation improve daily.

Her dream is to have a large store one day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, detergents, sausages, meat and bazaar items.

loans.name: Genny Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos, tres de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y tres de 15, 12 y 10 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela, cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su marido es comerciante y agricultor.

Doña Genny realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, el mismo que  se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, él se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta a vender sus productos por las calles en un triciclo, lleva productos que el mismo cultiva más que todo verduras y ciertas frutas pero el resto los compra en el mercado mayorista de Manta, trabaja los días martes, jueves y sábados ya que los otros días se dedica a la agricultura. Lleva realizando esto por más de 15 años y esta es la fuente del sustento de toda su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres, abono y semillas para sembrar  ya que se acerca el invierno y es cuando él siembra. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres en Manta.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sequita holds its meetings at the Sequita Parish which belongs to Montecristi in the Manabita Canton. It is a place full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their origins. La Sequita is a parish whose population is made up of honest people who only know how to work and care for their families.

This is where Genny, 48, lives.  She is married and has six children, three of whom are adults, and three are ages 15, 12 and 10 and still in school.  Her husband is a merchant and farmer.

Genny is taking out the loan for her husband's business.  He sells fruit and vegetables in the city of Manta, where he works as a street vendor selling from a 3-wheel cart.  He sells his own produce, mainly vegetables and fruit, and also buys items from the wholesale market in Manta.  He works Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday, and the rest of the week does his farming.  This has been his source of income for 15 years, allowing him to provide for all of his family.

The loan will be used to buy fruit, vegetables, fertilizer and seeds to plant because the winter planting season is approaching.  Genny has been in the communal bank since it began and she likes the fact that the loans are so helpful.

Her dream is to open a grocery store in Manta.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Magaly Lucia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Magali, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  hijo de 2 años de edad. El marido es ebanista.
 
La señora Magaly es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa en el cual realiza una gran variedad de productos con la madera como por ejemplo: camas, muebles, puertas, cajoneras, anaqueles entre otras muchas obras, trabajan a base de encargos de personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento para que les realice sus obras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y cuando tiene mucho trabajo para entregar hasta más tarde.
 
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas, selladores entre otros materiales que se necesitan para fabricar sus obras. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque con los créditos puede ayudar a su esposo y contribuir al hogar.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The communal bank La Sequita holds its meetings at the Sequita Parish which belongs to Montecristi in the Manabita Canton. It is a place full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their origins. La Sequita is a parish whose population is made up of honest people who only know how to work and care for their families.

This is where Magali, 23, lives.  She and her common-law husband have a two-year-old son.  Her husband is a furniture maker.

Magali is a good wife who is taking out the loan for her husband's business.  He has a furniture workshop at home and makes a wide variety of wood products such as beds, furniture, doors, drawers, shelving, and many other items.  He works on an order basis for people who visit the shop.  His daily working hours are 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and sometimes later when he has a lot of work.

This loan will be used to buy wood, paint, glue and other materials for his products.  Magali has been in the communal bank for two years and is thankful for the loans allowing her to help her husband, thereby contributing to the household.

Her dream is to have her own home, since she lives with her parents-in-law.

loans.use: To buy wood, paint, glue and other materials.

loans.name: Indaura Ismelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Indaura, tiene 58 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tienen 8 hijos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos  estudia en un colegio a distancia en Manta y dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Indaura tiene un local en su casa en el cual  vende artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes necesitan algo. Desde que ella empezó a recibir los créditos ha podido ir mejorando su local y surtiéndole de más mercadería para tener más clientela. Tiene más de 15 años su negocio el cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar y útiles escolares para mejorar su negocio. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y le gusta la ayuda que recibe. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank La Sequita meets in the parish of La Sequita, which belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous district of Manabita. It is full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the people are honest, dedicated to their work and live only for their families.

In this place lives a woman called Indaura. She is 58 years old, and she lives with her common law husband. They have 8 children, all of them grown up. The youngest is studying at a college some distance away in Manta. Two of Indaura’s children still live with her. Her husband is a trader.

Indaura has a room in her house where she sells assorted household items and stationary. She works every day from 08:00 to 18:00, and sometimes even later, when her customers need something.  Since she started receiving loans, she has been able to gradually make improvements to her shop and offer a bigger assortment of merchandise, in order to attract more clientele. Indaura has been running her business for 15 years and it has helped her to give her children a good education.

This loan is to buy household items and school materials in order to improve her business. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for more than 10 years and she likes the support that she receives. 

Indaura’s dream is to carry on running her business.

loans.use: to buy household articles and school materials.

loans.name: María Solanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Libertad #1.
 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es ebanista.

Doña María a además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, tiene una librería en su casa y también se dedica a la venta  ropa por catalogo, zapatillas, carteras, bisutería entre otras cosas. Ella con la ayuda de los créditos ha podido ir  aumentando su mercadería ya que antes solo vendía ropa, es así como sus ventas también han crecido mucho, su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta y en su casa hasta donde llegan a sus clientes más conocidos, trabaja de lunes a viernes en sus entregas y los cobros los realiza los días sábados, compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y en ocasiones le toca viajar a Huaquillas, ella lleva más de 14 años dedicada al comercio el cual le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar carteras, zapatillas, camisetas, pantalones y en especial ropa de niños, que es lo que más vende en esta época cercana a Navidad y Fin De Año. Lleva más de 6 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha aumentado su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran bazar.
texts.en:
The women members of the communal bank “Libertad #1” [Liberty #1] meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí and has been known for many years as the city of the “Royal Tamarind Trees.”

In this place lives Maria, who is 56 years old, married, and has four adult children who are all independent.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

In addition to being a good housewife, Maria has two businesses.  She has a bookstore in her house and she also sells clothing by catalog, including light shoes, purses, wallets and costume jewelry, among other things.  With the help of loans, she has been able to increase her merchandise, as before she was only selling clothing, and she has been able to greatly increase her sales.  She sells door-to-door but also in her house, which is where her best-known clients come.  She works Monday to Friday with her deliveries and she collects the payments on Saturdays.  She buys her merchandise generally in Guayaquil but sometimes travels to Huaquillas.  She has been running a business for more than 14 years, which has helped her provide for her family.

This loan is to buy purses, wallets, light shoes and shirts, pants and especially children’s clothing, which is what sells the most at this time of year close to Christmas and New Year.  Maria has been working at this business for more than six years and she likes it, because she has grown it with the loans she has received.

Her dream is to have big store.

loans.use: to buy purses, wallets, light shoes and shirts, pants and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Fátima Del Consuelo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Libertad #1. 

En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen una hija la cual ya es mayor de edad pero aun vive con ellos y esta estudiando los últimos años de medicina. Su esposo trabaja en el Consejo Provincial.

Doña Fatima a además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa, zapatillas, carteras, bisutería entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa a sus clientes más conocidos, también su hija le ayuda a vender la mercadería a sus compañeras de la universidad, su mercadería tiene mucha salida ya que es exclusiva por que ella viaja a Guayaquil para traer mercadería seleccionada, lleva más de 9 años dedicada al comercio y gracias a esto le está ayudando a su hija con los gastos sus estudios ya que estos son bastantes caros.

Este crédito es para comprar, ropa, carteras, zapatillas, entre otras cosas que vende. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es que su hija sea un gran medico.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has long been known as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the members of the Libertad #1 Communal Bank meet once every two weeks. 

This is where Fátima lives. She is 51 years old, married and has one daughter from this relationship. Her daughter is now grown up but still lives with her parents as she is in the last years of studying medicine. Fátima's husband works for the Provincial Council.

As well as being a great housewife, Fátima also has a small business selling clothes, shoes, wallets and costume jewelry, among other things. She sells door-to-door and also from her home to her best customers. Her daughter also helps her by selling the merchandise to her fellow students at the university. Her merchandise is very profitable as it is exclusive: Fátima travels to Guayaquil to get it. She has been doing this work for nine years and through this is able to help her daughter pay for her studies, which are quite expensive.

This loan is to buy clothes, wallets, shoes and other things to sell. Fátima has been part of the Communal Bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because of the help it gives her to get ahead.
 
Her dream is for her daughter to be a great doctor.

loans.use: to buy clothes, wallets, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en: Saveth is a resident residing in a rural area of Sangke district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 31 years of age and married with three dependent sons, all of whom are currently in school. To offer a decent life for her family, Saveth has a business raising pigs. Her husband works for others as a paid worker in order to add more income to the family. Through the current businesses, this couple is able to earn around 33,000KHR per day and save approximately 13,000KHR after offsetting the daily expenses. This is Saveth’s third time requesting loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The previous loans have helped Saveth to strengthen her pig-raising business, which has enabled her to earn more income for the family. Now she is leading a loan group of three female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 3,800,000KHR in total. The group representative, Saveth, will use her requested loan portion, which is 1,400,000KHR, to purchase seven heads of pig to raise. Saveth’s biggest hope in the future is to be able to support her dependent sons’ education so that they can have bright future and become potential youths in society.

loans.use: To purchase seven heads of pig

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
A resident residing in a rural village of Moung Russey district in Battambang province in Cambodia, Nen is a 57 year-old married woman with six children. To make a living, Nen and her husband work as rice farmers on four-hectare plot of farmland. Together, they are able to earn around 26,000KHR per day. After deducting the daily cost of living, they save about 16,000KHR for future needs. 

Nen has already been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for three loan cycles, with which she succeeded in improving the livelihood of her family. Now, Nen is in need of money to purchase fertilizer and rice-seed. Thus, she is leading a group of four members to take out a loan in the amount of 3,600,000KHR in total. 

After receiving the requested loan portion, which is 1,000,000KHR, Nen will use it effectively in order to keep her rice field in good shape and be able to increase her crop yields, earning more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice-seed

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en: Sreang, 46 years old, is a resident residing in a rural village of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has seven children. Sreang makes her living by growing corn and peanuts on a four-hectare plot of land. This industrious woman has been involved in her current business for more than ten years, earning around 37,000 KHR daily. This is Sreang’s seventh time requesting a loan via Kiva's partner VisionFund,. The previous loans have enabled her to better support her family. To better support her current business, Sreang is leading a loan group of two female members to take out a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 2,400,000 KHR in total. As a group representative, Sreang will use her portion of the loan, which is 1,400,000 KHR, to purchase fertilizer. Using this loan, Sreang expects to see a boost in her current business as well as the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em is 46 years old, married, and a villager residing in a rural village of Moung Russey district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is blessed with six children, three (daughters) of whom are dependent on her and currently in school. To make a living, Em and her husband have a rice farming business, with which they have been involved for 10 years. Em has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for a loan cycle already, which enabled her to improve the living condition of her family. Now Em is in need of money to support the family's rice-growing business. Thus, she is leading a group of three female members to apply for a loan in the amount of 3,400,000 KHR in total. Em will use her requested loan portion to support the current business by purchasing fertilizer and paying wages to farm laborers. After receiving and effectively using her requested loan portion, Em highly hopes that the rice field will provide higher and better crop yields so that she can sell them for greater profit. Em is willing to use the anticipated income to move her family ahead and advance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay wages to farm laborers

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
Rath is a 49-year-old citizen living in Thmor Koul district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. She is married and has five children, two (a daughter and a son) of whom are school-aged children and still under her responsibility. Rath offers a decent life for her family by farming rice on a hectare of farmland. Rath has been involved in her rice-growing business for ten years, earning approximately 16,000 KHR daily and managing to save about 8,000 KHR after canceling out the daily cost of living. 

Rath, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who, also, is a first-time borrower to request a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. With her requested loan portion, Rath will buy fertilizer to apply to her farmland. Rath expects a boost in her income after receiving her requested loan portion and using it as she plans. This hard-working wife and mother would like to dedicate the efforts that she has put into her work to moving her family ahead and supporting the education of her beloved children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Koukilan Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARCELINE représente le groupe KOUKILAN. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 21ans. 01 va à l’école et elle à 05 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des grains d’arachide, de la levure, des ignames et  des pains de singe depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Pô village environnant. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes du marché.
Mme veut s’acheter 20 tines d’arachide, 10 tines de levure et 10 ignames.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  améliorer son activité (acheter en quantité). Mme ambitionne épargner, subvenir au besoin de son dernier enfant et  de ses petits t fils dont leur mère (sa fille) est décédé.
texts.en:
Mrs. MARCELINE is the representative of the group KOUKILAN. She is a married mother of four children aged 21 to 35, one of whom attends school. She supports five people.

Marceline has been selling groundnuts, yeast, yams and pain de singe (baobab fruit) for two years. She buys her stock in the neighboring village of Pô. Her customers are men and women who visit the market. 

Marceline wants to buy 20 tubs of groundnuts, 10 tubs of yeast and 10 yams. She will use her profits to support her activity (purchasing large quantities of merchandise). She plans to bolster her savings, and provide for her youngest child and her grandchildren whose mother (her daughter) has passed away.

loans.use: to buy 20 tubs of groundnuts, 10 tubs of yeast and 10 yams.

loans.name: Sahra Group

texts.fr:
Mme MATA est responsable du groupe SAHRA. Mariée, elle est  mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 06 vont à l’école et elle à 07 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend du bois de chauffe, fabrique et vend aussi du savon depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages périphériques pour le bois et ua grand marché pour le savon. Ses clients sont les voisins et voisines du quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter 01 range de bois de chauffe, 10 assiettes de beurre de karité, 01 sac de soude caustique et 10 litres d’huile de coco pour la fabrication du savon.
Elle veut  épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne son activité, acheter un motocycle et aider son mari pour le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Mata is the leader of the group Sahra. Married, she is the mother of 7 children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. Six go to school and she has 7 dependents.

Mata sells firewood, and has also been making and selling soap for 5 years. She gets her supplies in the outlying villages for the wood and at a large market for the soap. Her customers are the male and female neighbors of the neighborhood.

Mata wants to buy herself 1 rack of firewood, 10 plates of shea butter, 1 bag of caustic soda and 10 liters of coconut oil for the fabrication of soap.

She wants to save her profits. Mata has the ambition of buying a motor bicycle for her business and helping her husband for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to buy herself 1 rack of firewood, 10 plates of shea butter, 1 bag of caustic soda and 10 liters of coconut oil for the fabrication of soap.

loans.name: Rosada Group

texts.es: Lucrecia es una microempresaria que se dedica a la venta de artesanía donde comercializa sus productos en el mercado de Masaya hace 8 años, es miembro de un grupo formado por tres socias incluyéndola a ella, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de adornos de barros, platos de pared, vasijas, comales, adornos en forma de sol y la luna etc. Rosa Amelia es otra socia que forma el grupo vende huevos y Rosa Patricia  vende tortillas y frutas frescas.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a small-businesswoman who has been selling handicrafts in the Masaya market for 8 years.  She is the member of a communal bank that is comprised of 3 women, including her.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of decorative pottery, wall plates, jugs, griddles, and decorations in the form of the sun, the moon, etc.  Rosa Amelia is another member of the group who sells eggs, and Rosa Patricia sells tortillas and fresh fruit.

loans.use: to buy decorative pottery, wall plates, jugs, griddles, and decorations in the form of the sun and the moon

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of Moung Russey district located in Cambodia’s Battambang province, Nan is 58 years of age and married. She has six children, one of whom (a daughter) is dependent on her and still in school. Nan offers a decent life for her family through farming rice on a four-hectare plot of farmland. Nan’s husband also assists in the rice-growing business, which is managed by his wife, and works one more job as a fisherman in order to earn extra income for the family. Together, they are able to earn around 28,000 KHR daily. 

Nan’s challenge is the lack of working capital to support her rice field. Thus, Nan, a third-time borrower, is leading a loan group of three female members to take out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR in total. To smoothly run and support her rice-growing business, group leader Nan will utilize her loan portion to purchase fertilizer and rice-seed. After receiving the loan and using it as she plans, Nan has high expectations that her rice field will provide her with a good quality crop so that she can sell it for a good price, generating more profit for the family. She will also use the anticipated income to keep her children in a good school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice-seed.

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo is a 28-year-old resident in a rural village of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province in Cambodia. She is married and is a mother of two daughters and one son, all of whom are her responsibility and currently in school. This hard-working woman, Sambo, earns a living for her family by farming rice on a five-hectare farm. Having been in this business for ten years, Sambo is able to earn around 14,000 KHR daily to cover her expenses and to save some portion for future needs. Sambo has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for two loan cycles already, with which she succeeded in making the livelihood of her family so much better. 

Now, she is leading a group member who is with VisionFund for the first time to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR respectively. With her loan portion, Sambo will buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice-seed to apply to her farmland. Via the help of this loan, the group leader Sambo strongly believes that her rice field will provide a good-quality crop so that she can sell it for greater profit, generating more income for the family. She is also willing to use the anticipated income to support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and rice-seed

loans.name: Sineang

texts.en:
Sineang is 30 years old and resides in Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district in Cambodia. She is married and has two dependent sons, both of whom are school-aged children. To offer a decent life for the family, Sineang and her husband farm rice, plant cassava, and work for others as paid workers. This couple is able to earn around 20,000 KHR daily. Now, Sineang is applying for a 500 USD loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the first time. With this first-time requested loan, she will buy fertilizer and pay the cost of labor.

Via the help of this loan, Sineang expects a boost in her income as well as improvements in her family’s living standards. She will also use the income generated by the family’s business, rice-growing business and cassava-planting business to educate her sons so that they will have bright future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the cost of labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en: Samath is 34 years of age and married. She and her family reside in a rural village of Tbaung Kmum district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. Samath has three daughters and one son, all of whom are under her responsibility. To make a living, she plants sugarcane and works for others as a paid worker. Samath’s husband also assists in the sugarcane-planting business, which is managed by his wife, and he works one more job as a teacher in order to supplement the family’s income. Together, they are able to earn approximately 20,000KHR per day and save around 5,000KHR after canceling out the daily cost of living. Samath is leading a loan group of two female members who are both first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a loan in the amount of 1,000,000KHR each. With the requested loan portion, Samath will buy sugarcane seeds. Via the help of this loan, Samath expects to see a boost in her income as well as an improvement in her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Proen's Group

texts.en:
Proen, 37, is a rice farmer from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She has two children, one daughter and one son, both of whom are still in school. Proen has grown rice on two-hectares of land for ten years, while her husband works for others for a fee to better support her family. She can earn about KHR 20,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 14,000 each day after daily expenses.

Proen has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and has fully repaid the loans, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Proen used the previous loans to relieve her family’s economic burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two members to request a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland as well as to pay labor fees for harvesting the rice. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay for labor to harvest the rice.

loans.name: Nork's Group

texts.en:
Nork is a 33-year-old married mother who lives with her husband and two children, residing in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. To support a family, Nork has been growing rice and pineapples while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area. Her family daily income is approximately 14,000 KHR per day and she can manage to save about 9,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Nork has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already. The previous loan, which she repaid, has supported her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice timely and healthfully so as to fulfill her dream to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Kimhon

texts.en:
Kimhon, aged 30 years, is a diligent farmer who lives with her spouse and two children in a village in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. All of Kimhon's children are in her care and still in school. To support the family, Kimhon and her husband grow rice on three hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 8 years, they are able to earn about KHR 19,000 per day, of which they manage to save about KHR 10,000 after deducting daily expenses.

Kimhon is seeking her first microloan with VisionFund. She would like to borrow KHR 1,600,000 to purchase a cow to help in her farming business. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to better her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to help in her farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, aged 37 years, is a married mother of six children who grows rice in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. She also sells grocery items while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver in local area to earn extra income for the family. Together, they have been in this business for 10 years. The current occupation earns them approximately 30,000KHR per day and allows them to save about 20,000KHR each day after daily expenses. Low yield resulted from drought is the main challenge for their farming business. 
Sary has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sary successfully repaid the loans which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en:
Chanry is aged 28 years and married with two children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Kandal Steong district of Kandal province, Cambodia. Both of her children are dependent on her; one is in school while the remaining one is still too young for school. Chanry and her husband have been working as a paid garment workers for several years to support the family. Together, they are able to earn about US $6 per day and manage to save about US $3 each day after daily expenses. 

Chanry has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan which has helped her to relieve family’s burden and improve livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of US $700 to buy renovate her old kitchen and use a portion of it to buy household supplies. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy renovate her old kitchen.

loans.name: Sabon's Group

texts.en:
Sabon, 46, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of family income are from rice farming and making palm juice. She and her husband have been in these businesses for five years. The current businesses earn her about 24,000KHR per day and allows her to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Sabon’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is in her first microloan with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Chakriya's Group

texts.en:
Chakriya is 41-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has farmed rice and raised pigs for 12 years. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 12,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Chakriya is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She wants to use this loan to buy pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs to sell them for a good price in order to better of her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Samol's Group

texts.en:
Samol, a 38-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has five children to take care of. To support the family, Samol has farmed rice for 15 years and supplemented her family’s income by selling grocery items while her husband works for others for a fee. Samol and her husband can earn about 14,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 7,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

Samol’s group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The past loan, which Samol completely paid back, has helped improve her family's living conditions. Now she is leading her group to request another loan. She wants to use this loan to pay for labor fees in plowing the rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees in plowing her rice field

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn is 61 years old and she has six children. Her family lives in a rural area located in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Thorn has been a rice farmer for ten years on two hectares of farmland and this is the main source of her family’s income. She can earn approximately KHR 25,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day.

Thorn has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles and fully repaid her past loans, which enabled her to buy a motor for commuting with her family. Now she is applying for another loan of US $1,500. Thorn will use it to buy piglets for raising in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sokhorm's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia, Sokhorm is a 27-year-old married mother who has been farming rice as the main source of her family’s income on four hectares of farmland for nine years. Sokhorm has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her daily income is approximately 20,000 KHR and she manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day after her daily expenses.

Sokhorm’s group consists of two members and she is a new borrower with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her rice field so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna is a 34-year-old farmer who lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is married with two dependent children, all of whom are still in school. She has been farming rice on three-hectare area of farmland for 16 years. The current business earns her approximately 30,000KHR per day and manages to save about 15,000KHR each day after daily expenses.
Vanna has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other member is on his first cycle with VisionFund. She completely paid back the loan that has helped her to support her rice paddy. Now she and her group member are applying for a new loan of 1,200,000 and 1,000,000 respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. Through this loan, she hopes to grow her rice successfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA est responsable du groupe SHALOM. Mariée, elle est  mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 38ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle à 02 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend des légumes depuis 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne  à la cité AN II. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  02sacs d’oignons, ½ caisse de tomate, 02 sachets d’épice et 01 carton de Maggi.
Elle veut  épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne assurer le bien être et la scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer son activité.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the SHALOM group.  She is married and the mother of six children.  Her oldest child is 38 years old, her youngest is 17.  Two of her children attend school and she has two people in her care.

Rasmata has been selling vegetables for the past forty years.  She buys her goods at the AN II district and resells to men and women.
She wants to buy two bags of onions, half a crate of tomatoes, two sachets of spices and one box of Maggi bouillon cubes.

Rasmata wants to save her profits.  Her ambition is to ensure the well-being of her children, pay their school fees and improve her own business.

loans.use: to buy two bags of onions, half a crate of tomatoes, two sachets of spices and one box of Maggi bouillon cubes.

loans.name: Vestline Group

texts.en:
SELEMANI,who is in his early 60s,is married living together with his wife with six children of which one of them goes to school.  For the period of ten years now, Mr. Selemani has been earning the living by running genge (fruits and vegetable) business. He is really hard working and it shows. He works from 4am( night) to 10pm daily and he is able to make a small profit per month.

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to buy more genge stocks to resell so as to rise his sales and income.  His dream is to one day be able to expand more his business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "VESTLINE" which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more genge stocks to resell

loans.name: Sect 16 Wendenda Group

texts.fr:
Mme BIBATA est responsable du groupe SECT 16 WENDENDA. Mariée, elle est  mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 04 vont à l’école et elle à 08 personnes à sa charge.
Mme vend de la patte d’arachide  depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de paglayiri. Ses clients sont les hommes,  femmes et les gérants de kiosque et de restaurant.
Mme veut s’acheter 01 sac d’arachide pour la préparation de la patte d’arachide.
Elle veut  utiliser ses bénéfices pour faire face à ses échéances. Mme ambitionne  agrandir ses points de vente et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madam Bibata is the leader of the group SECT 16 WENDENDA. Married, she is the mother of 8 children. The oldest is 28 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. Four go to school and she has 8 dependents. Madam has been selling groundnut paste for 30 years. She gets her supplies at the market in Paglayiri. Her customers are men and women and the managers of kiosks and restaurants.

Madam wants to buy herself 1 bag of groundnuts for the preparation of groundnut paste.

She wants to use her profits to meet her payment deadlines. Madam has the ambition of expanding her points of sale and paying for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy herself 1 bag of groundnuts for the preparation of groundnut paste.

loans.name: Zongo Watinoma Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETA est responsable du groupe ZONGO WATINOMA. Mariée, elle est  mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle à 05 personnes à sa charge.
Mme fait des pagnes tissés depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  01 balle de fils, 03 rouleaux de brillants et ½ kg de teinture.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut investir dans son commerce et faire face à ses échéances. Mme ambitionne agrandir son commerce et s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madam Asseta is the leader of the group Zongo Watinoma. Married, she is the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Three go to school and she has 5 dependents.

Madam has been making woven 'pagnes' [colorful African fabric] for 5 years. She gets her supplies at the market of her sector. Her customers are men and women

Madam wants to buy herself 1 ball of threads, 3 sequin rolls and ½ kg of dye.

With her profits, she wants to invest in her business and meet her payment deadlines. Madam has the ambition of expanding her business and taking care of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy herself 1 ball of threads, 3 sequin rolls and ½ kg of dye.

loans.name: Antoinette's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé en 05 Décembre  2000 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe composé de 04 femmes qui sont issues du même village, très solidaire entre elles, ces femmes  jouissent d’une très bonne entente et d’une réputation de femmes travailleuses. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Antoinette  (debout à droite avec la main levée), est  l’emprunteur en vedette du groupe, elle est âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle est vendeuse de banane  pour la plupart du temps, de jus citron et d’huile de palme.
