Tiene 20 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora a diario como jornalero, aun no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Aida pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su hijo que aun es pequeño, pero como tiene terrenos para cultivar siembra hortalizas y verduras las mismas que vende, también tiene animales como cuyes, gallinas y pollos.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, semillas y abono para continuar creciendo con su fuente de ingresos.
 
Su meta es agrandar la crianza de cuyes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Pacha is made up of 8 women members and one man. They live in the Nabon canton, which is located in the southeast of the Azuay province. One of it's geographic characteristics is the dispersion of its territory, which inhibits easy access among the various communities and makes communication difficult. The group members are characterized as hardworking, entrepreneurial, and as fighters. The majority of them work in farming or raising animals which they then sell in the city of in the own community. They are very proud that they have still kept their culture, traditions, and traditional dress alive. 

One of the members of this group is Señora Aída. She is an entrepreneurial members who wants to get her family ahead. This is the second loan she has had in the Pacha communal bank. She is 20 years old, married and within her marital relationship she has conceived one child who is now 2 years old. Her husband works daily as a day laborer. They still do not own their own home, which is why they rent. 

Aida spends most of her time at home caring for her child who is still little. However, since she has land to cultivate, she plants crops and vegetables, which she sells. She also has animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and chicks. 

She will use her new loan to buy chicks, seeds, and manure to continue increasing her source of income. Her goal is to expand the raising of guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy chicks, seeds, and manure.

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en: Sakun is a villager who resides in a rural village of the Dambae district, which is located in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 54 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Sakun works many jobs; she farms rice, plants cassava, and sells grocery items. This will be Sakun’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan helped her to secure food for her family and improve her family’s standard of living. This time, she is requesting a KHR 2,000,000 loan to buy fertilizer to support her rice-growing business and cassava-planting business. Sakun would love to dedicate the efforts that she has put into her work to moving her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Chantheoun's Group

texts.en: Chantheoun is 37 years old and married. She and her family live in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom (a son) is dependent on her. To earn a living, Chantheoun and her husband work as rice farmers and paid workers. Together, they are able to earn around 27,000 KHR daily. This is Chantheoun’s third time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans that she has obtained and successfully paid back have helped her to build a warm house in which her beloved family can live. Now to support the rice-growing business, Chantheoun is leading a loan group of two female members to take out a loan in the amount of 1,600,000 KHR in total. With 1,000,000 KHR, which is Chantheoun’s loan portion, she will utilize it to buy rice seed. This hard-working woman, Chantheoun, will use her requested loan portion very effectively in order to relieve her family’s burdens and move her family ahead.

loans.use: To  buy rice seed

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Lean is a villager living in a rural area of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia’s Siem Reap province. She is 52 years of age and married. Lean has five children, one of whom (a daughter) is still her responsibility and currently in school. 

To continually support her family, Lean works as a rice farmer on an eight-hectare plot of farmland. Low crop yields due to destruction by insects is the main challenge for her rice-growing business. Now, Lean is requesting a KHR 2,000,000 loan to purchase fertilizer to help keep her rice field in good shape. After receiving her loan, Lean expects a boost in her income as well as an improvement in her rice-growing business. This hard-working mother will use the anticipated income to keep her dependent daughter in school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the land where she grows rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: No

texts.en: No, 33 years old, is a resident residing in a rural village of Kror Lanh district in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. No is married and has two dependent sons, one of whom is currently in school. She earns the living through selling fruit, and her husband works as a rice farmer to complement their income. Together, they earn approximately 25,000 KHR per day and save about 13,000 KHR for future needs. No is requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner) in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR for the first time. She will use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer to support her husband's rice-growing business and use the remaining portion of the loan to buy more fruit to sell. No expects a boost in the family's income after receiving and effectively using the requested loan. She also is willing to use the anticipated income to meet the food needs for her family and, most importantly, support her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to buy more fruit to sell

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Many

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kror Kor province’s Pursat district, Many is aged 21 years and married. For more than five years, she has been farming rice as a primary source of the family’s income to make a living. Her husband also earns extra income by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 19,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Many is a new borrower with VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a buffalo to raise, and will use a portion of it to spend on buying an oxcart to help her in the farming business. 

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo and an oxcart to help her in the farming business.

loans.name: Kimbeoun

texts.en:
Kimbeoun, age 52, is a widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is working while studying. She and her family live in a rural village of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia's Siem Reap province. Kimbeoun offers a decent life for her family by working as a rice farmer. 

This is Kimbeoun's first time requesting a USD 1,000 loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Kimbeoun will use one portion of her loan to improve her rice field, by purchasing fertilizer, and use the other portion of it to purchase a motorbike, which will make her children's transportation to school easier. This single mother (Kimbeoun) would love to dedicate all the efforts that she has put into her work, to support her children's education as far as possible. Kimbeoun expects a boost in the income generated by the rice-farming business after receiving the requested loan and using it as she plans.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice-growing land, and a motorbike for her children's transportation to school.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Saphorn

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Saphorn is 29 years old and married. She has one son. The primary sources of her family’s income are sales of grocery items and rice farming and cassava planting. To better support the family, her husband sometimes works for others for wages. With 13 years of business experience, Saphorn can earn about 34,000 KHR per day, of which she manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day after paying her expenses. The main challenges for her family’s business are a drop in cassava’s price and unhealthy rice crops. 

Saphorn has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and she wisely and successfully used her first loan to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve their financial burden. She plans to use the requested loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to pay for labor. She hopes to improve the health of her rice and cassava crops in order to increase her family’s income, to better her living conditions, and to keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng, 54 years old, is a single father of five children. He has a son who is currently a student in the 10th grade. He and his family live in Siem Reap province's Kror Lanh district, Cambodia. Heng is a rice farmer on a four-hectare plot of farm. Having been in the current business for more than ten years, he is able to earn around 14,000 KHR daily and manages to save about 6,000 KHR for future needs. Heng, a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), is leading a group member who also is a fourth-time borrower to take out a loan in the amount of 700,000 KHR and 300,000 KHR, respectively. The past loans that Heng obtained and successfully paid back have helped him to better support his rice-growing business and secure food for his beloved family. This time, he will use his requested loan portion to purchase fertilizer to help keep his rice-growing business in good shape. Via the help of his requested loan portion, this hard-working father greatly hopes that he will receive a good-quality crop so that he can boost his income and use it to advance his children's schooling and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Meysom's Group

texts.en:
Meysom, 37, is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Sampov Meas district, Pursat province. She is the mother of one son, who is dependent and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and fishing, which she has been doing for several years. Her husband helps the family to earn additional income, by selling fish and working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. 

Meysom’s group is comprised of four female members, who have been with VisionFund for five loan cycles. Meysom completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her businesses. Now she is leading her group to request another loan of 1,400,000 KHR, each person. She wants to use her portion of this loan to buy fishing nets for her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish and to sell them for a good price, to better her family’s living conditions and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her fishing business

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kror Kor district of Prusat province, Sokhoern is a 33-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Farming rice and making palm juice have been the main sources of her family’s income for the past 10 years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day, of which she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after expenses.

Sokhoern’s group consists of two members who live in the same area. The leader of her group, Sokhoern is going to use her portion to buy an oxcart to help in her farming business. She hopes to get a high yield from the rice paddy in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy an oxcart to help in her farming business

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga, 62, is a villager residing in a rural area of Kror Lanh district, located in Cambodia's Siem Reap province. She is married and has been blessed with five children, two of whom (daughters) have their own employment. This industrious woman, Nga, makes her living from agriculture, that is, farming rice on two hectares of farmland. She earns approximately 5,500 KHR daily, and she can save only about 2,000 KHR, after offsetting the daily cost of living. 

The lack of food is the biggest challenge for Nga's family. Therefore, she is leading a loan group of two female members, both of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). They seek a loan in the amount of 750,000 KHR in total. Nga is planning to use her requested loan portion, which is 250,000 KHR, to purchase fertilizer for her rice. After receiving and using her loan portion in this smart manner, Nga has high hopes that she will be able to boost her income, so that she can use it to overcome the lack of food and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Jonh's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of four children, Jonh is aged 48 years and lives in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Pursat province, Cambodia. To support her family, she has struggled to farm rice as the main source of the family’s income. To add more income, she also raises pigs in her local area. She has been doing these activities for ten years. Her current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Jonh has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and completely paid back the past loans, while the other group members have been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now they are applying for a new loan. As the leader, Jonh is going to use her portion of the loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

loans.name: Yom's Group

texts.en:
Yom, 24, is married and lives in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. The main source of the family’s income is rice farming on four hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for one year to make a living. 

To earn additional income, she is working as a hairdresser in a local area. The current business earns her approximately 21,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield resulting from insects is the main challenge for her farming business.  

This is Yom’s first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Yom will use her portion to buy materials for supporting her hairdressing business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Sas' Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province of Cambodia, Sas is a 58-year-old. She is married and has six children. 

Sas has been in rice farming on a three-hectare area of farmland for almost 20 years, while her husband catches fish to support the family. The current business earns her family about 20,000 KHR and she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sas is in her first microloan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to seek a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay labor fees for harvesting rice.

 She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy-rice, so as to sell it for a good price to better her living condition.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Somalen's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Kror Lanh district, Siem Reap province, Somalen is a 34-year-old mother of one son who is dependent and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from rice farming and grocery selling, which she and her husband have been in for ten years. With her current business, they can earn about KHR 24,000 per day, but they can save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses.

Somalen has been with VisionFund for one cycle, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Somalen completely used the previous loan to better support her current business. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use this loan to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice. She hopes to grow rice fruitfully and timely so as to improve her standard of living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in harvesting rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Moul's Group

texts.en:
Moul is 60 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Siem Reap province’s Kror Lanh district. She is a rice farmer, and also supplements her income by raising pigs. She is able to earn about 23,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses.

Moul has been a member of VisionFund for five loan cycles already, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Moul fully repaid the past loans, which helped her to relieve her family’s burdens and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two, to apply for another loan of 1,400,000 KHR, each person. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy pig feed, for nourishing her pigs. She hopes to fatten her pigs, so as to sell them for a good price and better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, for nourishing and fattening her pigs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor, 36 years old, is a villager from a rural area of the Pouk district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a married mother of three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. To support her family, Sor has been involved in rice farming on a 2.5-hectare area of farmland. She supplements the income by raising pigs. Having engaged in this business for 10 years, she can earn about 13,000 KHR per day, and she can manage to save about 4,000 KHR, after offsetting daily living expenses. 

Sor is a new borrower with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three, to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to pay for labor to help her harvest her rice. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully, so as to sell it for a good price. This will enable her to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor to help her harvest rice.

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena is a northern villager in her sixties who has eight children in total; none of them are currently in school. For almost eleven years now she has been raising livestock and is happy. “That’s the only thing I know how to do well,” Prena said. “I like the daily routine from morning till late evening; milking the cows, cleaning up the stable, feeding them, taking the milk to the local market; making cheese/ ricotta cheese and butter; all of these are organic.  And this is what keeps me strong and makes me do more,” she continued saying. 

Prena is requesting a third loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to repair a stable; the previous loans have been repaid in full. She remains positive that lenders will show their generosity by lending to her.

loans.use: To repair a stable

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is an experienced seamstress, particularly with northern traditional Albanian clothing and has been operating from her own home performing repair and alteration services for over 25 years. She is the only one in almost the entire region running such activity and the clientele is steady.

Liza is in her fifties and has two children; one of them is still attending a public university. 

Liza is in need for a loan of approximately 1,850 US dollars to purchase fabric and knitted material. Being aware that her profile will be published on Kiva for financial support from lenders, she would like to thank all of the lenders in advance for their generosity and wish them Happy Holidays.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and knitted material for her home based repairing & alterations services

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana is a 37-year-old mother of four children, ranging from eleven to one year old. Only two of them attending school. She lives with her husband and children in the north west part of Albania.
 
Marjana has been selling milk and baby cows to the local market of a northern small town of approximately 10,000 inhabitants for the past six years and has been generating a somewhat good income. Animal husbandry is a preferred activity throughout northern Albania and has proven to be one of the main means of income for the northern rural areas.

Marjana wants to buy a dairy cow at the moment, and is requesting a loan from KIVA via VisionFund Albania. With the holidays approaching, she wants to say “Happy Holidays” to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte has lived below the poverty level for years despite her efforts. Things took a better turn when she started running her livestock herding about eight years back.
Since then, she has been selling milk and other dairy products to locals. Albanians consume lots of dairy products, thus, the need for dairy is always high especially in the northern regions where food products are scarce.  Bread and cheese is considered a staple amongst many poor Albanian families.
Marte is in need of a loan to buy another milk cow and she hopes that she will get some financial help from lenders. Being able to buy another cow would be her best gift these holidays, she said.
Marte is married and has four children and this would be her second loan within the same institution.

loans.use: To add another milk cow to her existing herd

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
Kujtim, a hard-worker blacksmith, is 41 years old and lives in northeastern Albania. He is married and has three children: 13, 8 and 6 years old. 

Forging metal is the type of activity that he has been practicing for the past ten years and has proven to be profitable according to Kujtim. He has been able to establish a good and steady clientele throughout the years and is proud of this, because he is not the only person who offers such services, yet he has known how to differentiate himself from the others. Recently, Kujtim has been very busy and the space where he has been operating his activity seems too small, and he wants to expand the shop. This is the reason why Kujtim is requesting a loan, and he hopes that everything will go well and that he will receive some financial help from lenders.

loans.use: To expand his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe is in her early thirties and married with two children, who are eight and four years old. About seven years ago, Bardhe started her livestock business, and she’s been happy with it overall, both in terms of progress and profits. As the only financial provider for her family, she is able to make an income from this activity while she is a stay-at-home mom.

Bardhe is planning on expanding this profitable activity, and she needs to add one more milk cow of a good breed to her herd. A loan from Kiva will help her vision become reality. She is requesting a loan of 130,000 Albanian Lek. She remains in good spirits with the holidays approaching, hopeful that she will get financial help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add one more cow of a good breed to her existing herd

loans.name: Verónica De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica forma parte del banco comunal Zhullin hace dos años y medio, es una socia muy alegre y participativa en su grupo, vive por la comunidad de Zhullin en la vecina ciudad de Azogues, donde se puede encontrar muchos sitios turísticos, artesanales, religiosos, culturales y ecológicos, con una variada y riquísima gastronomía, la Virgen de la Nube que es venerada por los fieles de todo el país y turistas. La ciudad tiene gran riqueza tradicional por sus viejas casas con balcones de madera tallada y por la Catedral ubicada en la Plaza Central, con su imponente fachada de piedra.

La Señora Verónica tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 7 y 3 años, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela, también está muy contenta ya que se encuentra en su octavo mes de gestación y todo va muy bien por el momento, su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que vive es de propia.

Ella tiene una tienda desde hace 7 años donde vende productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir n la compra de productos de primera necesidad, útiles escolares y artículos de bazar.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Verónica has been part of the Zhullin communal bank for 2 1/2 years.  She is a very cheerful and participative member of her group. She lives in the community of Zhullin, in the neighboring city of Azogues. There one can find many tourist, handicraft, religious, cultural, and ecological sites, along with 
a varied and very delicious cuisine and the Virgin of the Cloud who is venerated by the faithful of the entire country.

The city has a great wealth of tradition, with its old houses with carved wooden balconies, and the Cathedral located in the Central Plaza, with its imposing stone façade.

Verónica is 29 years old, married, and has two children ages seven and three. Her eldest son goes to school,  and she is also very happy because she is in her eighth month of pregnancy, and everything is going very well at the moment. Her husband works as a employee of a private company, and the home where they live is their own.

She has had a store for seven years, where she sells basic household necessities, school supplies and stationery. She works from Sunday to Sunday and has no fixed hours.

She is going to use the money from her new loan to buy basic household products, school supplies and stationery. Her goal is to complete her home, as it still needs some finishing work.

loans.use: To buy basic household products, school supplies and stationery.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Para la Señora. Luz este es el séptimo crédito que realiza con sus amigas y compañeras del banco comunal Zhullin, es una socia muy cumplida en sus pagos y muy colaborativa, vive por la comunidad de Zhullin en la vecina ciudad de Azogues donde se puede encontrar muchos sitios turísticos, artesanales, religiosos, culturales y ecológicos, con una variada y riquísima gastronomía, la Virgen de la Nube que es venerada por los fieles de todo el país y turistas. La ciudad tiene gran riqueza tradicional por sus viejas casas con balcones de madera tallada y por la Catedral ubicada en la Plaza Central, con su imponente fachada de piedra.

Doña Luz es una mujer casada que tiene 30 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 11, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos asisten a una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora en su negocio propio ya que es un profesional en la panadería y pastelería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Luz se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, para ayudar a su esposo economícamente se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar, en sus tiempos libres trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas  y alimento para animales.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
This is the seventh loan that Sra. Luz has received, along with her friends and fellow members of the Zhullin Communal Bank. She is a member who is very responsible with her payments and who collaborates with others. She lives in the community of Zhullin in the city of Azogues. The city has many tourist, handicraft, religious, cultural and ecological sites. There is also a varied and delicious cuisine, and the Virgen de la Nube, who is venerated by the faithful throughout the country, as well as by tourists. Azogues has a rich tradition displayed in it old houses with carved wooden balconies and in the Cathedral with its imposing stone facade, located in the Central Plaza,.

Doña Luz is a woman who is 30 years old and married. She has conceived four children in her marriage. They are 11, 7, 4 and 2 years of age. Her first three children attend a school in the city. Her husband has his own business and runs a bakery. They do not own a house and rent one.

Sra. Luz does household chores and cares for her children, who are still small. To help her husband financially, she raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also farms, but her crops are all for household consumption. In her spare time she helps her husband in the bakery.

She will use the loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and to buy feed for the animals.

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs, chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Cruz  Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora. Cruz es una socia alegre y carismática que conforma el banco comunal Zhullin, vive por el sector de Tomebamba en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, está situado en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana. Su Centro Histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.
 
La Señora Cruz tiene 50 años es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y casados, dos viven  independientes y  uno vive aun en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo  un taxi, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Cruz inicio su negocio con su primer crédito que recibió, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en un local propio que tiene en un mercado de la ciudad, también elabora y vende gelatinas actividad que le gusta mucho y en este negocio se encuentra hace 23 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Su crédito es para comprar ropa y tarinas de plástico para su gelatina.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio de ropa y tener más variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cruz is a cheerful and charming member of the Zhullin communal bank. She lives in the Tomebamba area of the the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of the province of Azuay, located in the southern part of Ecuador's Andean cordillera. Its historical center was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO, in the year 1999.
 
Cruz is 50 years old, married and has three adult children who are adults and married. Two live independently, and one still lives in their home and shares the household expenses. Her husband is a driver by profession and works driving a taxi. The house where they live is rented.

Cruz started her business with the first loan she received. She sells clothing at her own shop that she has in the city's market. She also makes and sells jellies; work that she likes very much, and she has been in this business for 23 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday with no fixed hours.

Her loan is to buy clothing and plastic cups for her jellies.

Her goal is to expand her clothing business and have more variety for her customers.

loans.use: To buy clothing and plastic cups for her jellies.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está conformado por 8 mujeres que viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que es la capital de la provincia del Azuay. Está situado en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana. Su Centro Histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999. 
Todas sus socias son mujeres que se dedican a diferentes trabajos que les dan la oportunidad de aportar a la economía de sus hogares y darles un mejor futuro a sus familias. A pesar de sus dificultades diarias son personas que mantienen su buen sentido del humor, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Melva, tiene 39 años de edad, es una mujer casada que en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio, su primera hija ya es casada y vive independiente. Su esposo es comerciante de varios productos, la casa en la que vive es la recompensa de todo el trabajo conyugal.

Doña es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender comida actividad que la desempeña dos veces a la semana sin un horario fijo, también cría y vende pollos y cuyes, y los días que pasa en casa cultiva hortalizas que solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vajilla, pollos y cuyes para continuar con estas actividades.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Nuevas Amigas" communal bank is made up of eight women who live in different places in the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of the province of Azuay, and is located in the southern part of Ecuador's Andean cordillera. Its historical center was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO, in the year 1999.

All the members are women who work in different businesses that give them the opportunity to contribute to their household finances and give their families a better future. In spite of their daily difficulties they are people who keep a good sense of humor and still maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Melva. She is 39 years old, married and has three children ages 19, 17 and 15. Her two eldest children go to school, and her eldest daughter is already married and lives independently. Her husband is a merchant and sells various products. The house where they live is the reward for all the work they have done as a couple.

Melva is an enterprising woman who has sold food for four years, work that she does twice a week, without fixed hours. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs, and on the days she spends at home, grows vegetables which are only for her household's consumption.
 
She is going to use her new loan to buy crockery, chickens and guinea pigs, so that she can continue with these activities.

Her dream is to not have debts.

loans.use: Comprar una vajilla, pollos y cuyes.

loans.name: Jenny Johanna

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  8 años  de edad y estudia en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. Ella estudia para Lic. en enfermería en la universidad de Manta.

La señora Jenny es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de ventases puerta a puerta,  trabaja tres días a la semana por su casa aunque todos los días lleva para vender a sus compañeras en la universidad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, es gracias a su negocio que ella puede salir adelante con sus estudios y pensar en un mejor porvenir.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo ya que en esta época vende bastante. Lleva más de tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank of 'United Mothers' meet every 15 days in Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of local products including, for example, hats made of straw and shawls that are known inside and outside of the country.

Jenny lives in this place. She is 24 years old, is married and from this relationship she has an eight year old son and she studies in school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. She is studying for a nursing license in the University of Manta. 

Jenny is a homemaker who works selling clothing by catalogue and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women) in order to obtain her own earnings. Her method of salesis door to door. She works three days a week from her home, although every day she is prepared to sell to her classmates in the University. She sells her products on credit and she charges payments each week or every fifteen days. She has worked doing this activity for three years and it goes very well. Thanks to her business she can get ahead in her studies and focus on a better future.

This loan is for buying perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothes now that at this time she sells so much. She has spent more than three years in the Communal Bank and she likes it because it helps her to get ahead. 

Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Eufemia, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 18, 15 y 9 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  el menor en escuela. Su esposo es electricista.

Doña Eufemia es una muy buena ama de casa que para conseguir sus propios recursos y con estos ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja tres días más que todo por las mañanas y en las noches ya que a esa hora encuentra a todos sus clientes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra por semanas. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo en un lugar que encuentra buena mercadería y a buen precio.  Lo que más vende es la ropa de mujer, ella lleva más de 10 años con un negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  más de 16 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products such as the Montecristi (or better known as Panama) Hat made of woven straw, which is known throughout the country and internationally, the members of the communal bank "Madres Unidas" meet every 15 days.

This is the place where Eufemia, 44, lives.  She is married and together with her husband has 3 children aged 18, 15, and 9 years.  The two oldest are in high school, and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is an electrician.

Eufemia is a very good housewife who, in order to generate her own resources and help her husband with the household expenses, also has a business selling all types of clothing.  She works 3 days a week, mostly in the mornings and in the evenings, because these are the times when she can find her customers.  She sells door-to-door and through orders.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  Eufemia buys her merchandise in Portoviejo, at a place that has very good products and good prices.   She mostly sells women's clothing.  She has had this business for more than 10 years, and it is doing very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been with her communal bank for more than 16 years and she likes it, because with the loans she started her own business.

Eufemia's dream is to see her children finish their education and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Rosa Bertilda

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo ya no trabaja por su edad.

Doña Rosa tiene un taller en su casa en el cual elabora figuras hechas con paja toquilla,  junto a su marido elaboran muchos diseños los mismos que luego los entregan a comerciantes que los llevan a otras ciudades donde los comercializan a muy buen precio ya que sus productos son típicos y de buena calidad, ella lleva más de 30 años dedicada a esta actividad, la misma que aprendió de sus padres y que gracias a esto ha podido salir adelante junto a sus familia.

Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla, pinturas y otros materiales para elaborar sus productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en todos estos años que está en el grupo. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante hasta que Dios así lo quiera.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products that are well-known nationally and internationally, such as the Montecristi (Panama) Hats that are made of woven straw.

 Rosa lives here. She is 55 years old and is married.  She and her husband have 5 children who are all grown and are independent.  Her husband no longer works due to his age.

Rosa has a workshop in her house where she makes figurines made of woven straw.  She and her husband make these figures in many designs that they later deliver to merchants who take them to other cities to sell at a very good price, because her products are traditional and are of good quality. Rosa has been doing this kind of work for more than 30 years; she learned this trade from her parents.  Thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead with her family.

Rosa will use this loan to buy straw, paint and other supplies to make her products.  She has been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help that has been provided to her over all of the years that she's been with the group.

Rosa's dream is to continue to move forward, God willing.

loans.use: to buy straw, paint and other supplies

loans.name: Jessenia Marilyn

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 11 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian el mayor en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Jessenia tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende pollos a la brasa, jugos, sodas entre otras cosas, trabaja de viernes a domingo en este negocio,  pero los otros días también por las tardes vende panes de almidón y el delicioso morocho, bebida muy deliciosa que es muy consumida por sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 16h00 hasta las 21h00, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando pueden y están desocupados. Lleva más de 11 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien, es así como ella obtiene lo necesario para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pollos, sodas, aliños y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Lleva más de 2 años en el Banco Comunal y  le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In “Los Bajos de Montecristi,” a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as, for example, the straw hats (Panama hats) well-known known inside and outside of the country, the members of the communal bank “Madres Unidas” (United Mothers) meet every fifteen days.

In this place lives Jessenia who is 33 years old and married. From this relationship they have three children ages 13, 11 and 7 who are students, the oldest in secondary school and the two youngest in primary school.  Her husband works in a factory in Manta.

Jessenia has a business in her home in which she sells barbecued chicken, juices and sodas among other things.  She works from Friday to Sunday in this business but the other days in the afternoons she also sells yucca-starch bread and the delicious “morocho,” a very delicious drink (made from a kind of dense corn) that is much consumed by her customers.  She works every day from 4:00 pm until 9:00pm.  Her children and her husband help her in her work when they can and are unoccupied.  She has dedicated more than 11 years to this activity and it is going very well for her.  This is how she obtains what is necessary to give her children a good education.

She is going to use this loan to purchase chicken, sodas, seasonings and other necessary provisions to prepare food.  She has been with the communal bank for more than 2 years and she likes the help that they give her with the loans.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sodas, seasonings and other provisions.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 16 y 12 de edad, ambas estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

La señora Maritza se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sandalias y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, sus ventas siempre son muy buenas ya que les da  facilidades en los  pagos, ella deja a crédito y les cobra por semanas o quincenas. También junto a su esposo tienen a cargo el bar en un colegio de la localidad, allí venden muchos bocadillos preparados por ella que son muy saludables como empanadas, sanduches, corviches, además de jugos y batidos de frutas entre otras cosas. Lleva más de 9 años dedicada a ambas actividades y es así como ellos luchan para que  a sus hijos nunca les falte nada. 

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sandalias y bisutería ya que se viene el tiempo de fiestas y es cuando más vende. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan en el mismo.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local para vender sus productos y un restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor meets every fortnight in the canton Veinticuatro de Mayo in the province of Manabí, which is known for its beautiful countryside, its forests, and the variety of its fauna, as well as for the kind and hard-working inhabitants who make a living from agriculture and farming.
 
It is here that Maritza lives. She is 33 years old and married. From her marriage she has two daughters, of 16 and 12 years of age, who are studying at school. Her husband is a merchant.

Maritza makes a living by selling clothes of all types, sandals, and costume jewelry. She sells door-to-door or in her house, to which her most regular customers come. Her sales are always very high since she has credit facilties; she lets her customers have the sale on credit and they pay if off weekly or fortnightly. She also runs a bar with her husband in the locality's school, where they sell a lot of very healthy food prepared by Maritza, such as pies, sandwiches, and corviches (fish encased in green banana mixture and fried), as well as juices and smoothies, among other things. She has dedicated more than nine years to both of these activities, and it is how she and her husband ensure that their children lack nothing. 

This loan is for buying clothes, sandals, and costume jewelry. The party season is coming and it is when she makes the most sales. She has been in the credit group for seven years and she likes it because of the help it gives to her.
 
Her dreams are to have a place to sell her products and to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Dellanira Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Dellanira, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos  ellos ya  mayores de edad, sus dos últimas hijas aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Dallarina es una muy buena esposa que al ver que su esposo hace lo posible por darles todo y al ver que hay días que él no tiene trabajo y no le alcanza para mantener el hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y  de  productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer por donde tiene sus clientes aunque sus hijas también le ayudan con sus ventas, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lo que más venden son los perfumes y los cosméticos, lleva más de cinco años con su negocio y es así como ella está ayudando más que todo para los estudios de sus hijas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa ya que esta época del año es cuando más vende. Lleva  10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta  por la ayuda que le han dado ya que con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijas sean profesionales y que tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank meets every two weeks in the “24 de Mayo” settlement, located in the Manabí province, known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, variety of fauna, and for its friendly, hardworking people.

Dellanira lives here.  She’s 46 years old, married, and has four adult children.  The two youngest still live in her home and attend university.  Her husband works as a mason.

Dallarina is a very good wife, who upon seeing that her husband does whatever possible to give them everything and after seeing that there were days when he didn’t have any work and or enough money to support the household, she decided to begin selling clothing and Avon products (beauty products, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week and sells door to door, going out to where her customers are.  Her daughters also help her with her sales.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  She mostly sells the perfumes and cosmetics, has been doing this for more than five years, and this is how she is helping, above all, to provide her children’s education.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and seasonal clothing.  It’s during this end of the year time that her sales are best.  She has been with the communal bank for ten years and she likes the assistance, especially since her business began with one of the loans.

Her dreams are to see her daughters become professionals and for them to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dolores María

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 

En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella con sus familias. Su esposo  comerciante.

Doña Dolores se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas, toldos y semijoyas,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en la casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan algo, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días, razón por la cual tienen mucha clientela. Su mercadería la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Lleva más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y sabanas que es lo que más vende en esta época del año. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos compra más barato y le quedan más ganancias. 

Su sueño es crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank meets every two weeks in the “24 de Mayo” settlement, located in the Manabí province, known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, variety of fauna, and for its friendly, hardworking people dedicated to farming and livestock.

Dolores lives here.  She’s 58 years old, married, and has three minor children.  Two of them live with her along with their families.  Her husband is a merchant.

Dolores sells all types of clothing, sheets, hoods, and costume jewelry door to door and also from her home where customers visit her whenever they need something.  She sells on credit and collects every week.  This is why she has so many customers.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month depending on what she needs.  She has been doing this for more than 12 years and, thanks to God, things have been going very well for her.
 
She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and sheets because it’s what she mostly sells this time of year.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes the fact that she can buy merchandise at better prices and increase her revenue thanks to the loans.

Her dream is to grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sheets.

loans.name: Angelica Liliana

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. Aquí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 

En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 37 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos de 16 y 13 años que estudian en el colegio. 

Doña Angelica para  salir adelante sola y para que a  sus hijos nunca les faltara nada se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos y productos Avon, Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios de damas), su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local y hasta  donde sus clientes en su mayoría la visitan para hacerle sus pedidos y sus compras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, deja a crédito y también al contado. Sus productos le envía su hermana desde Guayaquil, lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad la misma que le permite salir adelante  sola con sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar: ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes y accesorios de damas. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha mejorado su situación económica. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The canton 24 De Mayo, of Manabí Province, is known for its beautiful landscapes and forests, its variety of fauna and its hardworking people.  The people make their livings in agriculture and raising animals.  It is here that the communal bank "Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor." (Mothers for a Better Future) meets every two weeks.

This is where we find Señora Angélica.  She is 37 years old and divorced.  She had two children from her marriage.  They are 16 and 13 years old, and go to school.  

In order to get ahead and ensure that her children have everything they need, doña Angelica went into business selling clothing, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She sells door to door and also from her home, where she has a small shop set up.  Most of her customers come to her home to make their orders and purchases.  Doña Angelica works every day from 8:30am - 4:00pm.  She sells on credit and also on cash sales.  Her sister sends her the products from Guayaquil.  Doña Angelica has made her living in this business for more than ten years, and it has allowed her to get ahead, and raise her children alone. 

This loan is for the purchase of clothing, shoes, lotions, perfumes and ladies' accessories.  Doña Angelica has been a member of her communal bank for four years, and she likes it because the loans have improved her financial situation. 

Doña Angelica's dream is to give her children all the best.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, lotions, perfumes and ladies' accessories.

loans.name: Patricia Evangelina

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene  52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad  y dos de 17 y 15 años de edad, una estudia en colegio y el menor no estudia porque, es discapacitado. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella hace varios años atrás aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad y hoy tiene un salón de belleza en el cual realiza muchos trabajos como  tinturados, cortes de cabello, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Además en su negocio tiene dos vitrinas en las que tiene ropa y productos Sayson y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) para la venta que realza al mismo tiempo que realiza sus  trabajos, ya son más de 15 años que lleva en su negocio por lo cual tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por el buen trabajo que realiza.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar ropa, tintes, permanentes y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es que su hijo tenga buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank meets every two weeks in the “24 de Mayo” settlement, located in the Manabí province, known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, variety of fauna, and for its friendly, hardworking people dedicated to farming and livestock.


Patricia lives here.  She is 52 years old, married, and has three children; one adult and two others, aged 17 and 15.  One attends school and the other doesn’t go to school because he’s handicapped.  Her husband is a driver.

She learned to be a beautician a few years ago at a local beauty academy and now she has a salon where she does things like tints, cuts, and manicures among other things.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later if her customers need her services.  Aside from this business she also has two display cases where she sells clothing and Sayson and Lebel brand products (beauty products, cosmetic, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories) which she can sell at the same time that she does her other work.  She’s been doing this for 15 years and has many customers who prefer her because of the good work she does.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, tints, permanents, and cosmetics.  She has been with the communal bank for five years and likes being able to get loans.

Her dream is for her son to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Petita

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 

En este lugar vive la señora Petita, tiene 81 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 13 hijos, cuatro de ellos fallecieron y los otros ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Petita para ayudar a su esposo el cual ya está muy anciano se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo para lo cual tiene un local en su casa en el  que trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de una de sus hijas. Su mercadería  la recibe desde los Estado Unidos ya que una amiga le envía todo tipo de mercadería o si no la comprar a Santo Domingo, lleva con su negocio ya por 10 años y  siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños y ropa interior.  Ella está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque siempre le han brindado gran ayuda con los creditos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank meets every two weeks in the “24 de Mayo” settlement, located in the Manabí province, known for its beautiful landscape, its forests, variety of fauna, and for its friendly, hardworking people dedicated to farming and livestock.

Petita lives here.  She is 81 years old, married, and had 13 children.  Four of them passed away and the others are adults, two of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Petita, in order to help her husband who is very elderly, sells clothing of all types and has a shop in her home.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00 pm and one of her daughter helps her.  She receives her merchandise from the United States and a friend ships her all types of items.  If not, she buys in Santo Domingo.  She’s been doing this for 10 years and things are going well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, and undergarments.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and likes being able to get loans.

Her dream is to have a great shop.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Graciela es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Graciela tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelará la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Graciela, who is 64 years old, lives with her life companion and their children in their own house. She has a store where she sells basic products, such as beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other items. She has had her business for many years, and this has given her experience in sales that allows her to obtain the best earnings. Her store is located in her home, in a very busy area. This has given her a lot of customers. People prefer her because she always has what they need, with quality products, affordable prices, and unequaled service. She is always at the command of the customers. Graciela is a woman dedicated to her work, energetic, and with many goals for the future. Her greatest secret for achieving success is perseverance and love of work. She knows that only this way will she achieve what she desires. Like every good businesswoman, she wants to increase her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. For this reason, she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy basic foodstuffs, candies, eggs, bread, beverages, etc. Graciela has good payment references. She confirms that she will repay the debt and at the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic foods, candies, eggs, breads, and beverages

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is happily married and blessed with six children. According to him, all of his children attend school and he needs to redouble his efforts to send them to higher education. Rogelia works as a farmer and he raises livestock. He cultivates a half-hectare of rice and is currently fattening four hogs. He has borrowed previously and is thankful to lenders because he is able to run his livestock business well.

Rogelio is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy livestock and maintain his rice field. In the future, he hopes to increase his profit and improve his financial stability to be able to have comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock and maintain his rice field

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
For more than 10 years, Bibiana has been in business planting and harvesting rice to sell. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 per harvest twice a year and uses her income for school expenses, meals and bills at home. Bibiana and her husband patiently work to gain a plentiful harvest from their rice field. Bibiana has four children. 

Bibiana would like to keep improving their farming practices. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides to help ensure healthy crops for a productive harvest soon. In the future, the couple would like to become successful rice growers in their village and uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessenia del Carmen,  es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:00 am  inicia a las 5:45am a distribuir su producto a las demás comerciante, finalizando a las 4:00 pm, compra su mercadería a proveedores que la visitan en su puesto de venta. Ella es madre de un   hijo  de 3 años de edad, realiza este tipo de trabajo para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

Inicio su negocio de forma ambulante con venta de bolsas plásticas  en pequeña cantidad actualmente vende productos desechable  en un puesto fijo y realiza esta labor desde hace 5  años.

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de bolsas plásticas, pajillas,  platos, tazas, cucharas desechables, lo que le ha  Permitido  atraer más clientela e incrementando las ventas y ganancias para una mejorar su negocio

Los sueños de la Joven  son de lograr a tener su propia vivienda ya que habita en casa familiar.
texts.en:
The young Yessania del Carmen works in one of the markets in the city of León. She leaves her house at 5am and starts distributing products to other sellers at 5:45. She finishes at 4pm and buys her stock from suppliers who visit her at her stall. She is mother to a 3 year old boy and does this type of work to help her husband with household costs. 

She started her business by selling plastic bags in small quantities on a mobile basis. Now she has been selling disposable products in a permanent stall for the last 5 years.   

She will use the loan that she is requesting from Ceprodel to buy plastic bags, straws, plates, cups and disposable spoons which has attracted more clients. It has also increased her sales and profits which have improved her business.

Her dream is to manage to have her own home as she lives with her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, straws, plates, cups and disposable spoons which has attracted more clients

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es: Uldarico es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Uldarico se dedica a la elaboración de y comercialización de prendas de vestir y accesorios para la decoración del hogar como cortinas, forros de cojines para muebles etc.. Uldarico en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para compara materiales como telas, tapicería, hilos y accesorios para la elaboracion de sus productos. Uldarico está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse  y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en: Uldarico is a member of the communal bank "QORICHUSPAS” in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He has a business making and selling garments and decorative home accessories, such as curtains, cushion covers for furniture, etc.  At this time, Uldarico is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as: fabric, upholstery supplies, thread, and other supplies to make his products.  Uldarico is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cloth, tapestries, thread, and accessories

loans.name: Margort

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion como yeso,cemento y clavos,als ocia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el credito para comprar yeso,cemento y clavos.

La socia  se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
She continues to sell construction supplies, such as plaster, cement and nails. She has been in this business for 9 years, working from 8am to 7pm and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to expand her business selling construction materials so she is requesting the loan to buy plaster, cement and nails. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through these means, and promises to comply with the corresponding repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase plaster, cement and nails.

loans.name: Los Pinos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS PINOS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teofila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: macramé de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de cereal, tejido de cama, venta de polainas y gorros, venta de álbum de fotografía, macramé en cola de rata.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Teofila es parte integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que la visitó en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de tienda de barrio, que instaló por requerimiento de sus vecinos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de refrescos) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Pinos" will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. It is made up of eight members and a directing board of which Teofila is the president. The members' businesses are varied. Among them are: macramé blankets, a grocery store, grain sales, woven bed linens, chaps and hat sales, photo album sales, and macramé with rattail cord. The loan that they will take out will help micro-business owners  with different businesses. Teofila is a member. She says that this is the third year that she has been part of Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her in her home.

Currently, she has two businesses, which are neighborhood stores. She started them at her neighbors' request. The loan that she will take out is to increase capital (purchase of soft drinks) that she will get from the distributing stores around the city of El Alto. Later, she will sell them in her place of sale. This kind of work allows her to earn money to support her home as much as possible, since she lives in a common law marriage and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 27 años de edad, es acompañada y tiene un hijo. Es una joven emprendedora, que desde su infancia a trabajado muy fuerte junto con su abuela realizando los quehaceres del hogar; ya que su mamá falleció cuando era una niña. Por eso creció con sus abuelos quienes la apoyaron. Ella estudio un curso de corte y confección en la comunidad donde reside, a los 23 años se acompaño con su pareja y procreo un hijo. A pesar de ya tener su familia, ella continuo sus estudios y el año pasado se graduó de bachiller. Ella ejerce la sastrería, elabora pantalones, camisas y faldas; además elabora los uniformes escolares para unas escuelas.

Todos los insumos que necesita como botones, hilos, sippers, entre otros, los compra en una ciudad, tarda en llegar una media hora y las realiza en compañía de su pequeño hijo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una maquina de coser estilo rana, otras dos maquinas de coser normales e insumos para la sastrería. Con la inversión podrá contratar a más personal, ya que la demanda es bastante grande y obtendría mejores ingresos económicos. Entre sus planes esta el poseer un taller de costureria mejor estableció, para trabajar en mejores condiciones y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old. She has a partner and a son. She is a young entrepreneur who since childhood has worked very hard along with her grandmother doing the household chores as her mother died when she was a young girl. This is why she grew up with her grandparents supporting her.

She attended a dressmaking course in the community where she lives. When she was 23 years old she joined with her partner and they had a son. Despite having her family she continued her studies and last year she graduated from high school.

She has a tailor’s shop making pants, shirts and skirts. She also makes school uniforms for some schools. All the supplies that she needs such as buttons, thread, zippers, among others, she buys in a city, a half hour trip and her young son accompanies her.

The loan that she is asking for through Fundación is in order to buy a zig zag sewing machine, two ordinary sewing machines and dressmaking supplies.

With the investment she will be able to hire more staff as the demand is quite large and she could get more income. Among her plans is to have a better established tailor’s shop, to work in better conditions, and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy a zig zag sewing machine, two ordinary sewing machines, and dressmaking supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, a elaborar hamacas, tapetes, cortinas, gorros, entres otros sus padres le enseñaron ha trabajar con las artesanías; además vende ropa desde hace dos años, ella junto con su esposo salen a vender los días martes, viernes y sábados a los pueblos aledaños. También, Rosa trabajo en la venta de tortillas y minutas, siempre ha tenido que trabajar para salir adelante con su familia. Su esposo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fríjol y hortalizas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 50 libras de hilo de seda para hilar hamacas, 45 libras de hilo para elaborar los manquillos y el resto para comprar ropa de niño, damas y caballeros ya que en esta época es en donde se tiene más demanda. Con la inversión, podrá disponer de todo el material que necesita para elaborar las hamacas y para vender la ropa para que sus ingresos sean mejores.  Entre sus planes esta el construir una casa más digna.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, is married and has two children. She makes a living doing domestic duties in her home, making hammocks, rugs, curtains, hats, and other things. Her parents taught her to work with crafts. She has also been selling clothing for two years. She and her husband go out to sell items on Tuesdays, Fridays and Saturdays in the surrounding towns.

Rosa also worked in the sales of tortillas and shaved ice snacks. She has always had to work to move forward with her family. Her husband makes a living cultivating corn, beans and vegetables.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 50 pounds of silk thread to sew hammocks, 45 pounds of thread to make hammock handles, and the rest to buy children's, women's and men's clothing since this is the period when she has the most demand.

With this investment, she can have all the material available that she needs to make hammocks and sell clothing so that her income is better. Among her plans is to build a more dignified house.

loans.use: to buy 50 pounds of silk thread to sew hammocks, 45 pounds of thread to make hammock handles, and the rest to buy children's, women's and men's clothing since this is the period when she has the most demand

loans.name: Luscinda

texts.es:
La señora Luscinda tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, pero todos ellos han formado su propia familia. Ella tiene más de 30 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de enchiladas, tostadas de plátano y de yuca, lo más popular que ella vende son los famosos pasteles de chucho que así le llaman, están elaborados de relleno de papa, ejotes, arroz. Estos productos los comercializan en un mercado de la ciudad, atiende de 2:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m., también vende café y chocolate. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus familiares ya que ellos se dedicaban a esta misma actividad. De esta manera Luscinda les brindo educación a sus hijos. Los materiales para la elaboración de sus alimentos, como lo son repollos, maíz, yuca, guineo verde, aceite, entre otros. Los compra en el mercado central de la ciudad que esta ubicado a medio kilómetro de donde ella vive.
